Eat at the Breakfast Bar, the Dining Room or the Outside Table along the Generous Wrap-Around Patio. Community Pool & Gas BBQ's & Private Membersh
neighborhood_overview: Located in the Heart of Princeville and Minutes away from Tropical Destination Beaches
notes: Please keep the WINDOWS & SLIDING GLASS DOOR *CLOSED* when not inside of the condo. Unexpected Tropical STORMS can cause DAMAGE to the interior. Thank You!! Second Level Condo Corner Location, set atop the Bluff with direct access to the Condo. NO STAIRS.
transit: Rental Car is HIGHLY Recommended
access: Community Pool & Gas BBQ's & Private Membership to Makai Tennis Club in Princeville
interaction: We are Available and Ready to assist with any unforeseen maintenance issues. We do manage multiple properties so when reaching out to us, PLEASE let us know what Location and Unit Number you are staying in.  We welcome your questions prior to or during your stay. We want your stay to be most enjoyable. We are onsite and ready to assist at anytime. It's our sincere pleasure!
house_rules: Strict...  Please be Mindful of our Condo.  The bedding is White Silk & Couches White  NO SMOKING inside or on balcony NO EATING in the BEDS No CANDLES whatsoever NO SHOES WORN INSIDE (Hawaiian Custom) Quiet Time:    9pm to 9am  Upon Check Out all trash and open food items are to be thrown in the outside dumpster.   No shoes worn inside the condo (Hawaiian Custom) In the event there is Excessive use or Damage to the Condo, your security deposit WILL BE RETAINED.  Bed linens & towels will be washed by our housekeeper. Please just throw out any trash or open food items. Great efforts are made to be sure the condo is in excellent condition for your stay. In the event an unforeseen item need to be repaired or replaced CALL US. We are onsite and ready to assist to ensure your stay is most enjoyable. Thank you!

host.host_about:
Aloha...! 

We have a lot of Gratitude for living on the Beautiful Island of Kauai. 

We Embrace the Diversity of our Global Community. We Warmly Welcome travelers from All parts of the World and All walks of Life. Our goal is for your stay to be Most Enjoyable!  

We welcome your questions and would be Delighted to Host Your Stay.  

With gratitude, 
Shana & Jeff

reviews.comments:
Jeff and Shana were very easy to get in touch with, even though we landed late it was extremely easy to get into the condo.  The condo was perfect for us, the master bedroom looks out over the ocean and you can actually hear the waves crash- makes for the best sleep!
Princeville where the condo is located is a lovely community in Kuai.

The best part of this listing is the view from the master bed. You get to have an unobstructed view of the ocean every morning when you wake up! Although this is a condo in a neighborhood full of condos, the views from the balcony and bedroom are amazing. 

Great location. Loved the north shore. 

Everything we needed was provided, even beach gear such as boogie boards, beach chairs, umbrella, etc.

Best AirBnB experience ever!! The condo is perfect, really comfortable and clean, beautifully decorated. The view is amazing, the sound of the waves had us sleeping so well every night. There's an abundance of beach and bath towels, which really came in handy. Also, there's boogie boards, coolers, and beach chairs to use. It's really close to the town of Hanalei, where we spent most of our time. We loved every moment of our stay, it was so relaxing. We did buy two more fans, which we left at the condo, just to help with a little more air flow, but it doesn't get very hot at night really. We hope the next guests enjoy them! We would definitely stay here again. Thank you again Jeff and Shana for everything!
What a view! You can just sit in the lanai all day to soak it in. Jeff and Shana went out of the way to make it a very comfortable stay. We enjoyed everything this home and Kauai had to offer.

Our family was very pleased with the condo. Great view, right over the surf!   We felt quite comfortable with everything - the photos don't do justice to the size of the unit.  It is much more spacious than we expected.  Lots of beach chairs, boards, toys and carry bags!  We simply put our clothes away started playing and relaxing.  Thank you Jeff & Shana - good job.

We had the most wonderful experience in this beautiful condo. Beautifully furnished and so comfortable with everything we needed. We will never forget the world's most beautiful views from the patio. 

Just a short drive away is the special town of Hanalei with great restaurants and beautiful beaches. A shopping center with groceries and cafes is just a mile away at Princeville Center.

We loved the condo! We were so sad to leave and are already planning to return.

We had a great time in the condo, it was well equipped for everything we needed and the location is really good for exploring the north shore.

The views are fantastic and everything is generally great. The beach stuff was really useful, renting or buying chairs etc. for a week is always so wasteful.

Some small things could do with some maintenance, like many of the window blinds don't work but that wasn't a real issue!

We had a wonderful trip at this rental! Large living room, fully equipped kitchen, two bathrooms, a balcony, and of course the ocean view & sounds. Couldn't have asked for much more!

Check-in was extremely easy (just involved punching the code into the door and turning the handle :-). We had no contact with Jeff & Shana during our stay--but only because we had no issues! However they were there for us if we needed them and provided very helpful info prior to our check-in to make sure we had all the right info. 

Princeville itself is basically a collection of resorts surrounded by a golf course, so really not walking distance to many bars/shops, but you can take a nice stroll around the course and down to a beach if you're ambitious. There is a shopping center at the end of the road and the quaint, laid-back hamlet of Hanalei is a short drive away, so you're not really isolated, just know that you'll need a car if you stay here. 

We enjoyed drinks at nearby Tiki Iniki bar, dinner at Postcards cafe, and of course you'll find yourself at Hanalei Coffee & Bread company more than a few times if you stay here as it's practically the only coffeehouse in town :-). But good cappucino's and fresh bread on a tropical island - which is better than we were expecting!

Jeff & Shana ~ thank you for making sure we had a memorable & comfortable stay!

Jeff & Shana's place was BEAUTIFUL! The ocean views are wonderful and everything in the house was clean. The instructions sent to us answered any questions we could have had and were helpful when (Hidden by Airbnb) Maps tried to navigate us to the wrong location. A huge bonus was all of the equipment in the house to use (beach, grilling, kitchen, etc). Check-in and check-out was a breeze and we highly recommend booking this place if available.

This place is absolutely perfect and I'm so glad we booked it for our stay in Kauai! The location is great in Princeville and close to a shopping center for groceries as well as a short drive to some beautiful beaches. The place itself was perfect for two couples and had everything we needed to make all of our meals (blender, pots, pants, dishes, microwave, coffee maker). You'll just want to note that the kitchen doesn't have basics for cooking like oil, spices, etc. so definitely purchase some of those if you plan on cooking meals. Other than that, I don't think we could have asked for a better stay. Enjoying our coffee on the balcony every morning was truly wonderful.

Great communications and lots of useful information provided prior to our trip.  The apartment presents exactly as it looks in the photos.  The kitchen was well stocked and there was even beach chairs and some snorkel gear which we really appreciated the use of.
For us the location was perfect and we absolutely loved sitting out on the balcony and enjoying the stunning view with a wine in hand!

We had a great experience with our stay in Princeville.  The condo is exactly as described.  From both the main bedroom and guest room, you have a beautiful view of the ocean.  You are no more than a five minute drive to Queens Bath or a 15-20 minute walk.  If you are going to drive, get there early.  The earlier the better to avoid the large afternoon crowds.  You are a 5 minute drive to the beautiful St. Regis Hotel and a 10 minute drive to the great down of Hanalei. 

The condo is clean and very convenient to many Kauai destinations. 

I would definitely recommend a stay at this Kauai location.

Kauai is absolutely stunning and Ocean Bluff Retreat was a good home base to experience it all. We were able to see most of the island, and by far, Hanalei Bay was our favorite beach area. It's really a magical place. Being a short drive away was very fun. Princeville is a great place to find condos like the Ocean Bluff Retreat, but as it is structurally very residential, we did miss being able to walk out directly onto a beach. It only took a day or so to get over that though, as there are so many stunning beaches just a short drive away.

Jeff and Shana truly care about their guests. The only issue we ran into was that one grill area did not work and one was out of gas, but there were directions on who to call to have it addressed. 

Our favorite part of the condo was the Lanai. The greenery and the ocean views are spectacular, and we really enjoyed having our coffee out there every morning.

We had a wonderful time at the condo. Great location and truly amazing views- all we saw was ocean from the master bed. Very comfortable beds, and everything we needed at the condo. We had most meals at home. Also very clean. 

The nice (vey large) pool was a bonus and the kids loved it.  We had it pretty much to ourselves even though we stayed there in the busy summer season. 

We definitely recommend to others. Thanks Jeff and Shana!

Nous avons passé 1 semaine très agréable dans un appartement  bien agencé et très propre avec une vue incroyable sur l'océan! Les informations précises de Jeff et Shana ont été appréciables pour arriver à destination. Nous avons aimé la piscine, juste à quelques pas de l'appartement et nous recommandons le restaurant Postcard Café. 
Mahalo!!!

Our family of three had a wonderful time in Princeville, thanks in large part to this condo. It comes equipped with all that you need - from a well-stocked kitchen to beach toys and chairs. The views are also breathtaking!

The only "downside" to the stay was the heat factor as the condo does not have A/C. (But then again, we willingly traveled in July!) That said, the ceiling fans in every room and portable fans in the bedrooms certainly help make a difference. 

All in all, it's was a memorable and wonderful stay! We would definitely come back.

This home is wonderfully located in the town of Princeville Kauai.  The condo had a spectacular view of the pacific ocean!!! It was very clean and had everything a family would need for a comfortable stay.  Very close to beautiful beaches and other attractions!!!
Location was perfect, view awsome. Just loved it.

The place was as advertised with a fantastic view and balcony. The layout was great with great kitchen
That had everything I could need.

This is a second floor condo with bedrooms and Lanai that offer incredible views of the ocean. The sounds of the surf will lull you to sleep and chirping birds will wake you in the morning. Everything you could possible need was in the unit, so no stress about needing something. If you really need to watch TV, basic cable is furnished (along with local music CD's and loads of books). Comfortably furnished, clean, quiet. 5 minutes to shopping and 10 minutes to nightlife and restaurants. If you are going to stay on the North Shore, this is a great place to be!

Great place with awesome sights and sounds.  We loved the view out of the master bedroom and listening to the waves as we fell asleep at night.  Princeville area was great, close to cool places like Queen's bath and good shops/restaurants.  We would definitely stay here again!
Such a great stay. Would love to stay here again in the future!

We absolutely loved our stay here on Kauai! This place was perfect for us located in Princeville, close to Hanalei and the Napali coast hiking. 
The views from the bedroom are absolutely as advertised - we woke up to the sound of waves every morning. The bathrooms and kitchen have obviously been recently re-modeled and the kitchen is well stocked with pots, pans, etc for cooking. The grounds are beautiful and quiet, and the pool is a great bonus!
Our interactions with Jeff and Shana were limited, but they were very nice and even mailed something we forgot after we left.

Perfect location in Princeville overlooking the ocean.  Clean, well equipped kitchen.  Long walk to the beach, but worth it.  Short treacherous hike down the cliff to a cave with turtles.  Very nice condo that we would definitely like to stay in again.

Jeff and Shana‘s place has amazing ocean views, everything in the apartment is of high quality. It is perfectly equipped, so that you find everything you need. And their communication was always prompt and very friendly. We would definitely come back.

My friends and I had a very pleasant stay at Jeff & Shana’s place. Check in was super easy (door code), and the place was nice and cozy :) the balcony view was to die for!!!! Also, waking up to the sound of the ocean was so beautiful. The location worked great for the activities we had planned for the week. I def recommend having a car rental if staying in the north shore. One thing to note: the place does not have AC but during our May travel -temperatures weren’t hot at night. There are fans in every room so that helped. I also appreciated that the place came with a good amount of towels. I would def stay here again.

We did not go all the way to Kauai to spend all the time in a condo but it was nice to have coffee or drinks on the patio overlooking the Pacific. 

The description is very accurate. Everything is clean and functional and there was sufficient space for a family of 4 to sleep, cook a meal and relax

Graf place , loved the kitchen !! Like at home fully accessed! Knife really cuts ! They also have ice packs so we were able to take our cooler bag with us! 
The sound of the ocean is amazing  
In overall is a great place if you want nice quiet place !

Our requirements for a Princeville condo were;  spectacular ocean view, clean and updated accommodations and outdoor space.   Jeff and Shana's place easily met all of our requirements.  The view is splendid, the interior space is warm and relaxing and the outdoor spaces were beautiful.  We really enjoyed the pool area which seemed to be only used by us. There were zero problems or complaints with the unit.
Amazing place with a breathtaking view! Condo was as described, very clean and a great place to stay in Princeville.! Thank you for a wonderful stay.!!!

Hard to go wrong here, the place is gorgeous! Much more spacious than we envisioned. Check-in was great and Shana was very responsive to our communications. Great location near lots of places that tourists would want to go. Magnificent views throughout, and a roaring ocean to lull you to sleep every night. The hosts provided some great information about the local area.

Our only gripe -- and it is a small one even though the paragraph is long -- was that we thought the cleaning fee was excessive (about 13% of the cost of the rental) considering we were still asked to put all the dishes in the dishwasher and run it, gather together all the trash and take it outside, and clean out the refrigerator before we left. Happy to do those things, but we collectively felt like we shouldn't have to pay a cleaning staff $135 when we are doing all those things for them. 

As far as the place and the hosts go, however, completely top shelf. A wonderful experience and we'd be happy to be back.
Jeff and Shana’s place is absolutely adorable. Truly stunning views and the decor fits with the Kauai atmosphere. And it’s impeccably clean! We will definitely be back.

The view from this condo is amazing, slept with the waves crashing on the rocks! Location is very convenient to shops, view, trails. Condo is a little dated with small bathrooms but it is clean, fully equipped kitchen and location is great. Kauai was our favorite island and north shore is spectacular. Free tennis access was nice.

Homely apartment with nice view of ocean from balcony in living room and through windows in both master and second bedroom. 

Very close to Hanalei and Anini beaches which are fantastic. 1.2 miles from the hideaway beach. Nice neighbor hood to jog. Quiet. The neighborhood is close to foodland and good number of restaurants which is very convenient.

Most activities like sailing tours , zip lines and choices of helicopter tours are at Lihue which is about a 45 minute drive which is a gorgeous drive. But keep this in mind if hiking activities and sailing are your preferences. 

Overall a great experience

name: 0 min to train, two stops to central (shared)
summary: This is an affordable version but still comfy stay.  The super comfy sofa-bed designed same as QUEEN size bed in living area (NO DOOR).   Enjoy the conveniences of Mascot, you can hit the town and anywhere of Sydney just in minutes.
space: I'd appreciate a message & please say hello *before* you make your reservation request... It'll help speed things up, and smooth things out... oh, and read the bits about house rules. G'Day from Sydney! Thanks for coming to check out my listing :)  I have another btw... http://www.airbnb.com/rooms/5127169. It's called "0 mins to train, 2 stops to central"; an entire home for your stay in Sydney. And http://www.airbnb.com/rooms/8213958 for another affordable private room to stay, This is not a business, or a hotel, or a B&B. This is my home. :)  Reading through the description, and the "House Rules" (Next tab across from the "Amenities" tab), you'll find all the important information you need... Feel free to send me a message with any question you have about me, my home, Mascot, Sydney, or AirBnB… I'd love to hear from you! :D ================================================== Your place: Shared room (private, but NO DOOR - please see the photos) Queen size sofa bed, in lounge area. All

Enjoy the conveniences of Mascot, you can hit the town and anywhere of Sydney just in minutes. I'd appreciate a message & please say hello *before* you make your reservation request... This is my home. :)  Reading through the description, and the "House Rules" (Next tab across from the "Amenities" tab), you'll find all the important information you need... Feel free to send me a message with any question you have about
neighborhood_overview: Mascot is an inner-city village of Sydney. Only about 2 stops from the Sydney CBD (Central Business District) / Core.  Mascot was once a vital component of Sydney's industrial suburb, with manufactory yards, factories and wool-stores. That history remains and in recent years Mascot has experienced a resurgence with an influx of residents and office workers. Cafés, restaurants, warehouse and outlets for shopping in the neighbourhood.
notes: I may be able to arrange some earlier check ins or later checkouts, but I do need to make those arrangements well in advance. So if the 2pm checkin and 10am checkout time isn't your preference.  I can't guaranty and it may involve $50 to cover the cost of arranging someone to handle the keys. Sorry... I've been left waiting too many times to be able to make other arrangements… Please talk to me about it *before* you make your reservation.    :)  I'd ask that you'd please not smoke inside the house. Hope you respect my preferences.  I sometimes work from home. Although I'm out and about visiting clients, I may also work by phone too. So this means that our home would be better suited to guests wanting to be out sightseeing during the day, rather than spending the days inside.  I'll give you keys so you can come and go as you need... Mines is not the place to host parties - but if that's what you're looking for we can certainly point you in the right direction :)  Every morning, please d
transit: By Train:  8 mins (2 stops) to Central  10 mins (3 stops) to Museum (Hyde park, Oxford st)  16 mins (5 stops) to Circular Quay (Opera house) 1 stop from Domestic airport  2 stops from International airport By bus:  Bus route 400/410 direct to Bondi Bus route 400 extra direct to Domestic Airport, International Airport.
access: My house is your house - it's not a hotel, it's a home. I look forward to welcoming you. You can access everything in house other than my private room and personal belongings. After a confirmed booking, an arrangement will be made to give guests the swipe card and key.  I will also share house manual with u by iCloud if u r using iPhone or iPad, the house manual includes WiFi password and how to use the keys. Please send me ur email (normally the same email u use for iTunes). Or I can share it via (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) drive if u prefer.
interaction: As much or as little as you like. My work load can be busy sometimes, so you may see me work from home or won't see much of me until evenings. When I'm around, I'm happy to chat as little or as much as you like. I love meeting people and learning more about the world. I'm open minded, honest, affable and have an immense passion for life, and learning. :)
house_rules: My house rules are very simple: - Please be energy efficient (turn off lights/appliances when not in use)  - Be considerate of–and respectful to–my neighbours  - Keep noise to a minimum  - Be neat and tidy, don't wear shoes inside  - Please don't have food in the bedroom or on the couch  - No pets, smoking inside or parties  - Keep the house locked when you're not at home  - Leave the place as you found it and  - Wash dishes as they are used  - If you don't know where something is - ask.   - If you break something - tell me.   - If you like anything of mine then feel free to say so and I might be able to tell you where to get one of your own!   - Most importantly, enjoy your stay! That's all there is to it :)

host.host_about:
I love travel, enjoy meeting people. I firstly started my Airbnb when I was travelling in 2015.    

I've been as the host and also as a guest, I have met many interesting people over the world which made my life more enjoyable.

reviews.comments:
Thanks Tiger! Your place was just great for what I needed - spotlessly clean, the bed the height of comfort and the location near the airport excellent. Your communication and welcome made me feel very at home! This was a really great stay.
 I suggest using the bus to and from airport. It's quicker, cheaper (A$2.10 and avoids the unjust cost of the train (A$9.20 to travel 2 stations!). The bus is about 100 metres away.

Everything perfect
I recommend this place to everyone
Very clean and comfortable

Living with Tiger was a great experience!
Alltough we booked just one day before,Tiger prepared everything and made us feel very welcome everytime! (He also took pictures from the complex,the street,his flat to explain how we can find everything and to make sure,that we can't get lost- so cute :D )
His flat is so lovely and very clean.
Tiger had to work during our stay,but he offered help anytime. Thank you again! :)
We had space and much time on our own,he really cared about us.
Thank you for everything Tiger! 
Hopefully we can return some day,because we couldn't say goodbye :(
All the best for you!
Marianna&Fabiola
Good place to stay. Very good traffic links.

Thank you for everything Tiger! A great, clean and tidy place, easy location, and Tiger helped me plan my sightseeing in Sydney. He was really easy to contact during my stay, everything was great. I hope to return soon!

I had an unforgettable time in Sydney. Staying at Tiger's place is such a joy and extra point to that. The place is right above the station, u don't even need to think about miss the direction. Taking the train from airport just 2 stops (I remember is 5 mins?), and walk downstairs to catch the train to city, circular quay, Hyde Park, Western area or north part of Sydney, and anywhere, you can't think of any more convenient. Woolworth is just opposite of the road, lots of cafe and restaurants just downstairs, which the place is located on a quite street. I'm very glad I didn't choose another place which looks also close and similar but is on a noise street.  Tiger's place is spacious, clean, modern and well organized. There are some flight noises in the morning but I didn't even notice. The most comfortable bed I have ever had when traveling overseas, of course my own bed at home is the best. :)
Tiger is a friendly funny man, he helped a lot while I'm staying at this beautiful. Thanks again, I'll come back again. Highly recommended.
Tiger is a great host. The place is accurately described. It is by the train station and 2 stops away from Central station. It is tidy, clean and modern. I cannot recommend enough.

Tiger was a very friendly host, I enjoyed my stay here. I was in Sydney for a conference in Mascot airport, so the location was absolutely perfect for me. The public transport was literally at our doorstep which made getting around very easy for me. Thanks for making my stay in Sydney an enjoyable one Tiger, it was nice to have met you and share life experiences!
Beautiful, very good, perfect, clean. 5 stars!!!
The apartment is perfect and Tiger too

It was a great time at Tigers place. His flat is clean and beautiful and directly over the train station. 
Tiger is very helpful and makes your time in Sydney more comfortable.
Tiger is a very nice and friendly guy. I really enjoyed the stay. I got a lot of advices where to go and what to do. So I can really recommend to stay at his home.
Tiger was a great host. Very friendly and helpful. The apartment was very clean, large and had everything you might need. Perfect location next to a major train station.

What a great place and a great host. With Mascot station right at your footstep you are less than 10 mins from anywhere. The strip of shops, restaurants and great little bar are all there outside your front door.
Always a great place to stay when in Sydney - so easy to get around with the train at your footstep. Tiger is a great host and very quick and helpful to make sure your check in is smooth.

summary: Apartment for up to 6 people

host.host_location: Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
host.host_about:
I live in Rio de Janeiro. The city has a lot of attractions like restaurants, museums, bars and an astonishing nature! I would like to welcome you to my apartments and do my best to make you feel comfortable and help you to discover Rio as local. 

I love traveling, teaching DeRose Method, art, cycling, and meeting people from different cultures. I am brazilian and I lived in Spain and Portugal. I speak portuguese, english, spanish and a bit of french. 

I studied environmental engineering and I am a business administration graduate from PUC-Rio and from the University of Salamanca, Spain.

address.street: Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil

name: Nice and relaxing room in Beyoğlu!
summary: In the heart of Taksim, close to Taksim Metro,bars,restaurants&cafe. You will enjoy to stay our room. Our room is very big,shiny,silent,clean and has balcony. Kitchen,bathroom and saloon are to share.
space: The room good for couple.
description: In the heart of Taksim, close to Taksim Metro,bars,restaurants&cafe. You will enjoy to stay our room. Our room is very big,shiny,silent,clean and has balcony. Kitchen,bathroom and saloon are to share. The room good for couple. Bus stations are very close, taksim metro is only 5min far by walking. HAVAS station very close.
transit: Bus stations are very close, taksim metro is only 5min far by walking. HAVAS station very close.

Beyoglu, taksim 
istanbul beyoglu taksim, İstanbul, Turkey

name: Palm Beach Bed&Breakfast ST TROPEZ
summary: A 'traditional' style B&B run as a lifestyle, not as a business. Central location in a tranquil bush setting, walking distance to everything Palm Beach has to offer All 4 rooms have queen or king beds, ensuites and ocean or Pittwater view balconies
space: There are 4 bedrooms in all accommodating 8 people. Room rate shown is for one bedroom (one couple) Discounts are available for off peak seasons and multiple night stays, doesn't hurt to ask !!!
description: A 'traditional' style B&B run as a lifestyle, not as a business. Central location in a tranquil bush setting, walking distance to everything Palm Beach has to offer All 4 rooms have queen or king beds, ensuites and ocean or Pittwater view balconies There are 4 bedrooms in all accommodating 8 people. Room rate shown is for one bedroom (one couple) Discounts are available for off peak seasons and multiple night stays, doesn't hurt to ask !!! Choice of two guest lounge/sitting room areas, one upstairs and one downstairs.  Tea/coffee making facilities. Garden area with several seats/tables in the tropical rear garden overlooking Pittwater. Off street parking The rooms are individual and private.  There is a common lounge room with 50" flat screen TV downstairs and another small guest sitting room, with 32" flat screen upstairs.  Most guests seem to prefer the interaction with other guests having breakfast in the common breakfast room downstairs but you can take it upstairs to your room/bal
neighborhood_overview: Palm Beach is a very unique area. It is well known that 80% of the homes are Holiday homes with only 20 % residents. For all but a few periods i.e. Xmas holidays and long weekends it is unbelieveaby peaceful and quiet.  The nearest shopping village is Avalon Beach, just 5 1/2 kms or 8 mins back along Barrenjoey Rd.  In Avalon you will find Banks, Woolworths, Service Stations, Cafes and Restaurants and the normal sorts of shops you would find in a small village.
notes: We respect your rights to smoke but ask that you respect our right to have a NO SMOKING premises.  Please limit smoking to balconies or outside and please remember to keep the balcony door closed as wind draught can waft  smoke right through the house.
access: Choice of two guest lounge/sitting room areas, one upstairs and one downstairs.  Tea/coffee making facilities. Garden area with several seats/tables in the tropical rear garden overlooking Pittwater. Off street parking
interaction: The rooms are individual and private.  There is a common lounge room with 50" flat screen TV downstairs and another small guest sitting room, with 32" flat screen upstairs.  Most guests seem to prefer the interaction with other guests having breakfast in the common breakfast room downstairs but you can take it upstairs to your room/balcony if you prefer.
house_rules: This is a "traditional style" Bed & Breakfast so there might be four lots of guests.  Please be respectful to all other guests as you would expect them to be respectful of you.  Especially where there are several rooms of guests that are friends it is tempting to get together and "party on" which can be very disturbing to the others.

host.host_location: Palm Beach, New South Wales, Australia
host.host_about:
Well travelled host, classic Baby Boomer, chucked in a successful corporate/executive career many many years ago to embark on a life of rolling mid life crisis and bucket list fulfilment A self confessed motoring enthusiast with a broad  penchant for the classic and unique, don't do 'normal' cars.  Never did grow up and not planning on doing it any time soon !!! A typical Saggitarian ... I can resist everything EXCEPT temptation

My B&B motto is "A traditional style B&B that's run as a lifestyle, not a business ... and it shows"

reviews.comments: The host canceled this reservation 10 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

I can't even begin to tell you how brilliant my stay was. Rudi and Avalon were a total dream. From start to finish they were both so attentive and helpful. The house is charming and full of character and it was amazing to hear all of Rudis stories. Feeding the birds in the morning was such a memorable experience!!! I would recommend the b&B to everyone! Palm beach is the perfect place to relax and Rudis place was the perfect place to stay. I will be back one day!!!

you've reminded me how good staying in a proper b&B can be! Thank you

Simply put, Rudi's place is fantastic. A secluded hide-away a few minutes walk from the beach or the bay. Rudi is very warm, relaxed and attentive - and even gave us a lift to a nearby wedding. A shame we had to leave so soon! Highly recommended.

Staying at Rudi's was the perfect tonic to a hot a busy stay in the city.  The B&B is easily accessible from Sydney - one bus ride all the way.  My room was clean and comfortable with balcony views to the Pitt Water which turned into theatre for the local birds to perform on in the morning!

Rudi was a great host - giving the lowdown on facilities and local amenities whilst letting me explore the area on my own.  Sharing breakfast with two Kookaburra will not be forgotten!!

One tip - for a couple of days from the city I would say a car is unnecessary - the bus takes a while but is frequent and direct, but it is DEFINITELY worth arranging a pick-up with Rudi if possible as the walk up to the B&B was a bit of a struggle with a large amount of luggage!

Great location - close to the beach and restaurants. Relaxed environment and great host. Rudi was very informative on the local area giving us valuable knowledge. Nice room, comfy bed and good shared facilities.
We had a great time. Rudi and Avalon were excellent hosts!
One of the best Airbnb's I've ever stayed. Rudi and Avalon are total legends and two of the kindest people I've ever stayed with. Would go back in a shot.

We had a wonderful stay at Rudi's beautiful B&B and only wished we could have stayed longer. He was a lovely host and extremely hospitable and we couldn't have asked for a better more relaxing room. We look forward to returning soon.
We were attending a wedding at Palm Beach and needed a place to stay for the night.  This place was just what we needed.  Rudi & Avalon were extremely helpful and delightful hosts.
A great place to stay at palm beach!

We were in Palm beach for a wedding and had an absolutely amazing time at Rudi and Avalon's b&b. The place is situated in the most beautiful area and Rudi and Avalon are very lovely and friendly people, they made us feel very welcome and were simply incredible hosts. The room itself was clean with a comfy bed and a really cute balcony with a lovely sea view. Thanks for such a great stay!
There is no better place to stay!
Exactly as described would stay again

We had a wonderful time at Rudi and Avalon’s place. They were incredible hosts (even dropping us down to the wedding we had nearby) and the place was clean, fresh and comfortable. We would definitely stay there again!

name: D3 Waikoloa Beach Villa
summary: Waikoloa Beach Poolside Villa , 2 Bedrooms, Swimming Pool, Hot Tub, & Close to Beaches!
space: Aloha! Welcome to the beautiful Waikoloa Beach Resort, a tropical oasis amid the dramatic backdrop of virgin, black lava fields. Waikoloa Beach Resort Villa is just as spectacular as the scenery and offers the utmost in luxurious living. This poolside villa is perfect for two couples or a small family and features two bedrooms, two bathrooms, and accommodates up to four guests.  The villa opens into a generous area that accommodates the kitchen, living and dining rooms. The living room features a large flat screen TV and cozy designer furnishings. The living area blends seamlessly with the outdoor area that features a built-in BBQ grill and a dining table with seats for four. A well-designed kitchen with dining table with seats for six, and plenty of work spaces to help create a delicious meal. There are also two barstools at the breakfast bench. A great space for quiet contemplation can be found in the master suite that features a comfortable king-size bed and leads into a crisp, cont
description: Waikoloa Beach Poolside Villa , 2 Bedrooms, Swimming Pool, Hot Tub, & Close to Beaches! Aloha! Welcome to the beautiful Waikoloa Beach Resort, a tropical oasis amid the dramatic backdrop of virgin, black lava fields. Waikoloa Beach Resort Villa is just as spectacular as the scenery and offers the utmost in luxurious living. This poolside villa is perfect for two couples or a small family and features two bedrooms, two bathrooms, and accommodates up to four guests.  The villa opens into a generous area that accommodates the kitchen, living and dining rooms. The living room features a large flat screen TV and cozy designer furnishings. The living area blends seamlessly with the outdoor area that features a built-in BBQ grill and a dining table with seats for four. A well-designed kitchen with dining table with seats for six, and plenty of work spaces to help create a delicious meal. There are also two barstools at the breakfast bench. A great space for quiet contemplation can be found in
neighborhood_overview: Waikoloa Beach is an area located on the South Kohala coast on the island of Hawaii. Approximately 25 minutes north of the Kona International Airport (KOA). The Waikoloa Beach Resort is very family and pedestrian friendly. Most properties are within a 10-15 minute walk (3-5minute drive with ample parking) to ʻAnaehoʻomalu Bay, also known as A-Bay. A-Bay is a shallow water bay located within the resort. ʻAnaehoʻomalu is best known for its sunsets, snorkeling and historic royal fishponds. The Queens’ MarketPlace and Kings’ Shops provide convenient dining and shopping options.
notes: Please Note: due to property and association by-laws the maximum occupancy listed is the maximum occupancy that is allowed in the property regardless of age of the guests. GENERAL TERMS, RESTRICTIONS & DISCLOSURES: The general terms, conditions and disclosures which apply to this property include, but are not limited to, the following: The "House Rules" for each complex are located in the informational binder in your vacation rental. Upon arrival, please make sure to familiarize with and adhere to the "House Rules". 1.) BEACHES: All beaches in Hawaii are public; there are no privately-owned beaches. Private property begins at the high tide mark or at the commencement of the vegetation line. 2.) OCEAN WARNING: Ocean swimming has certain inherent risks. Wave and current conditions and dangerous sea creatures vary from area to area, day to day and season to season. Risk and responsibility for ocean swimming rests solely and completely on occupants and guests; lifeguards are not provided.
transit: Rental car recommended
access: - 2 Swimming Pools - 2 Hot Tubs - Fitness Room - 2 Bedrooms  - 2 Bathrooms - Sleeps 4 - Air Conditioning - Linens  - Beach Towels - Multiple Flat Screen TVs - Cable TV - High Speed Wireless Internet - Ceiling Fans - Telephone Service - Washer & Dryer - Outdoor Dining & Living - 2 Adult Bicycles - 2 Beach Chairs - 2 Boogie Boards - 1 Portable Ice Cooler - Gas BBQ Grill & at both Pools - 1 Car Garage - Concierge Service - Non-Smoking Community
interaction: Our office is open M-F 8:30-4:30. We are located in the Waikoloa Beach Resort - you are welcome to come by and meet our team! Available for emergency assistance 24/7
house_rules: Yes, there are House Rules. Basics are; Quiet hours from 10pm- 8 am, no parties, no smoking, no articles of clothing or beach gear on lanai, no glass at the pool. If you have specific questions or concerns, please ask. The complete condensed rules are posted in each unit.

host.host_about:
Aloha!
We have had the pleasure of hosting thousands and thousands of guests since 2006. We have built beautiful relationships with our returning guests and love to share the "aloha" with all of our guests.
We look forward to building our relationship with Air BnB!

reviews.comments: Great spot close to many great beaches, shopping, and very family friendly!
This is a great vacation spot! The location is perfect, within walking distance of the beach, restaurants, and shops. Clean, roomy, plenty of dishes/cooking supplies. We enjoyed it thoroughly!

We loved this condo! extremely clean, VERY well stocked with all of the things you would need ( towels, pots and pans, washer, dryer....). D3 is ground floor and the back leads right to the pool. Garage was also stocked with all of the goodies we might need for the beach. Neighborhood was quiet and so close to the queens shops that we just walked across the street if we needed anything. we will for sure be using Resortica again for our rental needs. they answered every question in a timely manner and were a breeze to work with! Mahalo!

Great unit to rent!  Loved the layout/floor plan.  Condo had everything we needed!  Next to pool, outdoor patio/BBQ was fantastic.  Resortica management was very helpful and accommodating with our needs.  I'd love to return to the same unit for our next trip!
Our stay here was great, well equipped place that is close to the pool and had everything that we needed. Highly recommended!

This is a lovely condo in an ideal location. We would definitely stay here again! Everything was clean and nice. Manager was helpful and easy to communicate with. We loved being so close to the Queen's Shops and A-Bay.
Lovely 2 bedroom villa in Waikoloa Resort. Walking distance to Queens MarketPlace and Kings Shops. Great to have washer and dryer. Pool was lovely and close by! Enjoyed using the BBQ! Great stay!

The unit is well-stocked with all the basics for a beach vacation - this complex is centrally located to anything you want to do on the Big Island - beaches, volcano, observatory, shopping!  Plus D3 is right by the pool and hot tub!

The condo was awesome and better equipped than we hoped! The garage was so helpful and the BBQ in the lanai was top notch! It was amazing to walk in and feel feel like we were home away from our home on Oahu. Waikoloa is the best place to stay for sure! And the pool was 5 stars and so nice and warm!
This place felt like home! I would absolutely recommend this place. There is a shopping mall that has a grocery shop/store right across the street which made it even better!

Unit D3 is really nice.  From the patio, you can walk over to the pool entrance maybe 50 feet away which we did several times.  The rooms are nice and the extra room has two twin beds which were perfect for our kids.  A/C is cool, kitchen has all you need to cook, there is a walk in shower, ceiling fans, and full cable TV.  The door is keyless with a code which is handy for multiple users coming at different times.  The garage unit had two bikes and several boogey boards and a couple sets of snorkle stuff which we used. The Queens shops are across the street and easy to walk to...Starbucks is maybe 400 feet away as the bird flies. We were impressed with everything, including the well maintained grounds of the gated condo community.

This was not our first time in the Waikoloa Beach Villas, but our first time renting with Resortica. Overall, it was an amazing stay. The unit comes stocked with everything one needs for the beach and we enjoyed all of the amenities the condo had to offer. Our little one is 11 months old and the condo was equipped with two high chairs, a travel crib and many books for kids, which helped out a lot. This is definitely a baby friendly rental. Our only qualm with the unit was that the thermostat was hard set to go only as low as 74°, so at night the unit felt a little muggy, making it hard for our baby to sleep. But the condo fans helped to circulate the AC air as the night went on and we were vigilant to keep all the doors closed to keep the unit cool. We have stayed in different units in the Villas that don't have this thermostat restriction, so moving forward, it would be nice to make that clear to guests in advance in case they prefer to keep the condo cooler at night. However, having said all that, we absolutely enjoyed our stay and would definitely rent this condo again and rent with Resortica again. Thanks!
Thanks for the great and comfortable stay. This place was really nice and clean, close to some awesome beaches.
Excellent location! Beautiful unit. Enjoyed everything about the stay

The condo generally was quite clean and tidy, and the appliances were modern and easy to use.  The location is pretty reasonable to getting to north and northeastern parts of the island, as well as to southern parts, including Kailua-Kona and the Kona airport.  I liked having a garage for our vehicle - that made a big difference in the parking situation.  The restaurants in the resort (besides the ones in hotels - i didn't check those out) were perfectly satisfactory.

Pro's & Con's Listed Below...
Pro's:  Great Location, Beautiful Apartment & Wonderful Pool Recreation Area... This is a Fantastic Townhouse... Unfortunately... Beds Need Replacing....

Con's:  King Size Bed in Master Bedroom & Double Beds in 2nd Bedroom need to be REPLACED...  King Size Bed is sloping to the side making you want to roll to the edge.... Double Beds in 2nd Room have Big Dips in the Middle of Mattress... 
Also... Shower Door in the Master Bedroom will not stay closed during shower causing Water to get all over the floor requiring towels on the floor... Some Basic Maintenance Needs to be Done regarding these Issues...
Great location for family with kids

It's a rental condo in a fantastic community of condos so there's not going to be a bad unit in the place.  With that said, this was an easy unit in which to feel right at home.  We are neat freaks, and we know where dirt likes to hide.  We were happy to find this place was clean, clean, clean!  

We like to cook too, so we were glad that there was enough basics in oil and spices to not worry about those.  Did I mention we like things clean?  One way to tell is to see how clean the dishes and utensils are.  No problem there!  Clean kitchen with up to date utensils and appliances.  A big selling point was having a private grill on our patio.  Clean, there too and everything was in top working order.  The dual gas tanks were ready to go and there were sufficient grill tools so we could get the job done.  

Wasn't sure about the ground level at first.  We usually like a balcony.  However, once there, we found it relaxing to have access to the backyard and shortcut path to the pool.  

The garage was stocked with his/hers set of bicycles, a bunch of boogie boards and other ocean equipment that makes a vacation in Hawaii, near the beach a pleasure.  

All in all, it was a great unit.  I would definitely stay there again!
Beautiful place and it had everything our family needed!
Home was well kept, incredibly clean, and had more than enough amenities to make our stay amazing for over two weeks.  We'll be looking to stay here again in the future!

The instructions for check-in and check-out is easy to follow. The place is clean and has a nice shared backyard. The closest beach is the "A" Bay, and it's an 30-min walk away. The Queen's market is just across from street where you can get food, and beach supplies.
Great, clean condo close to shopping. Quick and easy communication with Resortica staff.
Great host and would rent from them again.

Nice unit, great location for easy access to the beauty and adventures of the Big Island.  It was great to have a variety of beach equipment (chairs, boogie boards, snorkle equipment) and bikes included.  We enjoyed our stay.
Great place for family , walking distance to a very nice grocery store . lots of pool and beach gear . secure and private , comfy bed and couch. over all an amazing airbnb experience

This condo is comfortable and clean, tastefully decorated and has a very convenient location close to the pool and the Queen’s shops. The available amenities including outdoor bbq and comfortable outdoor sitting area are all well maintained or nearly new. The ocean is not visible from this condo but the surrounding grounds are lovely.
My one complaint is that upon our departure we received a very upsetting message from the host company Resortica that our condo was left a mess and that they may need to charge additional cleaning charges!!  They later apologized and explained that their phone may have been auto-correcting our condo unit for another one. The message said that they were very disappointed at the state of our condo upon departure, that all linens had been soiled and used, that we didn’t follow check out instructions, that our group included 10!!! people.  After spending most of the evening and all of the morning cleaning I was quite affronted. We washed, folded and put away all the linens ( with the exception of one load going in the washer), washed all the dishes except for a few in the dishwasher washing, took out the garbage and recycled the recyclables, shut off all fans and closed all blinds and locked the doors and windows and left the air conditioning at 74 as requested. We swept the floors and wiped out the fridge and reset the door code to the required setting. As for the number of us using the condo  there were three of us the first night, four the second night and four the third night. I invited Resortica to personally go and check out our unit to ensure that this was a mistake. I was assured that they would investigate and get back to me. This was a week and a half ago and I have yet to hear from them. This ruined the last day of my vacation and has left us feeling very uncertain about this host company. My recommendations to renters would be to make sure and take photos upon departure!!!
Super Apartment nahe am Pool. Alles vorhanden und sauber. Sehr gut organisiert. Der Strand und Lava Lava Beach Club sind zu Fuß zu erreichen. Wir hatten eine tolle Zeit! Danke

name: Waipiʻo Hostel- Kai Room
space: Waipi'o Hostel is located in the quaint village of Kukuihaele, less than a mile from majestic Waipiʻo Valley.  In a place where horses and wild turkeys often wander by, this is the old Hawaiʻi.  A place where neighbors are welcoming and life is sweet as the smell of sugar cane grass.  You'll enjoy the wonderful ocean view and many fruit and macadamia nut trees on the property.  We enjoy the best weather on the island- not hot like Kona, not rainy like Hilo, not cold like Waimea… just perfect!!  It’s also a central location for exploring the Hilo and Kona sides of the island.  Just 10 minutes away is the lovely town of Honokaʻa, with farmers markets, antique shops, restaurants, and the coolest old movie theater in the world.   Our three guest rooms are called "hostel style" but are really private rooms below the main home.  The rooms are simple, yet nicely decorated, clean, with great beds.  Guests share a bathroom, outdoor patio and living room with high speed Wi-Fi, couches, cable TV,
description: Waipi'o Hostel is located in the quaint village of Kukuihaele, less than a mile from majestic Waipiʻo Valley.  In a place where horses and wild turkeys often wander by, this is the old Hawaiʻi.  A place where neighbors are welcoming and life is sweet as the smell of sugar cane grass.  You'll enjoy the wonderful ocean view and many fruit and macadamia nut trees on the property.  We enjoy the best weather on the island- not hot like Kona, not rainy like Hilo, not cold like Waimea… just perfect!!  It’s also a central location for exploring the Hilo and Kona sides of the island. Guests share a bathroom, outdoor patio and living room with high speed Wi-Fi, couches, cable TV,
house_rules: Most important rule: Enjoy yourself!  Other than that:  No smoking  No illegal substances  Quiet time between 10 PM and 6 AM Please be clean and courteous of other hostel guests... and live aloha!

host.host_about:
Aloha,
I'm the Executive Director of Hawaii Outdoors Institute.  I also run the Waipi'o Hostel and host interesting travelers from all over the world.  I travel often for work, and sometimes need to stay in your AirBnB!

reviews.comments: I felt very welcomed by Gregg, the property was beautiful. the water was hot and there was fruit a plenty. Anyone who's looking for a clean friendly place would enjoy this place.

When I arrived, Greg was there to welcome me and show me around. He informed me of a few things around the area so I could go out and explore.
The place was exactly what the listing showed, except the bed was exceptionally more comfortable than expected!
Thanks so much for a great stay!

This room had a really good feel to it. Very clean and good vibes. Really nice bathroom and shower. I would love to stay again if I visit the area. Overall exceeded my expectations from the listing and consider it very affordable for what you get. 

I was looking for a place to stay at the last minute and the host got in touch right away and helped me get set up. Host made me feel welcome, made sure I had everything I needed and gave some great advice about a nearby beach to visit.

Overall positive experience and would recommend!

Great experience from the beginning to end. Very close to the Waipio lookout- we walked. The rooms are clean and the bed was very, very comfortable. Swriously, more comfortable than thr resort we stayed at the night prior. No bugs in the room and easy to keep them out of common area if you keep the door closed. Great hosts, very helpful and accommodating. I would definitely stay here again if I am ever in the area. You also get to meet fellow travellers, which is also nice.

We only stayed one night but anyway we had a great time. It is a perfect place to discover the Waipio Valley (Very close to the hostel, it's just a 15 minute walk) and to get to know other people. The room was very nice, the bed was comfy and the garden beautiful. All in all a very cozy place to stay. Mahalo Greg for your hospitality :)

The room was very nice and comfortable. Greg was very prompt to answer my questions. When I arrived there was no one at his place, so I texted him to see which room I was staying at.  It was an amazing experience to pick up oranges, guavas in the morning and have them for breakfast. The only problem was the line for the bathroom in the mornings. It would have been nice to see Greg  during my visit but I couldn't.

Greg & Harmony were very accommodating and gracious hosts. Their two children added a delightful element.
The accommodations were clean and met our needs perfectly! Met some very fun guests as well during our time.
Loved the fruits that were available as well.
Thanks for enabling a very special HI stay.

Waipio Hostel is a great spot for a stay near Waipio Valley. It's an easy walk to the Waipio Overlook. The rooms are simple, clean and affordable. Greg was super nice as were the other travelers. We enjoyed comparing notes and planing adventures with the other guests. The kitchen is well stocked, there are lots of guide books about the Big Island and the bed was very comfy. Mahalo Greg!

My fiance and I had a great stay here last night.

The common areas are very cozy and inviting, and had a lot of little extras that made it easy to feel at home. Things like tea, condiments and spices were plentiful.

And of course everything was quite clean.

Our room was very roomy and comfortable. The bed and the linens were super comfortable and high quality.

We had to arrive late but Greg was really helpful and easygoing about it making it no problem at all.

As an extra bonus there are a number of fruit trees on the yard which we were allowed to pick from. Oranges and tangerines were in season, but there were others as well that didn't have fruit this time of year. We even got help from the neighbors puppy!

Our stay at Greg's place was perfect! Greg and Harmony are kind-hearted and very friendly! The hostel is rustic and charming. You can hear frogs and birds all night long and you'll meet geckos and other creatures in the garden - very cool! Pick a fruit or cook a meal in their outdoor kitchen! We had a great time out there!

My husband, infant daughter and I stayed with Greg and his family for one night only. They run a very sweet hostel in a fantastic location. Plus: We got a tour of all the fruit trees on the property by one of his children, very nice!

Greg was a lovely host. He was very kind and very laid back regarding my arrival time. The space was quite nice for what  you expect when you hear the word hostel, and I was pleasantly surprised by the bed. Of course it is more expensive than a regular hostel, so one should expect a few extras, but it was still a very nice stay, and conversations with his two young children were an added bonus for me :)

What a nice stay! We were given a yard tour by the cutest host ever (Greg's daughter) and received great tips regarding the closest beaches and restaurants. Great view on the ocean, cozy room and comfortable bed. Merci beaucoup!

Greg was great! Very friendly and knowledgable about stuff to do in the area when our original plan fell through, but gave us space to enjoy the hostel by ourselves. Not a lot of frills, but that's the way we like it! Perfect for us young 20 somethings exploring the island.
Nice hosts. Lots of amenities. Beautiful location.

Staying at greg's hostel was really nice. The place is great and cosy. Greg showed me the hostel and my room when I arrived, he was really nice and he really made an effort. The location is perfect for trips to waipio valley, it's just a 15 minute walk from the house to waipio lookout . I'd definitely stay there again.

Spent two weeks at this extraordinary hostel, and enjoyed every aspect. It was clean, Greg was a great, accommodating host (although he suffered a serious accident while I was there and thus was quite limited in his activities. That will be temporary and did not impact the great experiences I enjoyed there.). He recommended the Waipio Cookhouse nearby for meals, and that was a terrific bonus. Good, locally sourced simple foods and wonderful staff. But you have ample cooking facilities at the hostel if you prefer, and coqui frogs to serenade you in the evening. If you want a natural, peaceful, inexpensive place to see local Hawaii, including Waipio and nearby valleys of true magnificence, this is an unbeatable choice.
Greg was awesome. His chickens laid delicious eggs, and the home was beautiful.

We found the Hostel easy with our GPS, also the hostel sign on the Mailbox was helpful ;)
The room was prepared and and everything was clean and fine, we enjoyed the fresh eggs =)
Greg came down to talk to us and was very helpful.
Thanks again,

Michael

When we arrived after hiking down into Waipio Valley, we were greeted by Greg and his family. It definitely made us feel at home. He then showed us to our room and the amenities that accompanied it. The outdoor kitchen was great for when we made dinner on our second night. The room was fantastic and would definitely stay here again if we return!

Greg met us at the front door and showed us around the apt/property. He was very welcoming/nice and made sure we had anything we needed and offered to tell us more about the area and to talk to him if we had an questions later. The apartment was clean/nice and the bed was incredibly comfortable! The apt is o lookout. We walked, but you could easily drive there.

Harmony was very welcoming and answered all our questions about nearby Waipio Valley. We enjoyed the indoor outdoor cooking and eating area with the cool breeze and lovely view. The sitting areas was comfortable and filled with useful books. The shower was great with enough water pressure to wash my thick hair (and there was lovely shampoo and conditioner provided). Most importantly for me, the bed was great! Super comfy   
This place was recommended to me by a friend and I will certainly do the same.

Thank you very much for the spontaneous commitment :) your room was really cute and the rest of the hostel was absolutely lovely - the outside kitchen, the big bathroom and the cosy living room. We definitely recommend your hostel though we just came around for the introduction and and stayed for the few hours of sleep because of all the things to do on the Big Island ;)

Greg was wonderful! He heard us pulling in, and welcomed us into his hostel with open arms. We had a king size bed (which is my fiance's dream come true), a shower, kitchen and anything else one would need. We loved everything about this stay!

great stay. close to waipio lookout/trail.
very tranquil, cosy bed and lovely common area. very friendly and welcoming hosts. couldn t have asked for more. thank you.
We really enjoyed our stay, Greg is a great person. The house is in a really quiet location and we really liked the area outside for BBQ.

Great value! The room, booked at the last minute, was simple but clean and the bed extremely comfortable, our hosts were very nice, and even lent us a jacket when we needed one! We met cool people during our stay and ended up hiking with them :) perfect to explore the valley
迷ってしまい､到着が遅くなったにも関わらず､とても優しく暖かく迎えてくれました｡静かで星空も美しく､素敵な場所でした｡こんどは長期滞在したいです｡

Wai'pio hostel is located just five minutes walk from the Wai'pio valley lookout. The place is really idyllic, and we loved having breakfast and dinner in the outdoor kitchen area with a fantastic view of the ocean. The rooms were clean and shared a common bathroom and kitchen area with other guest rooms. Greg was a really nice host and made us feel comfortable. But the best part of staying there was the special fruit tree tour we got from his adorable daughter (with directions to the secret grapefruit and avocado trees in the neighborhood)! We loved this place and highly recommend it!
Greg is very friendly and the house is very well located to visit Waipio Valley. I had a nice stay!
Very welcoming.  Beautiful surroundings.
We stayed here for 1 night. It was very Nice.fully in the nature! Nice rooms,comfortabel beds.nice livingroom. Greg old us Nice things to do. We had a warm welcome!

Great place, very close to Waipio Valley. Greg and his family are very friendly and able to offer advice about the local region. Would certainly recommend to others. The fruit and nuts in the Garden are an added bonus.

Greg & Family's hostel is the first AirBnB experience I've ever had. Before arriving to Greg & Family's hostel, I stayed in contact with him letting him know my estimated arrival to the hostel. He was kind enough to let me know that he wouldn't be on the property and that he wouldn't be able to greet me, which is totally fine! 

While arriving to his property was a bit tough without GPS (which people should set way before hitting Waipio valley), we were able to find it with the description he set on his itinerary. With that being said, expect no cellphone coverage out here! Greg has graciously offered wifi on his property for convenience.

The hostel was lovely, and I really loved how convenient and close it was to the lookout! Although at night, I hear frogs and crickets pretty clearly outside of the hostel, so I would bring some earplugs with you if you don't regularly carry them. :) Thanks, Greg & Family!
greg was super kind and friendly. his place had a beautiful backyard and everything we needed was in the room. I would definitely recommend this to others :)

Nice little hostel with three rooms, common room, spacious bathroom and a nice seating area outside with the kitchen. Bit far away from everything, would be perfect to explore Waipi'u valley which is close.
Thanks for the nice stay, Simone and Jan
We had a very good stay. Room was simple but clean and fine. Very nice outside fully equipped kitchen. Fresh fruit from some fruit trees. Friendly and helpful owner. I can recommend this place.

場所も家族もﾍﾞｯﾄもお庭も出会う人も全てよかった!
3回もﾘﾋﾟｰﾄしてしまいました!

The place was outstanding! We had a room with a king size bed. The common area was fantastic, great outdoor cooking facility. The water is so clean and tasty! The location is perfect - great to venture the north island. The hike to Waipio is great. The Waipio Cookhouse has AMAZING food. Beautiful place to kick back. Would stay there again in a heartbeat. Thanks Greg!

We stayed here for 1 night whilst on the Big Island as we wanted to check out Waipio Valley. The location was perfect for this. The room was clean and exactly as described. The bathroom was also clean and the shower had good water pressure. We arrived whilst Greg was out but there were instructions to let ourselves in - he came down to introduce himself later and was very friendly.
Everything was just as mentioned, clean and quaint.  The only thing that I would say is that starting around 6 am there was a little noise upstairs of little feet. :)  Other than that, it was good!

C'est un endroit charmant! Tout est fait pour vivre une aventure particulière. Les fruits et légumes dans le jardin. Les conseils avisés d'Harmony & Greg et bien sûr le lieu qui est magique par bien des aspects. Si vous voulez vivre une vraie expérience complétement détachée de tout alors ce lieu est pour vous.
we were there only for one night. Greg is absolutely nice, the rooms are not very new, but regarding the price absolutely okay.

This place was awesome! I wish I could've stayed longer, but the one night I did stay was VERY relaxing and cozy. It's close to the Waipio valley and the Waipio cookhouse is close too, which has great food. I would definitely recommend this spot to anyone wanting to explore the Waipio valley or just to have a relaxing time in Kukuihaele.

We enjoyed our stay a lot! There were fresh fruits and avocados in the garden which we could take and eat. Good information was provided and even guide books to read. Greg's family was super nice and helpful too! we felt very welcome and would stay there again. MAHALO! :)

In general we had a great stay. I guess the kids running around upstairs can be a bit noisy, but they will go to bed before you anyway and it provides a nice home-atmosphere. Greg and Harmony are very nice and welcoming. The big avocado tree and macadamia's and other fruit trees are also pretty cool!
Greg's hostel was beautiful. Super comfortable king size bed, breezy outdoor kitchen, massive avocados, farm fresh eggs. Thanks for having us!
This place was awesome and we enjoyed our stay!
The host canceled this reservation 105 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Awesome place to stay if you are trying to stay as close as you can to Waipio Valley.  There's a place right next to the hostel called The Smoke House and that's the best locally grown and organic food you'll ever eat!  Best place to stay if you are looking for the best bang for your buck.  You can't go wrong.

Had a great stay at Waipi'o hostel. It's a great location and charming old house and general set up for the hostel. Greg was super accommodating with our timing being a bit out of wack. Would highly recommend it!
Perfect!
Zimmer einfach aber fein, mit Tisch zum arbeiten und einem sehr bequemen Bett. Gemeinschaftsraum ist auch gemütlich. Hostel sehr nah am Waipi'o Valley

The host was generous and offered us any fruit on the property, which included macadamia nuts and avocados.  The room was clean and cozy. As a hostel there were three guest rooms sharing one bathroom- which worked just fine as everyone was on a different schedule. 
The host welcomed us but mostly left us alone, he let us know they lived upstairs if we were ever in need. They have 3 young kids and being upstairs you could hear foot steps.
The area is nice but in the town many things were not open, I think we were there in the low season. But there is a fridge and all you need to cook most things.
We really enjoyed staying at Greg's place. It's truly unique place and we'll highly recommend!

I had a wonderful time at Waipio Hostel, I didn't want to leave! Greg was an excellent host with clear directions and check in/out procedures. I settled in very easily in this quaint set up, appreciating every aspect of the property. I would most definitely stay here again!

If you are hiking the muliwai trail or just looking for a fun and local experience, this is a great stay! It was clean and comfortable and the shared spaces allowed us to get to know a couple from Chicago staying next door. The outdoor kitchen is fun and it is so handy to have a full kitchen with all the cooking utensils for making meals and keeping costs down. Having a coffee maker is so nice in the mornings although there are only two mugs despite the plethora of other dishes. I saw no bugs inside the house area but the tree frogs sounded lovely at night. We stayed in the "kai" room and could hear the family overhead in the mornings and early evenings but not to the point of it waking us up or keeping us up. The clementines were in season while we were there as we're avocados so we ate really well. The check-out process was quick and easy. Highly recommend this place!

Waipi'o Hostel was a great base camp to explore the Waipi'o Valley area! Greg was very helpful and welcoming. I would only recommend bringing some earplugs if you're not used to countryside noises at night.

The setting for Greg's home is so relaxing and beautiful. We were able to relax and also get out to enjoy the sites. Greg was very open and would have helped in anyway I feel if we asked. The space was what we had thought it would be. Had a feel of living in the Honokaa area, not just a visitor. We had the room with the king bed and it was very comfortable and clean. Rustic is the best way to describe the space. It was clean and had all that we needed and also the experience of living around others.
The hostel is a really nice place and Greg is very friendly. A perfect place to stay to explore Waipio valley.

This hostel is exactly what we needed. Greg was super easy to communicate with and directions to the place/to get in were very clear. The bed was very comfortable and there were lots of great books to read :) The fresh fruit and coffee were also nice. The location was fantastic and very scenic. I would definitely recommend this place. Very much worth it!
Such a beautiful place to stay amongst fruit trees, incredible scenery and a kind, open, living family.
It's a nice place. Really quiet and totally authentic Hawaii.

Greg's hostel was perfect for a rustic stay following exploration of the amazing Waipi'o valley.   The well equipped outdoor kitchen with view of ocean and fruit trees loaded with tangerines provided the makings for a  lovely morning breakfast with fellow travelers.  Bed very comfortable to cozy in  and hear the night bird songs in this memorable corner of the Big Island.
Greg's place is better than described. It is clean, charming, and secure. The closeness to the Waipi'o Valley was outstanding. If we were booking again, we'd love to stay longer. Thanks so much Greg.

The hostel was a great place to stay for a solo traveler. Greg's place has a nice balance of community style living (shared bathroom, living room, kitchen) but with the option of some privacy with your own room. It was cozy, and I felt perfectly safe traveling there alone. Would totally stay there again!

Greg and Harmony seem very sweet and the description of an older plantation home had me wondering about their rooms when I saw they were downstairs. Upon reviewing many, many reviews stating it was clean I booked a two night stay. There was so much dust in our room above and behind the blinds, in the closets, the lamps well everywhere and there was mold on the walls in the shower. These may not be issues to some but I coughed all night so that my niece finally went to sleep in the car. Greg issued us a $20 refund for the cleaning fee, I stated our objections and not wanting to bash them as people only the condition of our room which was hardly fair since we then had to find another room for the night and pay again. Anyway am writing as I said not to bash them as people but not wanting another to have the same experience either.

If, like me, you stayed in lots of hostels in the 1970s, you'll love this place. Very nostalgic, with the best that those places had to offer. And Greg's place has a lot of nice upgrades.  Highly recommended.

The place is as described and the rooms are actually quite nice for a hostel. The common areas have everything you need and it's very nice to get to know the other guests staying in the hostel. However all rooms are adjacent to the common area, which means you'll also hear the other guests if they stay up late. The garden is very nice with its fruit trees and sea views.  Neighborhood is rural, lovely and peaceful: the real Hawaii as the host described it! At a stone throw from the waipio valley entrance.

This is a hostel is an old  sugar plantation located nine miles off Hwy 19 so a car is necessary.  It may seem "way out there" but you are actually very near Waipi'o Valley.  The accommodations are simple but nice.  The bedroom I had and the bed were very comfortable. The bathroom is rustic and simple.  It's very quiet at night except for the roosters so light sleepers  need earplugs.
nice room beautiful view,they are nice
Just as good as last time. My daughter was along this time and said she wanted to stay here all week.
If you are planning on attending a program in Honokaa, this is 8 miles out of town. You will need a car.
This place was just what we needed. A beautiful setting near the edge of the world with a great restaurant around the corner and a quaint town down the road.  Loved our stay here.

If you don't need it fancy but very adequate at a decent rate this is your pick. Have met some very interesting folks on both visits which adds to the ambience of this casual setting. Certainly a great pick if you want to explore Waipio or Waimanu.

Edge of the world!  This was a fun hostel - type stay. Shared a kitchen with other guests but it's such a small and cozy arrangement that it was really fun. Very close to the hike into Wiapio Valley (less than a mile down the road) and there is a nice little restaurant just across the way. Rooms are under the main house and you may hear a little noise from above but it's not bothersome. Beautiful older plantation house. Nice stay

Greg's hostel was much needed to crash at after a long day traveling. Bed was big & soft, and we drifted off to sleep to the sounds of nature around us. The hostel was as described; had all the basics and their backyard was fantastic. You can't beat the proximity to the Waipio Valley lookout either. Thank you!
This place is amazing! I felt very comfortable there, very safety and everything was clean.
This was a great location to get up get a great breakfast at the Cookhouse and beat the crowds to the lookout!

Best living experience in Big Island. 

We arrived late night but instructions were so clear we didn't have any trouble of finding the place. 

It is the perfect location if you're visiting the north part of the island. 

Greg and his wife are great hosts. 
Gave us plenty of info and tips about places to visit.

Peaceful and quiet area, you'll rest as never before. 

Restaurants and cafes close around 8pm so if you're looking for a late dinner my suggestion is to plan earlier where to eat or buy grocer before and cook at the hostel. 

Mahalo, 
Davide & Ben

Nice stay close to waipio valley. Very comfortable bed and good amenities, including nice shared bathroom and outdoor kitchen. Just be aware that there's a young family living above, so don't plan to sleep in past 6am.

Nice, quiet place to stay in one of the most most beautiful places. Don't forget to say hi to Tony and Johnette at the shaved Ice stand or great food at Wiapio Cookhouse. Loved all the fresh fruit shared by Greg. Comfortable rooms.
A very comfy bed and the song of the coqui frogs to fall asleep to.

Great location if you want to explore the Waipio valley. The place has everything you need to cook (outside stove, fridge, toaster, microwave, grill, spices) and relax (indoor and outdoor). There were fresh eggs and fruit trees. Greg was flexible with our checkin time and very welcoming. Would definitely stay there again. Bring some mosquito repellent.

Great price, nice people, get to meet people -3 rooms with one communal living room and bathroom. If you are a light sleeper it's not for you. Directly underneath main house. You hear every foot step, you wake up at 6am when the blender goes or  when the baby wakes up. No sleeping in here! Very close to Waipio.

The stay was very satisfactory! It was very nice of Greg to answer my calls prior to the visit and had patiently answered all the questions I had about the Island. We checked in pretty late in the night, and they had still come down to check out on us and made us feel comfortable. We came to the Island for a backpacking trip to Waimanu Valley and Greg had let us park the car for a nominal fee in the premises. Otherwise we would have had to hunt for a space. Everything about this place is perfect, the setting, the location.

ﾎﾉｶｱには泊まる所が少ないので､助かりました｡
壮大なWaipio valleyが近くにあるので､とても楽しみました!
お父さんがとても良い人でもっとお話ししたかったです!またBig islandに来たら､泊まりたいです:-)
The hostel is a perfect location for hiking in the waipio valley and a good place to meet other travelers. I enjoyed my short stay.

Greg's place was just as advertised, and good value for the money.  Be prepared for one bathroom shared with the other guests -- if someone is showering when you need to go, you need to wait!  Cooking is outside, but under cover (we cooked in pouring rain).  There were plenty of left-behind helpful things like spices and oil, and toiletries in the bathroom.  The proximity to Waipi'o is great; there's not much else to do.  We enjoyed picking tangerines and cracking fresh macadamias for breakfast.
This hostel was an easy choice in this rather remote location. Greg is a very kind, accommodating host and the place had plenty of unexpected amenities

What can't I say but views that leave you speechless. Up the road from Waipio valley. get a jeep and drive down it will be a trip in itself. Fresh eggs from the backyard. And a really good vibe. Slept like a baby.
Convenient to Waipio valley.

A very nice room with a huge, soft bed. I really liked the big bathroom with the wooden floor and the outdoor kitchen area where you have a view of the ocean. Greg and his family were very welcoming and helpful. The hostel is really close to the Waipi'o valley. You'll need a car to get to the stores, but also you'll be staying at a very nice, calm and friendly place.

A really nice spot (very close to Waipio Valley) with welcoming & friendly hosts! The outside kitchen, the privacy and the room are great :) 
A charming house, we recommend this AirBnB!
Just one thing, if you are very sensitive to any noise like me (no problem for my girlfriend), this charming old house (1922) may be too noisy.


Bien situé (proche de le vallée de Waipio) avec des hôtes accueillants et gentils ! La cuisine extérieure, l'intimité et la chambre sont géniale :)
Une maison charmante, nous vous recommandons cet AirBnB!
Une petite chose, si , comme moi vous avez des problèmes de sommeil (pas de soucis pour ma compagne), cette charmante vieille maison (1922) peut être bruyante.
This was a great place to stay! Everything was very clearly communicated and organized. The rooms and common spaces were comfortable and very organized. Very close Waipio Valley. Highly recommend!
