Great stay! Greg and his family welcomed us with warmth and showed us to the hostel around back. It's nothing fancy, feels like a basement (because it is); but it's got a good shower and shared space, and a great outdoor kitchen overlooking the ocean and yard. The bed was super fluffy, clean and comfortable. We made eggs in the morning that came from their hens. Located a stones throw from the gorgeous waipio valley. We were glad to hang our hats here for the night after a day of exploring the valley! Thanks Greg!

I stayed at the Waipio Hostel for two nights, it was a late booking but Greg accommodated and checked me when I arrived. Room was spacious and the bed was very comfortable, good shower also. 

As the Room is essentially basement level noise is carried over easily through floorboards, but I sleep with ear plugs anyhow so was not a real issue. Everything was as listed and Greg was friendly and polite upon arrival.

And the location is fantastic, Waipio valley short drive away, as is Honokaa for local shops etc. And the Restaurant the Smokehouse is just a short walk away, great food. Would definitely Recommend to others staying here.

Mahalo :)

Great value. Easy check-in. Close to Honokaa and walk to Waipio Valley. Amazing star gazing at night. Amazing backyard with a great view of the ocean. A good way to live like a true Hawaiian. Also walking distance to this terrific farm-to-table restaurant called Waipio Cookhouse, which we visited 3 days in a row.

The stay in Greg and Harmony's home was wonderful. We really enjoyed the possibility to cook our own food since the outdoor kitchen is amazingly great equipped. The room was nice. We enjoyed the neighbourhood right next to Waipio Valley. Communication was perfect!

Everything has been great. One thing is the poor noise isolation that make early mornings noisy when you have kids running upstairs.
The place is beautiful, and close to waipio Valley.
Great place.
Nice place for what it is.  Nothing fancy but gets the job done.

Greg's place was conveniently located in a beautiful setting. Check in was very easy, the accommodation was clean and well set-up for travellers, and Greg was a friendly host. We'd highly recommend this place for anyone looking for a relaxed and comfortable stay in the area. Would love to return some day!

I loved the outdoor kitchen with everything a hosteler could need and the living room area was warm and cozy with a great library. We were invited to pick the fresh fruit and macadamia nuts growing on the property and informed of a great place to eat nearby.

Greg's place was charming and very well set-up for travellers.  We loved the well-equipped outdoor (covered) kitchen, and opportunity to forage fruits from the yard. Bedroom and common areas had nice character and bed was very comfy. Accessible to both sides of the island. Host was prompt with communication. Great stay. Mahalo!
WE loved staying here! Outdoor kitchen was great with many fruit trees and a peaceful view. Greg was very kind and hospitable. Great access to Waipio valley- worth the trek!
It was a very comfortable stay and nothing beats this location. Just Amazing!!!

I would definitely recommend Gregs accommodation. It's a short hike to Waipio Valley and the view from the house, overlooking the ocean is amazing. The kitchen is very well equipped with both kitchen tools, oil and spices. Bathroom was spacious and shower was very good(equipped with shampoo, conditioner and body wash!!). The room was perfect with a big bed and a small open closet. In the garden they have mac nuts, tangerines and avocados and we were allowed to take as much as we wanted! This was the perfect stay and Greg and his family was very welcoming :-)

We are looking forward to our next stay. Quiet, fun, good company, very nice and a lovely change from over -priced,  soul-less commercial hotels.  Peaceful, family atmosphere, very enjoyable. Thanks Greg and family!

The location is perfect if you're heading down into the Waipi'o Valley.  And it's close to the Waipi'o Cookhouse which was an awesome place to eat!  We stayed in the Kai Room and our bed was so comfy and nice, especially after a long day hiking!  Greg was a wonderful host and shared some hiking tips with us for the valley that really came in handy.  Also, the macadamia nuts and tangerines in the yard are wonderful!!!  Remember that you're staying in someone's home and you can sometimes hear the kiddos.  But it wasn't a big deal for us.  The price is terrific, the location is great and the family is wonderful.

Gregs place is pretty much how other reviewers described it. The noise from upstairs is substantial. And it is a basement- there’s a pretty strong mildew smell and quite a few bugs. There is a usable kitchen though the fridge doesn’t seem to do much. On the other hand, the bedroom was reasonably clean and the bed was very comfortable. Greg is a very friendly, laidback, and accommodating host. And the location is great - very close to waipio valley.
Had some good conversations with other fellow travelers, ate some tangerines and macadamia nuts straight off the trees. Overall a very comfortable stay. Highly recommended.
We loved staying at this hostel! Charming location, cute, clean rooms, and awesome hospitality.

Greg's house is very close to Waipio Valley (3 mins drive). We got here at night and Greg welcomed us and lead us to the guest apartments which located at the back of the house. Amenities are good and they has a country vide which I liked! And we were provided delicious breakfast made of home-grown potato. Overall a good place to stop by.

Greg hat uns freundlich begrüßt. Die Outdoorküche ist gut bestückt und der gemeinsame benutzbare Raum ist gemütlich. Wir konnten uns an den Früchten 8m Garten bedienen. Man merkt aber, dass das Haus älter ist und es roch feucht. Außerdem war bereits am Morgen früh um 6 Uhr Betrieb in der Wohnung. Die Wände sind dünn und alles ist hörbar.

great outdoorsy get away!
walls are a bit thin; i could hear other guests in other rooms. 
other than that, great location and great host!

Great location and amazing tangerines and Mac nuts on the property. Had a great night stay after enjoying a local reggae concert nearby and got an early start on visiting the Waipio valley. Definitely recommend.

Totally recommend this place. A cozy and soothing place to stay, with it's outdoor kitchen and wind chimes. We were able to fix a dinner just with food left by other guests and there is free coffee and fruits from the garden. Yes, you do here that Greg and his family live just above, but it did not bother us at all. very close to Waipio Valley Lookout.
Greg has a charming place, so close to Waipio Valley!

Its a great place if you enjoy the outdoors (super close to Waipio Valley).
Greg was very friendly and the check in/out process was very smooth.

Greg's place is incredibly cozy and is a great location for exploring Waipi'o Valley and the surrounding areas. Check in was super easy and the bed was incredibly comfortable. Just a warning for those who need dead silence in which to sleep this may not be the location for you. His family does live upstairs and the ceiling doesn't insulate much of the noise, so you will hear the kids moving around upstairs fairly early in the morning. If you're generally up and about around 7am it shouldn't be much trouble for you at all. We enjoyed our stay here immensely even though it was only for a night. Thanks Greg!
It was a quiet relaxing location and it’s right next to the waipio valley hike so I had a good time.

This hostel was perfectly placed. The bed was so comfy and i sleeved so well here, falling asleep listening to the sounds of the island.  The outdoor kitchen was great, I especially liked having breakfast looking out over the backyard. 

Thank you for having me, I really enjoyed my time!
Lovely hosts, very comfortable bed, great location. A bit too rustic for my taste,  but perhaps in line with hostel expectations.

Waipio Hostel is a extremely cute and practical place to explore Pololu and Waipio from. We especially enjoyed our visit to the Hawaiian Vanilla company which is near by. Everything at this hostel is clean and the bed is very comfortable. Cooking in the outdoor kitchen might be the highlight of the trip for me. You will hear quite a bit of noise from above and the walls between the rooms are quite thin so we could hear the other guests. This hostel is reminiscent of camping for me since it is so open and airy. I would recommend this to others.

Greg’s place is very conveniently located near Waipio Valley.  I very much enjoyed my time staying there and conversing with Greg and his other guests.  Greg definitely seems like the type of host who will make sure you have a great stay and is very informative on things in the area.
Emplacement parfait pour aller à la waipio valley! Très propre et jolie endroit! La vue de la terrasse est magnifique!! Je le recommande!

Unfortunately, we had to cancel on this host at the last minute for 2 nights due to personal circumstances that forced us to change our travel plans. Greg was a great, sympathetic host and was very laid back about our last minute back and forth. Thanks!

FANTASTIC location for the stunning Waipio valley. We heading down early in the morning before most people just the surfers  
Greg and his family were lovely
Greg’s place is really cozy and peaceful. Really recommended to stay here if you are visiting Waipio!

The Place was rustic but nice! The day we arrived was raining a lot and since the apartment is on the basements of the house the room was really humid! The garden and the outside kitchen were nice and fully equipped! The location is great if you want to visit the Waipio Valley!
A great starting point for the Waimanu valley hike!

nuit parfaite
un lieu très plaisant et relaxant
et familial

I booked Greg’s place last minute: his communication was quick and instructions were accurate to find his space. The room was clean and ready for us soon after booking. The place was as is, and honest. Recommended as a good spot for a night in your travels.

Greg will make you feel at home. He has a lot of knowledge about Hawaii and his local area. The location is wonderful for visiting Wiapi’o Valley. Make sure to purchase food and drink before heading out to Greg’s as there is little available once you get to Greg’s.

We had a great time at Greg's place. It is located only a few minutes away from the Waipio Valley which enabled us to check it at sunrise, hike up and down the slopes before coming back to the hostel to shower, rest and grab a bite. We were able to pick fresh avocados, breadfruits, tangerines, Macadamia nuts, etc. straight from the trees and eat them in the outdoor kitchen which was a great plus. The place was quiet, clean and homey. Wifi worked great too. We'll be back!

This is a wonderful place to base yourself for a visit Waipio Valley, a mere 5 min drive away! Greg was super accommodating with late arrival time, and after a day out and about, the warm shower and clean space was more than welcome. The town of Honokaa is about 20min away by car if you need to get food and other essentials.

Highlights: 
- Great and plentiful fruit in the yard. Also have a chance to try fresh macadamia nuts!! 
- Located in a beautiful, lush part of big island
- Cosy room/ living room space

Lowlights: 
- Bathroom is a zoo at nighttime! Wish we were warned about the many slugs and roaches
- Lights out/dim in shared spaces at 9:30 (including the outdoor kitchen) and no way to turn them back up as they are set to a timer.

Greg was a kind host. He welcomed us and showed us around the place. He made sure we had everything we needed. 
We got to pick and eat fresh tangerines from the trees. 
Know that frogs and bugs are out at night.

Great location and Greg was super nice and helpful.  

Check out Sea Dandelion in Honokaa.  The food was really, really, good!
Nice place, beautiful property, tasty tangerines. Enjoyed our short stay.

Lush and tranquil setting just minutes from the Waipio Valley lookout. Greg's place is nice for a quick stopover if you are hiking into the valley, but also works well if you want to spend a few days exploring the north side of the island. The rooms are comfortable and tidy and the outdoor kitchen is fully equipped. We did quite a bit of cooking and eating in. There were a ton of tangerines to pick and eat while we stayed. The place is cozy but a little quirky- it is in the basement of an old plantation house (the window in our room looked out at ground level.) If there is a full house, you may need to wait to use the toilet if someone is showering. There is a nice outdoor shower. Overall, a great budget option in a beautiful area with a very kind and knowledgeable host!
Greg's place was great. very close to Waipio valley and there is wifi! Ate fresh bananas and oranges in the morning. Couldn't of asked for a better place to stay. Thanks!

This is the perfect launching point for the Waipio and Waimanu valleys. There is a shared kitchen and bathroom with everything you need. Greg is a great host who graciously shares his knowledge of the area and the Muliwai Trail. Check in is easy and you can't beat the price. I highly recommend this place.
Greg has a stylish place. The outdoor kitchen is especially awesome

name: Very Large Private Room on quiet st
space: Very large private bedroom on quiet street just off the famed Grand Concourse in the Bronx in a Pre-War building.  Steps away from conveniences such as Pharmacy, Grocery Store, restaurants.... 2 blocks away from 3 subway lines.   Manhattan in 15 minutes.  Wifi, towels, and light breakfast included.  Air conditioning in summer.     Use of kitchen for light cooking and food storage.   Big screen t.v. with remote in room.   2 closets. Airport transfer for $65.  Double bed plus one air mattress accommodates up to 3 people making it very economical.  $30 per night for one person.   If two or three, then it is $25 per person per night. ($50 for 2, $75 for 3)   You will have the keys and can come and go as you like.    VERY IMPORTANT: Please arrive at a reasonable time.   That is, no later than 10p.m.
description: Very large private bedroom on quiet street just off the famed Grand Concourse in the Bronx in a Pre-War building.  Steps away from conveniences such as Pharmacy, Grocery Store, restaurants.... 2 blocks away from 3 subway lines.   Manhattan in 15 minutes.  Wifi, towels, and light breakfast included.  Air conditioning in summer.     Use of kitchen for light cooking and food storage.   Big screen t.v. with remote in room.   2 closets. Airport transfer for $65.  Double bed plus one air mattress accommodates up to 3 people making it very economical.  $30 per night for one person.   If two or three, then it is $25 per person per night. ($50 for 2, $75 for 3)   You will have the keys and can come and go as you like.    VERY IMPORTANT: Please arrive at a reasonable time.   That is, no later than 10p.m.
house_rules: No smoking or alcohol inside my home. Please  note that you must arrive by open.  If you know you will be arriving after this time, please contact me before you make the reservation to see if I can accommodate a late arrival.

host.host_about:
I am a school bus driver as well as a construction worker.   I love vegetarian food.   I speak both English and Spanish.  I often travel to El Salvador to do missionary work.  My motto is "Do unto others what you would have them do to you".
To make it easy for my guests, I have arranged with a nearby business to pick up the keys to my apartment.   I will furnish the complete information when a booking is made.

reviews.comments: I stayed with Douglas for a single night while visiting Montefiore Medical Center and would definitely stay with him again.  He was very welcoming and had even picked up a few extra things for the kitchen especially for my arrival.  The room is big with lots of shelving and closet space.  The apartment is located close to a subway stop on the B/D line and one on the 4 line.  My only cautions for potential renters are 1) the heating system in the room is loud, so if you are a light sleeper this may disturb you 2) I found I had to choose between a hot shower or one with good pressure – I wasn’t able to achieve both, but that could have just been me, 3) at the time of my visit Douglas had not setup any internet yet and so you either need to rely on a data plan from your phone or do without.  Douglas also has to work throughout most of the day, so if you want to arrive or leave earlier in the day, you need to coordinate with him beforehand.  I think any shortcomings with the apartment are well balanced by the price and you get a very good value.

i really enjoyed my stay at douglas' and will probably do it again,its a nice and quite place,Douglas is mostly not around,it feels like u have the place to your whole self all day.hes still not set up a wifi yet. Douglas is a good guy and really enjoyed his hospitality
Doug was an amazing host. Close to subway. Big room.

Douglas is a great host.  The apartment is two blocks from the B/D so it was very convenient to getting around NY.  The room is large and quiet with a TV and wireless internet.  Douglas is very nice-- he even helped me with my apartment search.  I'd definitely stay here again.
Doug was a great host, five stars, highly recommended!

Douglas is the type of rare good soul that is so very hard to find! I only wish the stay was longer! Conveniently located to the B and D as well as the 4 trains which run express to Manhattan, you could not help but love the wonderful prices for fruits and other foods compared to the same products you would find anywhere else. A+ indeed!

It is a good place to stay if you have a limited budget. Very close to the subway, quite and roomy enough - it took me only about 20 - 30 minutes to get to Manhattan. I will probably try to rent the same room next time when I am in New York.

I stayed at Douglas's place for a week backpacking NYC for the first time, and I was honestly thrilled at the location and space I got.  I was only a few minutes from the subway and once you got on, manhattan was only 10-15 minutes away and the B/D got me mostly to where I needed to go.  The bed was clean along with the bathroom, it is in an older apartment building though so dont expect anything special, but for the price you pay, this place is a steal especially since you dont have to share the room.  Douglas was nice and I would definitely crash here again.

Douglas is the best host I’ve ever met. The apartment pictures are very accurate. The room is very spacious and comfortable. It is conveniently located from train D and 4. Staying at Dougla’s is like having your own apartment as Douglas works all day long. And he keeps his place very organized and clean which made me feel good. As soon as, I booked Douglas had the time to explain to me how to get to his place, he was very welcoming and helpful. By the time I knocked on the door I received the keys apartment, so I could come and go as I pleased. I’ll definitely stay here when I go back in New York.
I love Douglas !!!

We spent less than 24 hours at Doug's place. We had a layover before going to our next destination. Doug was very accommodating considering our flight was late getting into JFK. The place was clean. We hope to stay there again!

Douglas is a wonderful and accommodating host. He is generous with information on local amenities and everything that is required for a guest's stay in his Bronx neighbourhood. Much Spanish is spoken in this part of the Bronx, so one can practice his Spanish, which was great for me. My room was large, clean and comfortable, with free access to kitchen. Location appeared to be safe enough and was an easy commute to midtown, although a 30-40-minute subway ride (subway station: 170th St). Close to all major highways, if driving into the Bronx area. Agreed about the shower, but if a little cold water is added, the pressure is fine. The shower curtain needs to be replaced.
Wonderful-- I like Douglas!
last month stayed in douglas place for 5 days,great bargain for the price i payed,room good size easy transport links and douglas very friendly host

our stay here was a great pleasure,Douglas is very welcoming host.. The neighborhood is latinos but safe, we had no problems there. There is not enough of place for free parking on the street close to building but you can find it maybe two blocs further.
For the price you pay you can not ask for more, big room, near subway into manhattan quickly

Douglas is absolutely a great host. He was very kind, helpful and generous. I really enjoyed my stay in his apartment. The room is pretty large with a comfortable bed and fast internet. The area is quiet and safe and the subway station is very close. 
I strongly recommend this room and host!

I highly recommend staying at Douglas's place. The accommodations are just as described, Douglas is a very nice man and the area is very safe and very close to Manhattan.
This is my best experience in NY using Airbnb.

My boyfriend and I had a wonderful time staying with Douglas! He's super nice, polite, and easy to talk to. Even though the building itself is quite old, Douglas made sure that the room was very clean and comfy. The bed sheet was very comfortable, and he also gave us clean towels to use. Douglas also bought us bananas for breakfast. 

The location is not the most convenient if you want to go to Manhattan, but the metro is only a few minutes away! It's a really great deal for the price you pay.

My one week stay at Douglas's place was outstanding.  Douglas is a very friendly host and keeps an exceedingly clean and orderly home.  The room itself is spacious, clean, and includes a comfortable bed with plenty of storage space for your luggage.  I was pleasantly surprised at how calm, quiet, and peaceful the nights were up in this area of the Bronx: no honking horns or other "city" noises that can be a bother when staying in the middle of a city.  The apartment is located a short walk from the subway (approximately 2-5 minutes depending on the subway line you use).  On any future trips to NYC, I will definitely check to see if Douglas's apartment is available again.  Highly recommended. Thank you Douglas!

I had a nice stay in Douglas'flat. He is very friendly :-) 
I enjoyed my stay, and it's very near from the subway, very quieck to go to Mannathan.

Doug was a very nice host, He  showed me around the apartment, explained the neighborhood, handed me a set of keys, towel and soap and gave me the space I needed to relax during my short stay. Very nice person. The room was clean, the bed comfy, the water in the shower very hot and apartment very well heated.  Three blocks to the subway. Can't ask for more convenience. I look forward to stay with Doug again when the need arises.

It was our first my wife's and my first time in New York.
It was a wonderful stay.
Every day we found out new things and saw new places.

Douglas is a great host! Very nice friendly and concerned about my needs . If you have any problems, please talk to him he will settle and leave you as comfortable as possible .
The room is great place for you to store your things . It has Wi-Fi internet and TV in the room . Furthermore the room has heating and in my case it was not necessary to sleep with blanket. He let me use the kitchen and its appliances ( microwave, fridge , cutlery , cups, plates , etc. ) . The bathroom is very clean and ideal for cold days NYC hot water. He gave me the keys to be able to enter the apartment and thus could freely visit NYC .
We had great conversations about life in the U.S. . The neighborhood is very safe and quiet great to sleep at night after a long day visiting Manhattan . The apartment is right next to the train station metro D.

A tip for when you are staying with Douglas . It comes out very early to work and this also sleep early so do not make noise when back street at night ok ? Douglas is very cool and have all the respect for their guests .

Certainly am staying with Douglas next visit to NYC .

Douglas é um ótimo anfitrião! Muito simpático agradável e preocupado com minhas necessidades. Se você tiver algum problema ou dúvida fale com ele que ele irá resolver e deixar você o mais confortável possível. 
O quarto é grande com lugar para você guardar suas coisas. Ele tem internet Wi-fi  e TV no quarto. Além disto o quarto possui aquecimento e no meu caso não foi necessário dormir com cobertor. Ele me deixou usar a cozinha e seus utensílios (microondas, geladeira,  talheres, copos, pratos e etc). O banheiro é limpo e com muita água quente ideal para os dias frios de NYC.  Ele me deu as chaves para poder entrar no apartamento e com isto pude visitar livremente NYC.
Tivemos ótimas conversas acerca da vida nos EUA. O Bairro é muito seguro e silencioso ótimo para dormir a noite depois de um longo dia de visita a Manhattan. O apartamento esta bem próximo a estação de metro do trem D. 

Uma dica para você quando estiver hospedado com Douglas. Ele sai muito cedo para trabalhar e por isto também dorme cedo então não faça barulho quando voltar da rua a noite ok? Douglas é muito legal e deve ter todo o respeito dos seus hóspedes.

Certamente me hospedarei com Douglas na próxima visita a NYC.

A nice, large and clean room with a good bed in The Bronx/Manhattan. Use of kitchen and bathroom, WiFi and TV. Douglas is a very kind man, even brought me to the airport because my plane was leaving very early. I found it noisy but I live in a well insulated building. Bought ear plugs and then slept perfect. I had a pleasant stay!
Douglas, was an awesome host. Very friendly and  hospitable. The apartment was super clean and the train was extremely close. I would highly recommend his place for your next stay in the city.

I had a very good experience staying at Douglas' place. The room is very spacious and clean. Radiators provided plenty of heat. The neighborhood is a different experience but it is a very friendly neighborhood and I always felt safe. His place is a short walk to the subway station with B and D line, taking about 30 mins to get downtown. It took about 1.5 hours to get to JFK (B/D - E - airtrain) but the train transfers were relatively painless with minimal walking and stairs. The convenience was good especially since I was traveling with large bags. Also, there were elevators up to the apartment so again, no hoisting luggage up and down flights of steps. I would definitely stay here again.

I found "my home" in New York, a large room clean, with a large TV wifi internet,with a small breakfast included and  just 1 block from metro station stop,and in 20 minutes  you get to the 59th, and the "plus" of this choice is Douglas. a good person. So when I return in New York I know where go.Super recommended.

This is the perfect place to stay, if you need to be in the city for a few days.  Douglas is a great host, and was very accommodating.  The room is large and there is wifi and tv.  Especially for the price this is a great place!

I had a great stay here! It was cozy and roomy for a new york apartment. It is close to a couple of convenience stores and a short walk to the metro. I stayed here for an interview nearby and a short vacation while I was here. I am a poor college student so I didn't want to spend money on a hotel room if I was only going to sleep in it. I spent most of the day out in NYC so this place really was perfect and very inexpensive. There is a heater and you can have full access to the kitchen and bathroom. Douglas also leaves food our for you for the morning as he starts his days early. I didn't run into him much as I am on a college wake/sleep cycle.

The photos do not do the room justice at all. There are two closets and a lot of shelf and hanging space all around the room. He also provides hangers for you to use. I didn't know this and brought my own to hang my interview clothes, but he does offer a lot of things that a hotel does. There is an iron and ironing board, a hairdryer, ample outlets, shelves, hangers, free wi-fi, a TV, and a full-sized mirror. I am sure I am leaving things out but it was really much better than I expected, especially for the price.

I had a great time at Douglas place! I felt very welcome eventhough I didnt see him very much. 
The room is very spacious and the bed was very comfortable. I liked the neighborhood because it is different from Manhattan or Brooklyn and I always felt very safe.
I would come back any time.
It was so great! Not only Douglas is so nice and kind But it is also reasonable price. I will definitely recommend this place for my friends.
Nice place and very good price. Plus Douglas was so helpful he got us a subway map and helped us finding an ice rink in the city. It is really the place to be if you are travelling low budget.

Douglas is a great person - really helpful and a great host.
The place is only few minutes from the D and B subway line, which makes it really convenient. There is a supermarket (and Rite-Aid) right across the street, so if you are for a long stay you can buy groceries and cook at the place. 
The neighborhood is very nice, quite and safe. It is a Hispanic neighborhood so you'll get a chance to practice your Spanish. 
Great place for a very affordable price.
I stayed a few days, everything was good, quiet, clean, not far from subway. Douglas is very friendly. Best wishes for him.

Douglas is so nice and friendly!  Unlike some airbnb places that feel like living in a busy college dorm, staying with Douglas feels like living with one very quiet and respectful roommate.  Large room; fast wifi; full kitchen; good bathroom, although the hot water can be totally erratic (keeping the shower at very low pressure helps).  As others have mentioned, the radiator and pipes do make frequent whooshing noises, but nothing too bad.  Overall: this is a very good bargain, with a great host.

Very nice bedroom, Douglas is a very good friendly guy. 
He gave me advices on subway lines. 
I highly recommend this apartment. 
Thanks a lot Douglas.

Nice, clean room with tv, wi-fi and big, comfy bed. Good location, close to Subway D and 4, witch are connected with Manhattan. Close to supermarkets. And Douglas. He is perfect host. Because my cancel flight I was in his apartment on 2.30 at night. With any problems at check in. Airlines also lost my luggage with my winter clothes. And he gave me his hot sweater and jacket. Very helpfull and nice man. Highly, highly recommended!

Douglas is the best ever.
Respectful and calm. You get everything you need during your stay and even more.
He is careful and friendly and the flat has perfect location to public transportation.
Laundry and Grocery can be found in few steps around. Neighbours are also great and quiet.
So you will certainly get what you paid for.

What can I say about Douglas that already hasn't been said?!? The guy is awesome and very accommodating to your needs. The room is spacious. VERY SPACIOUS! Super quiet neighborhood and friendly neighbors. If Douglas is still on airbnb when I'm in NYC city again, I'll definitely be staying here, with no hesitation. Thanks Mr. DeLeon :)

The location is great, very clean and quiet. The bed is very comfortable. Bathroom very clean, good shower with exellent water temperature. Safe location very close to the lines 4 and D subway. Grocery stores, pharmacies, restaurants nearby. Douglas is the best! Recommend, helped me in many things, had patience with my bad English. This is the best place in the Bronx!

I was more than comfortable staying in Douglas' apartment, as I imagine anyone would be.  The place is quiet and easily accessible from the subways (both the 4 & D trains will take you right there, about a 35-45 min ride from lower Manhattan), the bed is cozy, and all amenities you could need are provided (TV, fast internet, clean sheets & towels, soap, coffee, filtered water).  The entire apartment is quite clean and you can tell Douglas makes a concerted effort to keep it that way.  Additionally, Douglas is a truly generous, gracious & respectful host, and an all-around good person.  He gave me excellent tips & advice for my time spent in the bright lights of the big city.  I am truly grateful to him for opening his home to me, and there's no way you're going to find a more reasonable price this close to Manhattan.
Douglas is really nice and helpful, he offered tips on what to do in NY and the room is great!
Excellent host.  Very accomodating and caring.  The place itself is an older building but the room is really big and nice.

It was a fantastic travel and Douglas has done much to this : very welcoming, helpful and nice, and in addition to that the room was great. The district is safe and quiet, and the subway is only 3 minutes by foot! If you want to save money, go to Douglas's place, you won't be disappointed!
Very good experience. No problem with communication, public traffic, close vicinity.
Great visit in new York !,,,, Douglas was great host!,,
Simple and good. I really recommend it!

Douglas was great, very welcoming and kind. The flat was clean and even had a TV and food for me. I contacted him last minute and he replied within minutes and he got a friend to take me to the flat.
Thanks Douglas
If you look for a confortable and unexpensive place to stay in NYC, this is a very good solution. The apt. is clean, room is large, and Douglas is a very corteous host!

Douglas is a great and very welcoming host! He picked me up at the subway station and invited me to a very healthy juice made by himself. The room was clean and definitely met my needs. If you are looking for a not that expensive place to stay in NYC, I would recommend you to stay with Douglas.
房东很友善｡房间空间也大,适合我在地板上堆东西｡

Douglas was great!!  He is very welcoming and even greeted us with umbrellas since it was raining when we arrived.  He offered to let us use his kitchen and fridge and even had items ready for us to use.  His wifi & cable work perfectly.  His place is only about 3 blocks from the 4 train to Manhattan (about 15-25 min depending on your stop).  It's also close to the D train.  His place is very clean and the building is very quiet.  If you've never been to NYC, don't be surprised by the trash in the neighborhood (It's not like Douglas can clean up the Bronx by himself).  I would advise staying on Grand Concourse on your walks home; there are just more people around and it was more comfortable than taking the back roads (**girl's perspective).  We came in around 1230-1AM often and never had any issues.  Do try to stay quiet since Douglas works early; he is very quiet in the mornings so it's only fair to do the same for him.  We actually only saw him when we picked up the keys and were able to communicate through AirBnB after that.  :)

Thanks Douglas for a really great stay! The room is just as described - big, comfortable and clean. Douglas was very welcoming and helpful - a wonderful introduction to the Bronx. Subway is close with easy access into Manhattan. All around I definitely recommend!
The reservation was canceled 5 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

We had 10 great days in Douglas' apartment. His place is quiet, clean and easily accessible from the subways (both the 4 & D trains). The room is very big and is just like in the pictures. We had TV, fast internet, acces to all the kitchen facilities, clean sheets & towels, soap, coffee, filtered water - well everything. We did not see Douglad much during our stay, but he seems very nice and generous - as an example he brought us a lot of fruit for our breakfast. If we ever go back to NY we will definetely stay with Douglas again!
It is very easy to go to  the subway.The house is small but ok for staying for several days.

Douglas was an AMAZING host! He provided very good directions on finding the location. 
The room was very comfortable and clean. There is plenty of shelf and closest space provided. There is also an air conditioner and t.v. In the room. 
Douglas also provided coffee, fruit and bread which was a very nice touch. 
The location is great because it's two blocks from the train and a 15 minute train ride to Manhattan. 
Overall a great experience and I will definitely be staying here again when I return to NYC.

I really enjoyed staying at Douglas Apartment. The room was large with a huge and comfy kingsize bed. There was also a TV and Wi-Fi and a well working A/C if it was too hot.
Douglas is a great host. I met him twice, but he was friendly and explained everything. I would stay at this room again, if I ever visit NY.

Douglas was really nice and looked after us well. The room was huge very clean and had good air con. Just be wary that the Bronx can be a little dodgy at night so dont plan on coming home too late. Just be alert and the apartment is a 1 min walk down the main road from the subway so its all fine. For the money you save staying out of manhatten this room is well worth it.
Douglas is very helpful and i had a nice week in his flat. Its very near to the Subway only 2 minutes.

Had a very enjoyable 2 week stay in New York at Douglas's apartment in the Bronx. The location was convenient being a few minutes walk from several subway lines and also various grocery and other stores, takeaways and launderettes. 

Douglas himself is a busy person but was very friendly and also very helpful when the occasion demanded. In particular Douglas helped me to locate and then get my suitcase delivered from JFK Airport, after it had somehow missed my flight from Europe arriving on the following day's flight.

Should i be in New York again i would definitely like to stay at Douglas's apartment.

It's really near subway,maybe only 1 min walk. But if you want to go downtown,it may take some time.Enough space for luggage,large and comfy bed. He is nice and offer enough privacy for guests. His place is a good choice for backpackers.Should be careful if you're a girl.
Douglas was a very hospitable host. Very near D train and 4 tran stations. Huge room too.
Great place to stay. Clean and very close to 2 different subway lines.  Onlt ran into Douglas once but he was very friendly.  Great price for NYC.  Would stay again in a return trip to New York.

Douglas was a great host always around to help. The. place was simply great it was as described a quite well lit large room that was only around 20-30 minutes to Manhattan using the express lines (subway just a 5 min walk away).

Douglas was a very welcoming host and did little extra things to make me feel welcome. It was nice after a long trip to have towel and soap laid out. The place is about 3 blocks from the nearest subway which with heavy bags is a bit annoying. Once I got use to the location, it was a good base to explore New York.

The room was exactly how he described. It is huge and very clean. The room was ready for me with clean bed and towel when I got there. The neighborhood is quite, but if you're traveling alone and female I wouldn't say it is too safe to walk alone at night, but everywhere in NYC is like that especially Bronx. 
Douglas was very kind and helpful when you need him. You can reach him easily through email or texts. The subway station is close by about couple blocks away.

It was a very comfortable place to stay. Very large room, as was shown in the picture, and very quite. You can reach to the down town very easily with the subway line D. The subway station is quite near. 

Douglas was a very nice and kind host. No issues about inconvenience or un-comfortableness while I was staying there. I highly recommend to others!

I would really like to appreciate the hospitality and kindness of Douglas. I really enjoyed my stay in his apartment. He is very kind  person and provided all the essential things for the breakfast. Also the stop is very near to his accomodation (almost 2-3 minutes walk).
I strongly recommend every one to stay in his place while you go to Newyork.
Douglas war ein sehr zuverlässiger und diskreter Gastgeber. Ich empfehle die Unterkunft weiter.
Douglas was an excellent host and provided easy to access immaculate accommodation. He was absolutely friendly and respected privacy and the occassional chat. Would love to stay here again

I had a wonderful 3 night stay at Douglas' place! He is a really nice, welcoming and open person and he'll make sure you have a good time during your stay. I've been in the city the whole time and he's at work most of the time but when we met we had a good time and once sat together and shared some ice cream. He always bought something small for breakfast for me and was extremely flexible concerning the dates of my trip!
Most important for most of you probably is to know whether the area is safe. I can only speak for myself but I never was in a strange situation or felt afraid while I was there. Plus, the subway station is really close to the apartment! However, I am a tall guy and I can imagine that for some younger girl this might be different. But if you're self confident enough this is an appropriate place to stay. 
The apartment is not new and there's some things that don't look nice but I'm sure this is not what all of us were looking for.
The kitchen offers anything you might need to cook which is a great advantage as well. 

I hope you will enjoy your stay as much as I did!

Douglas did everything to make our stay comfortable, we could use all his kitchen equipment and he even provided us food for breakfast and to make sandwiches. He is a very discreet man and respected our privacy, so it really felt like having an apartmet for ourselves. The neighbourhood is well connected to the subway system, it is about 20-30 minutes to Manhattan and cheap supermarkets are in a close reach. 
Thank you for our great time in New York!
good place to stay, host is a really nice person! Easy to get by subway

My stay with Douglas was very cool. Even when he was not at home due to his job, he did everything he could to help me in my trip to New York. He gave me advice on what to do and how to use public transportation. I never had a problem in the neighborhood, and they are plenty of food stores one or two blocks away. Definitely recommend staying with Douglas.
It's a good place for explore NY.  Also Douglas was so nice and friendly. The room is like the photo.

Dauglas is a really nice host. He is very helpful and kind during my trip. He offers some small breakfast everyday. Dauglas is not at home very often because of his work. There are two subway stations nearby within 10 min walk distance. I would say Dauglas' place is very affordable and comfortable to stay.

This property was exactly how it was described on the listing. Douglas went out of his way to make my stay the best it could be with advice, best way to use the subway and a complimentary light breakfast. This place is perfect for a seasoned traveler who is looking for a place to sleep and a hot shower. The room is huge and had plenty of storage and a big screen tv. I was worried about staying in the Bronx, but no one bothered me and the metro ride was only 20 minutes into the city. I'd stay here again. The subway station is two blocks away and is manned 24 hours a day.

Douglas is a great host. The apartment is very clean and comfortable. He even bought some breakfast for me and also, provided some useful informations about New York city. 

The place is worthy for your money and I highly recommend it.

Just like others said the host is a really nice guy. Provided me the ingredients for breakfasts, provided access to the apartment.
The subway is a couple of blocks away.
The heating system was quite noisy, but the ear plugs solved that problem.

I have spent sixs days in the Place of Douglas. The room was like in the pictures and the Location is pretty well connected with the subway. For people with a low budget it's a great place to stay. Besides that, Douglas is a respectful person and provides you a comfortable privacy. I enjoyed the stay.

Doug was a great host with a big heart. Unfortunately I only stayed 2 nights with him, but I really enjoyed his company. He was so kind to pick me up from the street, since his place is a little tricky to find. He shared his groceries with me, we had a good conversation and he really was interested in what I was doing and what living in Germany is like. He's open minded and interested in different cultures.
His apartement is very nice. I liked it a lot. No fancy stuff. If you wanna experience hard working, down to earth New York, that's the place to be.
I can't say much about the neighborhood. I just went from the subway station to his apartement and back. It's only 5 minutes. The subway will take you in 15 Minutes to Uptown Manhattan.
I strongly recommend staying with Doug.

First let me say that Douglas is a very kind, friendly and honest person.  I had trouble locating the key, but that kind of thing happens.  Douglas was kind enough to come and meet me and even help with my heavy bag.
  He bought rolls for my use in the morning.   The room was fine.  It was large by NY standards, but oh so comfortable.  The pillows and mattress felt better than mine at home. I had complete privacy because I only saw Douglas a couple of times when I needed to convey or receive information. It might not be detailed clean, but it was absolutely passable for the price.  The linens were fresh and adequately available.  There is a nice TV that comes with the room.  It requires a little manipulation of the antennae, but I was able to receive adequate channels and some news.
 The subway is about 2 blocks away.  You can catch the D train and go all the way downtown without a transfer.  You can catch the D train and go to 125th street for transfer to the M60 bus to Laguardia.  If you are new to NY and going to be there for a few days, I recommend the 7 day unlimited pass.  Feel free to get lost and see all you can see without worry of exact change or taking the wrong train.  Plan 30 minutes to get into Manhattan from  Douglas's stop.
  I felt safe in the neighborhood and I visited several of the little markets for coffee and bagles.  There is also a restaurant down the hill called Caridad.  I had a bountiful meal there for $7.99 and it was also very good.  Their fresh orange juice was extreme.
I was so glad to have stayed with Douglas.  It allowed me to take full advantage of the city, knowing I had a safe place to return at night and I didn't spend big $$$ for a room that was only used for sleeping and bathing.
After I left, I realized that I had left my phone in the bedroom and couldn't get back in.  I think Douglas works 12 hours per day.  I called him that night from home in FL.  He generously offered to expedite shipping it to me at no cost.  I hope there is no rule saying you can't tip a host, because he deserves it.
This is my second stay at Douglas place and again it was very nice, just like others are saying. He didn't leave feedback, however.

Douglas and the apartment were both great! Although I didn't see him often (because I would sleep in and then return late), he was a very courteous host. Every morning I would notice the trash was thrown out, and when I would do the dishes in the morning before leaving and leave them out to dry, I would come back to see that they were already put away. The room was very large, as described in the title and as shown in the photos, and the apartment itself was conveniently located just a few mins walk from 170 St Station on the D and B line, while just around 10 mins walk from Mt Eden Ave Station on the 4 line. Much better choice than an (overpriced) hotel. Overall, it was an amazing first Airbnb experience for me, and I would definitely book with Douglas again!

Ótimo anfitrião!
A localização é muito boa , na mesma calçada do metro,anda apenas um minuto.
Fiquei muito satisfeito!!!

Douglas is very nice and considerate. The room is big, and the bathroom is just next door. A few steps away is the subway station which can directly to to downtown. There are grocery and restaurants nearby. Very convenient!

Douglas was a very kind and considered host! The room is spacious, although there isn't that much furniture. There is however a nice t.v. present! We could use the kitchen to store and prepare food, which was handy. The location is rather off-centre, but using the subway the centre could be reached in a reasonable time.
This apartment was as described and Douglas was very helpful in providing me with what I needed. I came late the first night and he made sure to help me into my room.

Thank you, Douglas!!!
You're an amazing host that allows us leaving our luggage before check-in and after check-out. 
My dad,my brother and me were happy staying with you.
It's a very good experience with Douglas.
He was so helpful to me. Everything was perfect. Thanks for having me!
The place is in Bronx but no more than 2mins of walk from the metro. Douglas was very helpful and friendly!
Douglas is a very kind host! Very welcoming! The place is near a Metro Station and a big boulevard, very nice big room and apartment! Clean! All I needed!
It was a very good experience live here. Douglas is a super kind gentleman. The private room is very large and everything is convenient.

Douglas is a very kind host, and his flat is located in a large apartment building not far from a metro station in the southern Bronx. The room is surprisingly big, with the window facing the inner yard, which reduces the noise level. There's a kitchen and a bathroom. The visit was very smooth and everything felt very professional.
Douglas responds fast to messages; I had to leave the apartment before he returned back from work, and it was easy to arrange a drop-off of the keys -- thanks !
For me as an adult male, I had only positive experiences in the quarter and felt safe. For first-time visitors to NY, do research the location in advance to deciding.
I can give my warmest recommendations to Douglas :).

Parempaa ja kiltimpää vuokraisäntää ei olisi voinut saada. Huolehti siitä että minulla on aamiaistarpeita jääkaapissa ja että kaikki toimi hyvin. Huone oli lupauksen mukaisesti suuri ja siisti. Ilmainen nettiyhteys ja iso tv. En kaipaa matkoillani luksusta, vain hiljaista paikkaa nukkumiseen. Yhteydet kaupungilta hyvät ja toimivat, lähimpään metroon 300 metriä. Olen äärettömän tyytyväinen valintaani, mikäli olisin majoittunut keskustaan, olisi Bronx koko sen karuudessaan ja kauneudessaan jäänyt kokematta.
I ace stayed with Douglas once before and it was as before a great experience, allowing me to feel at home from the start; great.

Séjour de deux nuit dans l'appartement de Douglas dans le Bronx et pour ce prix, rien à redire ;)
Chambre spacieuse, internet, cuisine, climatiseur...

In english, perfect for young travellers !

I had a wonderful stay at Douglas's apartment. Doug is a very kind and generous host---he provided everything I needed  and made me feel very welcoming as a guest. The location is pretty good and convenient, too! Highly recommended for all the NYC visitors!

Douglas was a great host. The room is big and has a television and air conditioning. His apartment is clean and close to subway station. It takes around 20 minutes to downtown. I had a good time there. Thank you Douglas!

Thanks Douglas, you are such a nice host! I enjoyed my stay very much. The huge room is quiet and comfortable with aircondition. It is only 3 mins away from subway. I live in Berlin, so I had no problems walking around the streets even at night. highly recommendable!
Douglas was incredibly kind and generous during my visit and made me feel comfortable and at home. The bed was comfortable, the room was spacious, and it was walking distance to Yankee Stadium!

Jeg boede hos Douglas i ca 1 uke. Har kun positivt å si om oppholdet. Han er en god vert der får deg til å føle deg hjemme. Både min ankomst og avgang til NY var litt besverlige pga sene og tidlige tider men Douglas tok dette på strak arm og fulgte meg enda til metroen kl 3 om natten. Synes vi fikk god kontakt på et mer personligt plan, da Douglas byr på seg selv og gjør netopp airbnb til det perfekte konsept for solo reisende og folk der ønsker mer av sin reise enn et anonymt hotellrom

My host made me feel welcome, and reply very fast to any txt; he provided also breakfast for me as cereal, bananas, bagels, jam and coffee/tea. The neighbourhood is predominant hispanic and you get the feeling of the real New York as a multi culture city
Very nice host. We appreciate the breakfast prepared for us. Location is convenient to Metro station.

Douglas was an excellent host. He was very friendly and willing to go out of his way to accommodate me during my stay. His apartment is very close to the subways so getting around New York was not a problem. I highly recommend Doug as a host.
Douglas was an excellent host.  The room was very comfortable, and he was very friendly.  I would recommend staying with him to anyone.

Douglas was seldom there, but when around he made sure all my needs were met if I had any. The space was clean and quite in my favorite area in the Bronx which is located conveniently between both the 4 and D trains. There's a vizio flat screen tv with cable for your use, a comfy bed, an area to place your clothes and on hot days an a.c. No need to travel far for a bite to eat, shopping or barbers b/c all these things come in abundance on 170st. I had a great time.
Great location, and very big room. Douglas was a great host providing breakfast for our mornings. Perfect place to come home to after long day walking around the city.

El apartamente está muy cerca del metro, que funciona todo el día. La línea D alcanza el centro de Manhattan en 30 minutos o menos. La línea 4 se puede tomar a unas 5 cuadras. La habitación es muy amplia, en los días de calor el aire acondicionado funcionó perfecto. La cocina está equipada en caso de querer cocinar -hay heladera y refrigerador-, y hay lugares para comprar comida y bebida cerca. El baño funcionaba perfectamente. Douglas fue muy amable y dejaba frutas y jugos para el desayuno. El barrio era como donde vivo, me sentí muy cómodo. Las personas del edificio muy amables. Si vuelvo a NY, seguramente me quede ahí de nuevo.

The room was very spacious and the localization was great super near the subway stations. Douglas was really great, even bought us fruits and bread for breakfast. We loved the experience of staying there and recommend it to everybody! Thank you Douglas :)

Douglas is a very friendly, warmhearted host who helps you with each problem you could have when it's your first trip to the Big Apple. The room is neat and pretty large, the next subway station less than 5min afar. Most things you need for your daily life are just around the corner e.g. super markets, pharmacies, restaurants and a laundrotmat.
I can recommend this room to everyone who wants to explore the city (it's just about 20min to Times Square when using the express trains).
Thanks for everything, Douglas and take care ;D
Douglas was a great host, I felt right at home. The room was as described and very comfortable, I would stay here again on my next trip to NYC if it's available..

Douglas was really helpful and I found the apartment no problem, it is very close to the 170 D line subway, and pretty close also to the 4 line. The apartment is exactly as it appears in the photos, it is really quite big for a room in New York, Douglas left some bananas, bagels and coffee each morning, which was a good way to start the day.

Douglas is a great host who graciously accomodated my early arrival time. Room is large and clean. He also provided soap and a towel for showers, bananas and bagels for breakfast. Close to the D and 4 subway lines. There is a decent range of food on East 170th St and E Mt Eden Rd. Good stay overall. Recommended.

Douglas is a very nice man with a clean apartment in a nice-looking house. I met him on my arrival and departure and he made sure I had everything I needed - even provided some cereals, bagels and fruits for breakfast. 
The room was large, as described, but not as void as the picture suggests: The windows have dark red curtains, there is a big flatscreen TV, a shelf and a couch. The bed is wide, very comfortable and there is a small side table next to it. The bathroom right next door is small but has what you need. Clean towels were provided. 
The house is just 3 minutes away from a subway stop, but it takes a while to get to central / lower Manhattan. I felt safe walking to and from the subway stop, even at night.
The apartment smelled like cleaning agents - probably not recommendable for sensitive noses. I did not hear any noise though (stayed Sun-Tue). 
The price is unbeatable for what you get. I would stay again!

After a difficult task of getting the keys and then scruffy finding the property, Douglas was a great host. Really friendly and welcoming. He provided me with breakfast items and water and left me alone to get on with things.
The apartment is ok. It's certainly not what you'd call luxury but for the price it was fine.
The area is what you'd expect from the Bronx. I didn't feel too comfortable walking around at night but then I'm not used to the area.
Once I'd worked out the public transport system it was easy to get in and out of Manhattan - about 30 minutes to downtown - although the trains were very busy.
All in all a cheap and cheerful place to stay when visiting New York.

Douglas is a very nice & helpful host. His apartment is clean & short distance to the subway & 30minutes to Time Square. The water heater is an issue as it may turn cold or hot, not easy to adjust to it especially during cold winter. Overall, it is really good to stay with him & will book his place again if we come to New York. Thanks Douglas

Douglas was extremely hospitable and nice. The bedroom was spacious and clean. Clean sheets, towels and blanket. Near to most major subway stations. There were bananas, biscuits and bagels plus coffee for breakfast. Although bronx is a relatively dangerous area, this apartment is on main grand concourse and you should be okay as long as you keep your wits about you and don't do anything stupid.
Douglas was an excellent host.  The bed was comfortable and the place was quiet.  I could come and go as I pleased and the location was very convenient being close to the 4 and the D line.

房東人非常好,我改行程少住一天也都退我錢,提供早餐貝果跟自行取用他的咖啡｡衛浴其實用品都很充足,也有一條大浴巾,不過我因為攜帶了自己的,不常使用｡
房間一如所描述的非常大,三人入住絕對沒問題,我一人住住的非常愉悅｡
Bronx都是黑人多,這棟公寓也多半都是黑人居住,不過我個人認為不用擔心害怕,因為就我觀察很多是家庭形式帶著小孩,並且公寓離地鐵站非常近,夜間晚歸不用步行很長時間｡公寓位置有兩線地鐵站,基本上要去曼哈頓都非常方便,東側西側各有合適的線可以選擇,到曼哈頓中城約30-40分鐘｡
相當好的住宿體驗

Douglas was a great host. The apartments location was strategically located near the subway line. The room was clean, got wifi and huge tv. Good and working bathroom, I just had problem adjusting the shower control both hot and cold but it was just a minor glitch. Got a good breakfast like banana, bread, cereals and coffee. Thank you again Douglas!
This place is good and close to the busway station. The building is old enough, though. However, Douglas is friendly and helpful. It's a good place, given the price.

100 % satisfaction. Douglas was very nice, pleasant and communicative. Grand concourse is "TOP 11-20 NYC must see", and there is no better way to experience it than staying at Douglas apt. The walk from D line 170st subway stop (NW exit on 171st) is very very short, less than 2 minutes. And I believe that this walk is also safer than most of the Brooklyn as the house is right on the Grand concourse, which is one of those parts of NYC that never sleeps :) This was my best out of 7 different AirBnB experiences in NYC when it comes for value for money, but it had 3 minor downsides compared to other options to stay which I did not mind, but may be worthwhile sharing: 1. it was pretty cold in the room when cold weather came on Jan 4 (I slept well after I put my hoody on, and used my winter jacked as the second blanket), 2. there is mould (black fungus) in the bath which is no problem at all when it comes to hygiene, but mostly a visual problem which some girls and women may however find very disturbing, 3. the choice of take away food and grocery stores is very limited, and surprisingly Bronx is almost as expensive as mid Mahattan in this regards. But for wise travellers who buy the take away food in Brooklyn and eat it in the Sunset park (the best view of Manhattan), and end up their days in NYC on the Times sq., this will be a very pleasant experience especially if travelling before late night hours, as the D train is super fast from Times sq. to Bronx as long as it is on the express track (up to cca. 11pm I guess). I always dreant of staying right on the Grand Concourse, and am very thankful to Douglas for this listing, for being such a pleasant hist and so communicative before my arrival, and for opportunity to finally experience a lot of Bronx - even though I always prefer a different place to stay for a new experience as a solo traveller, when I first come with 1-3 friends Douglases apt. will be the first option whose availability I will check.
Great host. Would love being back at Douglas place in NY. Recommend this for short stay in NY.
It is great place. The room is so big. Almost four people can sleep in here. And Douglas is so kind and good person.

I enjoyed my trip to NYC. 
Douglas was a very kind and courteous person. 
The room was really big, the bed big and it was quite quiet. 
The Bronx isn't a bad neighborhood, like it first expected. 
The subway is really close and it is a short ride to Manhattan. 
Thanks Douglas.

Douglas is charm personified with a welcome smile and a winning room that he generously offers through Airbnb.  This accommodation is in the generous proportions of what I now think of as 'old NY' and, as such, certainly deserves to be cherished.  Certainly I will look forward to a return visit.  Of that there can be no question.  Thanks Douglas for ALL.
Douglas is soooo nice. I love him!!!!
e' un  uomo molto generoso  ed ospitale

Great place, conveniently located, quiet building, amazing host. 
Highly recommended if you are looking for a deal. As others have noted, Douglas is very helpful, kind, thoughtful and a great host in all ways. He let me leave my bike at his place for a few extra days and helped me with my bags when I arrived.  Plus it's one of the best deals in New York City.
Douglas was a great host.  The apartment is super close to transit.  Free coffee, bananas, wifi and a big room close to Manhattan; perfect.

Great experience all round, place was easy to find with Douglas' instructions, he's a very hospitable host and even bought me some fruit which was I was extremely grateful for after my 10 hour train to New York. 10/10 would stay again
Bairro muito tranquilo com estação do metrô ao lado comércios bem próximos também.

Douglas is really helpful and will make your trip convenient. The appartment is located 25 mn to Time Square by train. The bedroom is really big (the bed too). The bathroom is acceptable.  In other words, a big deal for a short trip in NYC.
Douglas was kind and accommodating.  The listing description was accurate. Great value for a large, private room close to the subway. I would stay again.
Douglas is very sweet and accommodating. I felt very safe and comfortable with him. The neighborhood is quiet and his apartment is course to the D And 4 trains. I highly recommend staying here!

This has been my second time staying with Douglas, who is a complete gentleman. It felt like coming home to stay with a relative who was seldom there, but always made sure there were fresh fruit and pastries in the kitchen each morning. The picture depicted is exactly what you will get. You'll find a bed, night stand, an a.c unit, flat screen tv and a set of shelves on the wall to place whatever you like or to simply air dry something. The place is nice tidy with a bathroom full of bottled shampoos and soaps if you forgot to bring. The price for what you get is unbeatable. I will have to discuss with my friend about possibly a little decor added to the room which I feel would warm it up a bit and add some color. I grew up in this neighborhood which you will find everything you need and the trains are right outside. Perfect. Gracias a ti Douglas
Douglas is a very nice host, made us feel like home, definetely I would come back to his place when I return to NYC.

Douglas is a great host! The room is big and it also has Wifi, big HDTV and Air Conditioner... 30 minutes train from manhattan and the subway station is 2 blocks away... Douglas is rarely at the house so there is a lot of privacy...He cares to have bottled water, muffins, bananas, milk, coffee, bread, so you probably won´t have to worry about breakfast... If you are looking for an affordable place to crash at night, this is a great option!
I really enjoyed staying there. It was quiet, safe and clean.

Good things about the location:
1515 Grand Concourse is pretty convenient, the 4 and D trains take you to middle or lower west Manhattan within 30mins. Pretty good price for an apartment that's not too far off! It is particularly close to the 170th st D train station, just a mere 2 blocks away. There is a large pharmacy, a Subway sandwich store and several other delis/eateries nearby.

This part of the Bronx is very safe. I returned home around midnight with no issues. Lots of families in the area and kids playing out late at 11pm which are good indications of general safety. 

Good things about host and amenities:
Douglas works long hours so he's rarely home during the weekdays. Nevertheless, he is very responsive to requests, and very generous and friendly as a person. Breakfast foods and bottled water are stocked every morning so you don't have to go out for breakfast. You are also free to use the fridge and cook your own food. 

The room is very spacious (there's actually space for 2 queen sized beds and then some) and comes with air conditioning and cable TV which was something nice to come home to. Pillows and bedsheets are freshly washed and comfortable. 

Things to take note of:
The apartment is clean enough for its unbeatable price, but it is not entirely dust/dirt free. Most people don't mind it, I'm just highlighting this for individuals, who like me, have sensitive skin, to come prepared. 

No washing machine for laundry, although this issue is easily solved by just heading to the nearby laundromats on 170th st.

Douglas is a very nice and humble host. He provides AC, TV with cable, Wifi and even coffee and some snacks for breakfast. Neighborhood is lively so you're never walking alone feeling unsafe. The place is a block away from the train station which is incredibly convenient.
He is kind and room is very big and comfortable~

Douglas' room is big, relatively comfortable and clean. Don't expect a hotel room, though. It is a nice, cost beneficial place to sleep and not much else. The air conditioning works very well.
Douglas is a gentle and reliable person. I had a nice time with him, even if none of us would stay at home during the day.
The apartment is located near a subway station. It is very easy to get to Manhattan from there. The neighborhood itself was of no problem to me, but I didn't feel comfortable to stay outside after night. 
In summary, I had a pleasant stay. The room is cheap and access to Manhattan is simple. It's just what I needed as a low budget traveler.

Douglas is extremely friendly and considerate. The check in process was very very smooth. His apartment is only a 2 min walk away from the nearest metro station, and felt safe walking at night. The room is very spacious and clean, and the air conditioner worked perfectly in the summer heat! Thank you for your hospitality, Douglas!

Douglas was a very nice host, very helpful and was easy to talk to. His place might not be extravagant but he provided me with a large room with a TV, AC, and a fairly comfortable bed. He provided coffee and some snacks as well. Thank you, Douglas!

Douglas was a great host.
The room was as described and pictured.
Pretty good choice in New York.
About 35 min to Times Square by subway.
Very open and available. I already recommended him to some of my friends. I will be if possible, booking from him again. Thanks Douglas.

Séjour de 17 nuits chez Douglas. La chambre est spatieuse et bien équipée. Une excellente affaire niveau Qualité/prix !
Ce quartier du Bronx est très sûr. On peux s'y promener sans crainte.
Deux lignes de métros à proximité nous permettant de rejoindre midtown rapidement (train express). Le wifi fonctionne bien. Douglas est un hôte formidable, toujours à l'écoute. Il y a une piscine publique gratuite dans le park situé à deux blocs de l'appartement (Claremont Park). De nombreux commerces à 2 minutes de marche, sur la 170e ainsi Mt Eden Avenue.
Je recommande cette chambre !

Great room, well equipped, for a very low price.  The neighborhood is safe, you can walk anywhere, fearless. Douglas is a very nice host.

Douglas is a wonderful host.He was waiting for me in his apartment although he had to go somewhere else at the moment of my arrival. The room was clean and had everything needed. AC and wireless Internet and very close to the shops and the subway station. I would definitely go back to his apartment if I ever visit New York again.

The room was very large and the accomodations were fine. No living room, small kitchen but with all the necessities. Did not see owner much but he was helpful with everything. Wifi and tv in room work fine. Would recommend. Near subway.

I would compare this accommodation to a hotel. The room is big,the bed and mattress were new and there was a TV and WiFi available..  Douglas is a great host,very kind and thoughtful and he had also left us food and water in the kitchen.I can highly recommend this place to everyone and I wish all other host were like Douglas.
Everything worked fine.  Douglas welcomed me on arrival and all was easy going.

Douglas is very nice and helpful. The room is very spacious. The only issue I've had is that the mattress is wrapped in plastic under the bed sheet. It makes noises while I turn in the night. Otherwise, it is a very good stay in this value.

Ho alloggiato nell appartamento di Douglas 21 giorni, mi sono trovato molto bene, la camera era grande e spaziosa, letto comodo, TV a schermo piatto 40 pollici, armadio, asse e ferro da stiro, wifi molto veloce. Bagno con doccia Ok. La cucina aveva tutto il necessario, Douglas mi ha sempre fatto trovare dolci o frutta per la colazione, è una persona molto ospitale, gentile e socievole, per nulla invadente. La metro si trova a 2 minuti dall appartamento e si raggiunge comodamente Manhattan. Zona tranquilla anche a tarda notte, supermercati a 5 minuti a piedi sulla 167th. Lo consiglio a chi cerca un posto tranquillo dove dormire, non lussuoso ma funzionale.
Fresh towels, fresh sheets, our own TV and room. It was everything we needed!
Overall decent room.
The place is exactly according to the description, the location is good, very close to the train station. Douglas is a very busy person, but always available to help you..
Really great place. Douglas was really kind and also provided breakfast stuff for me. He was generally very helpful and a very kind host.
Douglas's place was great. Quite,calm and very near the subway. He was quite approachable and humble too. Really loved his place and would highly recommend!
It was great, Douglas is very nice and friendly and the room was exactly as in the pictures huge private room,clean and he was approachable at any time

Very large room, fast Wifi, clean bathroom, great host. Area gets a little sketchy when dark but I didn't feel unsafe walking alone. Sheets, towels, and breakfast (bananas, tea, instant coffee) provided. I appreciated the access to the kitchen and microwave-- I used the fridge and freezer to store some food as well. Would stay again!
Big room close to subway in a nice neighborhood. Douglas is a very friendly host.
It is a cozy apartment and very close to the subway.

Big room,  very warm, near the subway (D line) and it takes only 30 minutes to Downtown. Excellent wifi and for you ladies there is a hairdryer. Douglas is vey kind and humble. He is so helpful. He sleeps so early as he wakes up very early, so be nice and considerate when you get back to the flat.  As a female I found the bronx different  than other areas but I have to acknowledge it was safe. The bathroom needs to be cleaner , I'm talking about the mouldy tiles. The building is rustic, there is a lift that takes you up to the flat on the third floor. I would definitely recommend this place and at this rate it is a bargain.

Douglas was a splendid host who went out of his way to make my stay as comfortable as possible, giving me full access to his kitchen and even providing me with breakfast! The room offered more space than I had imagined possible in New York City. His place is very close to the subway station and the D train is very efficient - I could get to Times Square in half an hour. The nearest subway station doesn't have lifts though, so if you're traveling with a lot of heavy luggage, you might want to get off the subway at 161 Street and Uber over to make your life easier, it should cost less than $10. The neighbourhood was quiet at night but well lit and I had no concerns with safety as a solo female traveler. Overall, I would definitely want to return to Douglas's place some day and visit NYC again :)
Was a great place to stay, host is very welcoming and kind. Train stop really close and convenient.

Douglas is such a nice guy and so welcoming and helpful!  He put some things out for breakfast and he even brought me lunch by surprise one day. The room is also huge and the area is pretty quiet and close to the train.
Very Comfortable,  convenient to all, Very Friendly Host in Douglas. He goes Above and Beyond
Douglas's place is great. Clean, and easy to get to via public transportation. Loved that he provided bottles of water, coffee and bread at no additional charge.

Douglas is a wery fine host. The room is nice and big. He gave me the key and i coud come and go as i want. i coud use the kitchen and the bathroom as i want. I can hardly re comment Douglas as a host! I will ask him next time im going to NY.

Doug was a nice enough man, but he wasn't very efficiently communicative on the check-in details (ie, he had the wrong address listed for the key key pick-up in the confirmation itinerary, which was really agitating!)  Also, if you're going to book this place make sure you have a piar of shower sandles, as the tub was REALLY dirty!
Basically, this is the sort of place that the phrase, "ya get what you pay for" was coined, and I am a bit perplexed by all the rave reviews the space got when I was considering booking it.  It wasn't the worst possible place to stay, but it certainly didn't live up to all of the previous positive reviews.
Douglas is a kind man, the appartment is close to the subway 4 and C/D.

This apartment is an excellent budget option to consider, when visiting New York. The guest room is very large, with good internet access, a large-screen TV, and a wonderfully comfortable bed, with new mattress. 

A recent reviewer complained that the apartment was dirty, but this is a little unfair; sure, there is some dust on the skirting boards, and mildew between the bathroom tiles, but the guest room is very clean, and the bed linen and towel provided are freshly laundered. 

Two nearby subway stations provide convenient access to Manhattan, via lines 'D' and '4' (I would recommend the latter, since it is more modern and efficient). 

The area itself is definitely 'gritty', and some people may feel a little uncomfortable after dark, but generally it does seem to be safe. 

Unfortunately I didn't meet Douglas during my stay, since he was out of town, but he made every effort to ensure that I was able to collect the keys, and arrive safely in his apartment.

大致上不錯
就是沒空調風扇
窗戶不太通風
The place was near the Subway station in a very quiet street!
便宜方便
Exactly what I needed for a few days in NYC.
Great place to stay. Only issue was figuring out the shower situation. Hot and cold was confusing. Everything else was perfect

My stay with Douglas couldn't have been better. He was very warm and welcoming from the beginning. He is a very attentive host but also leaves you to your own. 

The room was as described with plenty of space, fast wifi etc. 

The only feedback is that there was some dust on the floors and carpets but the linen and towels were all clean. 

I would recommend staying here as you can't beat it for the price!
It was a great experience to live at Douglas place. Highly Recommended..

I enjoyed staying there very much. It was comfortable, really close to the subway and the amenities like an elevator in the building, AC and a TV were very nice. Douglas is also a very friendly guy. I hope i can stay at his place again when i return.
가격대비 넓은 공간과 지하철역이 바로 옆에 잇어 지하철 타면 맨해튼 지역과 20~30분거리..  아무튼 너무나 저렴햇던 경험 이엇습니다..
Good.

Well, this was my worst Airbnb experience ever. Douglas says he will give information when the booking is made, I had to wait until last minute because he was just not answering me. One night he said two sentences, and then nothing. I feared I would be in NY without a place to sleep and it was terrible. Airbnb stepped in to help, giving him an hour to come back to me otherwise they would find another option. He didnt provide usefull information about the transport, would have been good to know that line B only works weekdays and line D skips stations and don't always go all the way to his neighborhood. It is a bit more then 30 min to the main attractions in Manhattan, took me more the an hour in rush hour. I wouldnt consider this place safe, as I was a white women solo and I can tell you I got some people shouting at me at night (around 10). He didnt mention his building has itps adress on one street, but the adress on another, and it was hard to find. I don't know what kind of hygiene standards people have, but I wouldnt have put food in is fridge, it was really dirty. The bathroom was terrible, dirty (walls, doors, bath...) mold everywhere, silverfish and even killed a cockroach next to the toilet one night, while another one passed by my soap in the shower to get behind a ceramic tile the other night. The only thing I was sure about was that there wouldnt be bug bites, since he left the mattress sealed in the plastic bag. You actually sleep on plastic covered with a sheet. The 2 nights I woke up soaked wet because of that. Douglas didn't take more then a minute to talk to me, is was not friendly and stayed in his room all the time except to eat breakfast. I didnt feel good or welcome at his place, I am glad there was a lock on the door room. The only 2 good things about this was that he provided cold bottles of water and air condition. Otherwise, this is a weekend to forget. I suggest you don't go there, actually, rooms like that are ruining AirBnB's reputation and should not even be advertised on this website. Keep away.

Douglas was a very friendly host.
Hier apartment has everything you need for your stay in New York. The metro is a two-minute walk away. When you have questions, ask him...he tries his best to help you. 
All in all the apartment is top and cheap! Thanks Douglas for beeing my host in New York.
