name: *Sunrise Studio*Sunrise and Ocean view!
summary: Beautiful, cozy, private, spacious and simple(not a full kitchen) studio in an open country hillside location. Studio has part ocean view with a private patio with a full ocean view. +Close to Onomea Scenic Route,Botanical Gardens,and Akaka Falls +50 minutes to Volcano National Park. +15 minutes to Hilo Airport.  *Message us for questions or interest in certain dates. Price ranges may be flexible on certain dates.  *Tax is included in price.
space: Studio is spacious with many windows with views of the beautiful countryside and a partial ocean view.  Studio includes comfortable queen size bed, couch(king fold out bed), dining table, hot plate,microwave,  small refridgerator, and coffee maker.  *Please note- the studio does not have a full kitchen.    * The studio is mostly stand alone- does share the front porch to other home. There is a private porch in the back of studio with a table+chairs and an ocean view. There are 3 other homes on the property with 7 acres of grassland and trees surrounding.   Horses and cows nearby in a seperate pasture.
description: Beautiful, cozy, private, spacious and simple(not a full kitchen) studio in an open country hillside location. Studio has part ocean view with a private patio with a full ocean view. +Close to Onomea Scenic Route,Botanical Gardens,and Akaka Falls +50 minutes to Volcano National Park. +15 minutes to Hilo Airport.  *Message us for questions or interest in certain dates. Price ranges may be flexible on certain dates.  *Tax is included in price. Studio is spacious with many windows with views of the beautiful countryside and a partial ocean view.  Studio includes comfortable queen size bed, couch(king fold out bed), dining table, hot plate,microwave,  small refridgerator, and coffee maker.  *Please note- the studio does not have a full kitchen.    * The studio is mostly stand alone- does share the front porch to other home. There is a private porch in the back of studio with a table+chairs and an ocean view. There are 3 other homes on the property with 7 acres of grassland and trees surrou
neighborhood_overview: This studio is 15 feet from our other vacation home and has 7 acres of grassland surrounding the unit. Peaceful landscape with horses and cows along the drive up.  The studio has a private patio overlooking the ocean. This is a quiet and peaceful location with a perfect temperature and breeze.   We are located 10 minutes to Hilo, 10 minutes to the nearest beach (Honolii Beach Park), and 50 minutes to the Volcanoes National Park((Re-opened 9/22)  Also Hawaii Botanical gardens and Akaka Falls are nearby. If you have any questions feel free to ask!
notes: There is small area with hot plate, small refridgerator, microwave, and coffee maker although( there is not a kitchen sink). -We have a Roku unit with flat screen TV where you can watch Netflix, Amazon Prime, Youtube etc.    The studio accommodates up to four people(2 beds) if using fold out couch. Please let us know before arrival if you would like it set up.   The studio is private- it doesn't share any walls with other buildings and has curtains-yet it is near the main house on the property.
transit: -It is recommended to rent a vehicle, we may have a car rental option onsite.
access: The road to the house is a dirt road so please drive slowly. Any kind of car can access the house if driving slowly and using caution.  Guests have a close parking spot near their studio.  The studio is equipped with a microwave, hot plate, coffee maker,  dishes, and a small refrigerator.  There is not a kitchen sink- just the bathroom sink. Guests are welcome to sit on private porch near the studio, use barbecue, or walk the road in the neighborhood.
interaction: Your choice for a self check in or to be greeted/checked in either by the caretaker Amy or the lanlords Mark and Sharon(depending on time of year.) Please feel free to ask for recommendations/questions/concerns you may have. *Amy is a Licensed Massage Therapist please let her know if you would like to book a massage*
house_rules: Aloha please let us know a check in time if you would like an in person check in. Otherwise we can setup a self check in.  *No smoking indoors- outside only* - Be respectful of home -Please take off shoes in home (Hawaiian style).  -Please be aware the doors are mostly glass-so please keep them secure as the wind will blow them open or closed.  -No pets allowed. - Do not flush tampons or anything besides toilet paper down the toilet because the house uses a septic tank.  ****Please do not feed the horses or goats that are in pasture next to driveway ***** Please, if you have any questions, comments, or concerns feel free to communicate it with us.

host.host_about:
Sharon and I built this beautiful, spacious home on 7 acres in 2003 to fulfill a dream of living in Hawaii. Our home takes advantage of an incredible view 5 miles north of Hilo on the Hamakua coast, up slope from the scenic drive and Hawaii Tropical Botanical Garden.
Come share our neighborhood with the farms, local horses, space and quiet while you appreciate what we feel is the best of Hawaii.  You are close to many of Hilo’s local activities, and within easy traveling distance to the Volcano sights, waterfalls and lush vegetation and attractions of our coast.
We offer an extremely spacious main living house area that mirrors the space of our outside view, and an ohana next door for a smaller living option.  We love the sunrises over the water, the constantly changing weather, and the sunsets over the mountain.  We hope you enjoy this place as much as we do.
Mark

reviews.comments: Directions provided in advance were helpful. Nice cottage, hostess Amy had homemade banana bread which was a nice touch. We only slept overnight, literally 9 hours but it was clean and comfortable.
Great, great place. Our plans changed and more people came, which was directly accepted. The view is amazing and the place is charming.
the perfect place with a perfect view! nice friendly greeting!
Great room with nice view of the sunrise. The living room and the  bathroom are nice. However, we missed a kitchen sink for doing the dishes and found it difficult to do much cooking.

Nicely appointed studio set in a bucolic farmland with an amazing view of the sunrise over the ocean.  Location is rural yet close to everything, which was a great break from the ordinary (and our busy city lives).  We met Aimee and she accommodated our late arrival and changes to our plans.  The studio is in close proximity to the main house, but is completely a separate space and has its own entrance and parking.

As first time bnbers we were very impressed with the place and caretaker Amy.  We were in a bind and needed to find a place to stay when our previous accomodations did not work out.  Airbnb came through for us.

Sharon and Mark's home was a wonderful, warm and welcoming place. Their house care taker Amy who was there to greet us was wonderfully helpful and very knowledgable about the city, region and what it is like living in Hawaii.
The studio was clean, well appointed and a pleasure to stay in.
Leave the windows open and let nature sing you to sleep.
Wake up with the rising sun, spend your mornings on the porch soaking in the warmth and view of the ocean.
We plan to stay here again on our next trip to Hawaii and highly recommend you stay here.

Amy, Sharon & Mark were extremely friendly to us & we loved our time staying in the Sunrise Studio.  The hosts were generous & helpful when we asked about places to eat, surf & snorkel.  The studio is actually larger, brighter and nicer than what’s implied in the photos they’ve posted, also.  The location is excellent, the view is just as promised and the surrounding landscape is very lush & peaceful.  Pretty plants and flowers surround the studio, also.

These were the 1st 3 nights that we spent on the Hilo side. We met Sharon and Amy upon arrival. Immediately we knew that Sharon ( the owner) is a warm and friendly person. Throughout the time we spent there…. every contact was an absolute pleasure.
The cottage is set as a separate building but only 10 feet from the main house and didn’t feel private. It is a single room with a walled toilet and shower. We expected more of a kitchen and food prep area than what is there. The very small refrigerator does neither make ice nor keep it frozen and it was necessary to ask for ice from the main house daily. If you want to prepare some of your own meals, the cottage is not supportive of that. Washing dishes and cooking items must be done in the bathroom sink without counterspace while standing on the wet shower floor. I think that our biggest issue was that the whole property wasn’t very well maintained and there was much junk laying around that should have found a trash bin long ago.

This worked perfectly for us; we really enjoyed our three-day weekend on Big Island. Amy, Sharon, and Mark were very welcoming and we enjoyed talking story with them. The house was very comfortable. The apple bananas they picked from the property were delicious! The house got a really nice breeze, which made for perfect sleeping conditions. We will definitely come back.

Sharon, Mark and Amy the caretaker are wonderful hosts, very friendly and welcoming. They did lots of little favors for us and really made us feel at home. Everything was very clean with no bugs and the studio has lots of windows for good breezes if it gets hot. Thank You Amy for guiding us in off the main road.
We will definitely be back next year if it is available when we come.
We feel like we made new friends and we are thankful we discovered your place.

Aloha,
Tom and Loretta

Sharon and Mark (and Amy and Miss Kitty Meow Meow) were wonderful hosts. They were very flexible and willing to accommodate a last minute booking. Sharon even had a plate with fruit and snacks waiting for us we arrived, which was so thoughtful and nice after our long drive. 
The location of their home is just incredible with 180 degree views out onto the ocean below. It's a wonderful spot to watch the sunrise and the boats coming into the harbor. The room is very cozy and comfortable, just a great little studio, and the actual structure that houses the studio is detached from their home so it offers quite a bit of privacy. However, Sharon always made herself available for a great chat! We found Sharon and Mark to be extremely friendly and accommodating, even letting us use their drier (since this area of the Big Island gets quite a bit of rain, we got soaked on our visit to Akaka falls, so the drier was thoroughly appreciated) and we really enjoyed their company. My fiance and I very much enjoyed our stay at their Sunrise studio and would absolutely stay there again the next time we are in Hilo.

What a wonderful place.  Sharon and Mark are great hosts, and Amy was very kind.  The room is a cozy little 1/1 Ohana, that had everything I needed.  I'm a resident of Kona and was in Hilo for a class at the college so I wanted something that was close to Hilo but enough away that I could study and rest.  This was perfect.  Comfortable bed, with a spectacular view of Hilo Bay on property.  It was refreshing to wake up with a cup of coffee and watch the sunrise.  I would highly recommend this very comfortable and affordable place for any single or couple staying over on that side of the island.  Mahalo for your Ho'okipa

We didn't get to meet Sharon and Mark, but their little studio was very charming. It is a little off of the beaten path and has an amazing view of Hilo Bay! Amy was very welcoming and accommodating. She had fresh-picked papaya waiting for us and was just a doorstep away, if we needed anything. The studio itself had everything we needed, as we were only there to sleep and shower. I would definitely recommend staying here, especially if you are a nature lover.

We had a great stay at this vacation rental.  It was very clean and comfortable.  Since the larger unit next door was not rented we got to have our morning coffee on that lanai which had an awesome ocean view.

Amy was friendly and we enjoyed visiting with her in the mornings too.

Had a fantastic stay in the little pink studio. It was the perfect space for me. Would definitely be comfortable for 2-3 people as well. I never met Sharon or Mark, but Amy was there and she's amazing. Great for advice or information on where to go and what to see. I ran out of coffee (which they provided) and she happily shared some extra with me. The location is outside of Hilo proper, but I found it super easy to drive in and also get anywhere I needed to go. Thanks again Amy for being such a great host and to Sharon and Mark for sharing your home!

Sunrise studio is just as described.  Very nice and comfortable.  Being forewarned of the limitations regarding"kitchen"setup allowed us to plan easy meals.  Amy met us upon arrival, showed us around and answered our many questions.
Amy is a great host and her place place was perfect : comfortable, clean and spacious . Great value for money. Would definitely recommend!
The place is very nice and comfortable. It's 5 minutes drive from Hilo. The host was super kind and helped us for any request, including our early check-in. Recommended 100%!

We really liked our stay at the Sunrise studio. The setting is great, with fantastic views over the ocean and the green surroundings. The studio itself is convenient and Amy is a great host. 
We loved staying on the Hill side (east) of the island. True, there are more clouds, but for people who enjoy an active vacation it is perfect. Relatively close to for example volcano np, mauna kea, hill and some gorgeous beaches. These are not the white sand beaches found on the Kona side, but the green surroundings and steep cliffs around make them very special. Impressive nature and not touristic at all. After also have seen the Kona side, the Hilo side is much more relaxing. It is under 2 hours drive to south kohala, and the way up there through the coast north of Hilo is very pretty, including waipio. We recommend staying Hilo side, and this place is a very good base to explore.

Beautiful location and perfect place to catch the sunrise from a more personal location. Everything was nice and Amy was very welcoming and helpful. I couldn't get the wifi to connect to my phone or computer because of weak signal but that's ok because you won't want to be connected to the office while staying here. Enjoy the solitude.

amy is a great ambassador & caretaker for property. Amy was available & responded in a timely manner to our requests. Amy was generous in offering tips & sharing gifts of property. Quiet, comfortable, convenient base camp for us to explore nearby sites. Stunning ocean views from lookout.

Stayed here for 4 days with my husband and the place is quite spacious. The only concern we had was not having curtains in one  side of the room window and the bathroom. Although it's far away from other houses, just didn't feel comfortable specially when getting changed after a shower for example. Other than that, it was nice and clean and very quiet. Definitely would still stay here when we come back to hilo. Mahalo Amy!!
Very nice place. Clean  comfortable. We slept with open windows and it was so peaceful and quiet.
Very friendly and personable host. Also quite accommodating. Perfect little place close to Hilo but far enough to not feel like you're in the city.
It is close to hilo, botanical gardens, and in a quite location.

amy meet us at the exact time we said we would be there, she gave us a walk through of the property and location of the belongings.  Over all I felt very welcome and safe. 

Getting on the property was a little bumpy. The property isn't on the map, and it is not pavemented. However the host gave great directions and we came prepared.

The host was very responsive and reachable at all times. She made sure we had all the information we needed to get ourselves settled down. 

The property is a bit off road from the main highway, and its recommended that you get there before dark - since the dirt roads that you have to take up the hill are pretty dark and there are no visible signs in the darkness to help you with navigation. Other than this, rest of the stay was pretty good. In the end, it is a basic accommodation close to the waterfalls and other places of interest (Puna) on the east side of the island.
Es handelt sich hier um eine sehr abgelegene und kleine Unterkunft mit einem kaum vorhandenen Bad.  Die Fenster ringsum konnte man nicht alle mit Vorhängen privater gestalten.

Amy was able to accommodate our same-day booking and even met us with a basket of fresh fruit. The accommodation itself had everything we needed including fridge, couch, bed, and full bathroom. The sheets were clean and comfortable, and the water ran hot, all good things.

The view of the patio is quite nice, worth getting up at sunrise to see.
Great quiet location. Studio allows for privacy. Amy had everything ready for us. I'd recommend to anyone looking to stay in this area.

This is a beautiful and rural space tucked away just a quick drive from Hilo. It had everything we needed and was clean, quiet, nicely decorated and cozy. The space offers privacy and is a peaceful place to stay. We loved being out of town and would recommend it if that is the experience you are looking for. The hostess was very kind.
Great place to relax, close to Hilo. Nice, quiet, clean place and Amy our host was very accommodating.

We had a great stay at Sharon and Mark's! The apartment is well-furnished, the neighborhood is beautiful, and Sharon and Mark were lovely, friendly hosts. Downtown Hilo is just 10 minutes away by car, which was also great.

Sharon and Marks hale was awesome! The room was clean and had a comfortable bed. The mini kitchen suited our needs perfectly! We checked out Akaka falls, Rainbow falls, and Kaumana Cave while we were in Hilo - all within reasonable distance and amazing. Sharon and Mark were very welcoming and shared fruit, nuts and carrot cake with us! We would definitely stay again!!

thank you very much for the hospitality. 
really nice place in nature. perfect for everybody who wants to see the north shore of big island. awesome own fruits on the farm too!

A little hard to find the location with (Hidden by Airbnb) navigation at first, but once you find the place,
Perfect clean,
Perfect silent,
Perfect host
strongly recommend!!
Sharon and Mark are very nice.  They shared with us some of fruits they grow.  It was a very nice stay.

It was cozy, quiet little house.
The scenery was so good and most of all I felt very welcome.
Thank you and Mark and Mark.
It would be a good chance to have a good chance to listen to a bird once in a clean facility.
Cute, secluded location with very friendly hosts. A great option north of Hilo.
Comfortable bed, big airy room with high ceiling, clean, clean, clean, rural location, friendly owners and property manager.

Nice spot located a little outside of Hilo. Clean and functional. The main house is close by and the lanai is attached to the main house. Quiet and peaceful, but there are coqui frogs on the property so don't be alarmed if you hear their call throughout the night!
Very nice and quiet place.  Sharon and Mark are lovely hosts with great suggestions for touring the island.

Great place to stay! We got a very warm welcome from Sharon, Mark, and Amy upon our arrival. The space is beautiful and secluded, near farmland with cattle and horses. The pictures don't quite do it justice. It's very warm and cozy on a rainy day and conveniently near Hilo. I would recommend showing up before dark the first time since the turnoff can be very easy to miss. (Be sure to follow the directions closely.) Highly recommend!!

We are return renters and really enjoyed the unit. Amy, the caretaker is great.  We also met Sharon and Mark, the owners and they willingly gave us a tour of the big house.  We will definitely be back again.  Could not ask for a better place, hosts and caretaker.

Sharon and marks place is a short distance from Hilo and is set on a hill overlooking the ocean. The studio was beautifully located on a farm, next to a larger house. The view is spectacular, and the studio is clean, quiet, and private.

What an amazing place! You can see the ocean from the house and are surrounded by the richness of Hawaii's country scene. Getting to the house was a breeze, since they give excellent directions. The studio is small, simple and close to town. The hosts Mark and Sharon are incredible and genuinely kind. Couldn't be happier with our stay here, even when it was only a night. We would come back and stay here in a heartbeat.
Very relaxing cute little place in a secluded area, though still close to Hilo. Sharon was very accommodating and helpful.
It was an excellent experience on a beautiful property. Friendly hosts, clean, and well accommodated! Would highly recommend.

This house is a true gem on top of a very scenic country hill. The home decor is simple but welcoming. We cannot stop talking about all the natural beauty around--the cows, the farms, the papaya trees, the flowers, and all the other greenery. We enjoyed seeing the ocean from the lanai, and ate papaya while star-gazing (just before the rain clouds overtook the sky). It was a great ending to our Big Island trip.
We had a great stay! Amy, the caretaker, was a wonderful host and very helpful. We enjoyed the space and  it was very comfortable. We would recommend the place to anyone.
We had a great stay. Amy was a great host and showed us around the house even though we reached quite late. I would recommend this place for anyone who wants to stay in Hilo.
Great people! Awesome deal!

What a wonderful place! Clean, spacious private house with outdoor seating and beautiful view of the ocean. We felt like home. Perfect location near Botanical garden, Akaka falls and close to Hilo downtown. Highly recommended!

Die Unterkunft war hervorragend. Sie ist sehr ruhig gelegen und trotzdem nicht weit weg von Hilo. Von hier aus sind zb die 'akaka falls' und der 'botanische garten' schnell zu erreichen.
Die Unterkunft war sehr sauber und war gut ausgestattet. Die Gastfreundschaft von Sharon und Mark ist außergewöhnlich. Wir fühlten uns von der ersten Sekunde an willkommen und haben die Gespräche mit ihnen sehr genossen. Wir können die Unterkunft jedem empfehlen, der einen schönen Hawaii Urlaub erleben möchte. Hoffentlich sieht man sich eines Tages wieder.

Sharon and Mark are very welcoming hosts. They offered us banana and papaya grown on their property and the place was cozy... felt right at home. The room was VERY clean, bed was comfortable and had all the essentials. Located 5 mins drive to downtown Hilo, yet located on the country side.. truely a gem. A little difficult to get there at first but once you know the way it's very easy. Just follow the directions listed on airbnb. Definitely worth the value.
Quaint and nice place. Great hosts!

Sharon and Mark's AirBNB is the type of vacation rental that I go home to my friends and rave about. We never got to meet Sharon and Mark, but instead was taken care of very well by Amy. We arrived a lot later than originally planned yet Amy was very accommodating wth our late night arrival. Check in was very smooth and the studio itself was amazing. It had everything we needed, from basically a full functioning kitchen to an attached bathroom. Amy was always available by text for anything we needed and was there to say aloha in the mornings. My boyfriend and I very much enjoyed the private, quiet studio and patio that sat on top of a hill and had stunning views of the countryside, beach, and stars at night. I was blown away by the very affordable price and could say it was definitely worth every penny and more. I have nothing bad to say except that I wish we could have stayed even longer. Mahalo

Nice views, quiet and secluded, yet easy to get to Hilo town. If you plan on cooking, this is not the place. Very little counter space and had to do dishes in the little bathroom sink. Bathroom is very tiny, so this was not an easy job. Otherwise a decent place to stay.
If you want a peaceful, secluded hiding place with an AWESOME view, and a perfect host, we highly recommend this fantastic place to feel ay home! Thanks!

I had a wonderful stay here. It was secluded and absolutely peaceful.  Their place was spotless, the furnishings were comfy and maintained.  They left fruit, coffee, a "starter" breakfast and snacks, just great.  I had my breakfasts and several meals on the back veranda rather than eating in town.  The kitchen was basic:  hot plate, fridge, microwave; wash the dishes in the bathroom sink. What they advertised, so it wasn't a surprise.  

The caretaker, Amy, was very nice and friendly, and checked in daily to make sure everything was good.

The location was secluded, but with that, it is a peaceful place. You'll need a good map or better yet a smartphone w/ map function.  I'll come back again if ever I'm on the Hilo side.
Nice quiet place, a bit hard to find. The host were ver kint, cos apartment well equiped

The studio is located in quiet area surrounded by lush greenery and has beautiful views of the ocean. Comfortable place and friendly caretaker. The one thing missing from this place is a kitchen sink. If you want to cook meals using the kitchenette the cleanup would be difficult in the tiny bathroom sink. Also it can be a bit tricky to find but once you are there it's fine. Hilo and beaches are a short drive away from this peaceful place to stay. We enjoyed staying there and exploring the Hilo area.

Beautiful views from this secluded spot. We had both mountain and ocean views. We seemed to have the entire ranch to ourselves. We were able to accomplish many things as the Airbnb is close to town. The road to get to the house is very rough. Our car rental took a beating, but we had a good time overall. Thank you very much!
Amazing stay here, fantastic views and  good value too. Left my watch and was promply found and posted!

Nous avons passé un agréable sejour. Emplacement parfait pour visiter Hilo et les environs. La vue est vraiment belle et l'environnement de la maison avec ses arbres fruitiers très agreable. Le logement était propre, très fenestré et plus spacieux que sur les photos. Merci pour les petites attentions.
아름다운 시간이었습니다. 은하수까지 보이던 밤하늘의 별들, 해가 떠오르는 바다, 아침의 무지개, 자연의 소리. 호텔과 비교하면 청결함이 완벽하진 않지만, 서울에서는 경험할 수 없는 휴식이었습니다.
Any was really helpful & quick response for our needs.  Great place to stay with great view

Located about 20 mins outside the heart of Hilo. This was a tranquil place with beautiful sunrises. The host, Amy, has helpful in getting us checked in. The studio is located right off of a main house, but you have your own space, privacy, and patio. The whole space was comfortable. You are provided with a small "kitchen" with utensils and cookware. There is no sink to clean, but we were told to just leave any used dishes for later cleaning. There is no AC, but most properties on the island don't have them; not really necessary. The way the studio is situated provided enough cool breeze, along with the fan. It is hard to find off the main road, so follow their instructions carefully or use UPS. Would stay again.
Great little affordable home away from home near Hilo.
This quiet lovely home is wonderful. It has a great view of the ocean from the patio, and it was off the beaten path just enough to feel secluded. It was definitely worth the money.

Nice place, had everything we needed. Conveniently located while still being secluded and quiet. Beautiful view of sunrise on the ocean. We would recommend this place to anyone staying on the east side of the island.
Great stay. All as advertised.  Beautiful place.  Recommend!

BEWARE LOCATION: Getting to this place requires driving up and down a hilly gravel/dirt road with a moderate amount of ruts and potholes. This violates almost all rental car agreements in our experience. It is difficult to find in the dark. This was not included in the description when we booked the airbnb. We strongly suggested it be included (with photos) in the description on the airbnb website. 

BEWARE PRIVACY: We didn't feel like we had any privacy. The studio is right beside the main house. When the windows are open, you can hear the main house and they can hear you and because of the warm temperatures, the windows need to stay open in the studio. A car arrived at 5:30am and parked right in front of our studio. The headlights lit up the interior through the curtains of the studio. Based on our experience, expect the host to disrupt a part of your stay here. 

VIEWS: The majority of the views facing the ocean from the studio unit are blocked by bushes and greenery. If you look out at a certain angle you can see a small part of the ocean between the bush and the main house. The exception to this is the view from the private patio - that is a lovely ocean view. Unfortunately, it was too wet to use this private patio for most of our stay. 

SUMMARY: The studio itself is clean and spacious. The bed is comfortable. The shower pressure is perfect. The kitchenette is perfect for making coffee and heating up breakfast in the morning. The host is very nice and attentive if you have a question (or can't find the place). However, we will not stay here again. We wanted more privacy, accessibility that did not violate the rental car agreement, and quality sleep on our vacation than this airbnb listing offered.
What a great view! We really enjoyed our stay.  The room was perfect and had everything we needed.  The road to get there was a little bumpy, but we had a jeep so it wasn't a big deal.
Very good place et very kind people. Théorie hospitality was exeptional and we really enjoy our stay with us. We recommand this place for every travler!

Great place to stay right outside of Hilo, about ten minutes from town! Would highly recommend this place to anyone visiting the Big Island. Comfortably slept me and two friends. Make sure you enjoy the private lanai for a sunrise!
We stayed just one night but the place is very nice and quiete

Die Unterkunft war genial. Ein kleines Haus für dich allein in sehr ruhiger Umgebung. Es hat ein Sitzplatz mit Blick auf den Ozean. Man kann auch etwas kochen, es hat 2 kleine Herdplatten. Wir waren absolut zufrieden mit der Unterkunft und der Gastgeberin Amy. Hat alles reibungslos funktioniert und mit der Wegbeschreibung, die man bekommt findet man das abgelegene Haus auch gut. Ich kann die Unterkunft absolut weiter empfehlen.

Amy the manager was responsive and quick. Very accommodating- we didn't get to the house until late at night but was very pleasant when we arrived. The pull out couch was opened and the linen was on it for our arrival of 4 people. Very pretty outside. Place looked just like the pictures. Thanks for everything!

My husband and I stayed here with our 6 month old son.  It was perfect because the bride/groom we were celebrating with stayed in the main home rental.  We had everything we needed to enjoy our stay!  Amy was great with communicating with us and made sure she was available if needed.  Check in/out was easy.  I would recommend (if getting a rental) to get one that sits a little higher up.  The short road leading to the location is a little bumpy and it could be challenging with a low riding car.  Otherwise, beautiful location with great views and a short drive to downtown Hilo.
Great studio, just a short drive to downtown Hilo. The access road is a little rough but certainly navigable with a compact car. The patio is private and a nice place to watch the sun rise.

Nice place in a beautiful area. The driveway is a little rough so a jeep or suv would be best. Its really close to another house which can be a little noisy if the guest there are noisy people. The host was accommodating and helpful.
Nice and quiet, with a beautiful sunrise view. Amy was very accommodating. Place was clean and well priced. We enjoyed our stay!

Very charming little house in an amazing location. Imagine being surrounded by wild flowers, farm animals, fuit trees and view on the ocean, while being close to Hilo. We loved our 3 days there and would definitely recommend to stay there!
The studio is clean and in a good location near Hilo. Right next to a main house. WiFi was spotty/had to use data to book new room.

We loved our stay here! Great location and tips to local sights was helpful. When we finally got some sun we enjoyed a little solitude on the porch. Everything was clean and Amy was so helpful and responsive. Would definitely come again.
Perfect views and great value. We loved it all, would stay here every time!

Sharon and Mark's place is a great place to be.  Spectacular views of the ocean.  We enjoyed sitting outside and looking at the ocean..  Not being "techies" we did not have GPS or phone maps to help us find the place, but Amy, the manager, guided us in.  It was worth it.  The room was very attractive and comfortable. Suggestions about local activities were very helpful.  It is very close to waterfalls and the botanical garden and just a small trip into Hilo. We would go back again given the opportunity.

Fred and Linda

This is a destination hideaway! You can stay here all day and just enjoy the beautiful view. The way the windows show the gardens and view makes it a great place to spend a rainy day too. I'm used to a small kitchen so that was fine. The road was not difficult in my Sedan. It was so clean I felt very comfortable. I have never stayed in a more beautiful place.

We had a great time staying here and thoroughly enjoyed the sunrises.  To be honest though we did not spend much time here because we were very busy with activities during the day. We did appreciate coming back to this studio as it was both very quiet and very clean.  There was quite a lot of space in this studio.  We stayed there with two kids and had plenty of room with the pullout sofa.  We would definitely stay here again to explore Hilo, nearby waterfalls, and trekking north to the Waipio Valley.  I highly recommend this place for quiet and chill folks traveling on the windward side of the Big Island.

This place was a perfect home base for a few days. Plenty of space, all the basics for cooking (mini fridge, hot plate, microwave, coffee maker), and privacy. Bathroom/shower is small and driveway is rough but totally doable with a compact car. Overall definitely recommend!

Beautiful natural surroundings and spacious.  Feels like you're well secluded but not too much away from town. Also I liked that a copy of "Big Island Revealed" was in the studio. Overall the studio is an excellent value. 

The host was very responsive and polite. 

Note that the dirt road isn't too bad of a drive but you have to check the host's directions carefully. If you rely on the GPS and miss the turn, it may reroute you onto bad dirt roads.
Nice view, Nice host. Comfortable bed, big sofa. Great terrace .
Very friendly people, great spot for sunrises, quiet and great location close to Hilo! Shower is not closed in and no kitchenette/kitchen sink area but we enjoyed our stay very much.

Sharon and Mark have a beautiful private studio in a peaceful gorgeous location just 10 minutes from Hilo.  The location gives you access not only to Hilo area but also Waip'o valley and northern areas if you want to explore.  Less than an hour from volcano national park ( though the park is best if you stay in/around volcano for a couple of days. )
The place was super clean and well cared for.  It has a private patio with view over fields to the sea.  I wish we had stayed there longer. Communication with Amy , the property manager was prompt and clear, as were directions.  
I would highly recommend!!

The location is great - off a main highway close to Hilo, but the driveway is about 1/2 mile long. Absolutely no traffic noise. Curtains don't quite cover up a couple of windows completely and the bathroom door does not lock - but we did not care since is was just 2 of us. Very quiet place with everything we needed. Good value.

Perfect place for a weekend stay, the hosts Sharon and Mark are super awesome people. The location of the studio seems to be confusing, but, actually it’s not, just pay attention to the details provided by the hosts and you should be fine, we didn’t cook at the place, but you can if you want, as it comes with a small stove (no kitchen, but, it has all the things you need for cooking for 2-3 people.
We loved the small farms on the way to location which the hosts have mentioned as a dirt road (dirt road is only 2-3 mins ride), you can also see horses and the 10-15 mins ride to Hilo is by the sea so expect to have a wonderful view every day.
Very good place for the price you pay and nice hosts..!
This is a wonderful place to stay you will need a car though. Sharon and Mark were awesome hosts. On a chilly night Sharon offered me a comforter. Mahalo Cath

This oceanview/sunset bungalow was stunning. We really felt like we were in Hawaii, and we can’t wait to come back. We made it home base for 5 days and wish we spent the whole week there. Such lovely thoughtful hosts.

I had a great stay with Sharon & Mark at Sunrise Studio! The location is a little out of town which makes it a nice retreat with beautiful grounds and many interesting birds. The driveway is a bit bumpy but easily managed with a low clearance rental car. Sharon was very thoughtful giving advice about places to eat or see in the area & I was even lucky enough to share some fruit from the garden. Lovely spot!

Wonderful hosts and lovely Ohana.  
We loved the location and ambiance. 
Anyone staying their will not be disappointed!!
We love visiting Hilo, and north of town is a great location to stay for the many nearby activities.

Sunrise Cottage is in a stunningly beautiful location, is well appointed and convenient. Sharon and Mark are warm hosts with lots of local knowledge. It was  a great experience to stay there and I hope to be able to return!

Sharon and Mark were welcoming when we arrived, and were very nice throughout our visit.
The space is great, as described and shown through pictures. The view is amazing, and it was really fun hanging out in the morning sipping coffee on the patio and looking at the beautiful view!
Definitely Recommended.

This place is a gem! Sharon and Mark were great to us from check in to check out. They gave us recommendations on what to do ( touristy and things off the beaten path). Their place is situated between mostly farms and still convenient. The place was clean and the view was great. Very quiet and peaceful. Highly recommended!
Great lovely people! Great view.

Sharon and Mark were amazing hosts. We were greeted up arrival and shown around the living space. The room had everything we needed and their property had great views for sunrise. They even offered to mail an article of clothing we left behind!
Wonderful people, place, location and stay!  Was the perfect get-away for our family!  Mark & Sharon were great with sharing area "tips" and so accommodating with little hospitality's!   Mahalo!

Sharon and Mark waited us until after 10 pm and gave us a very warm greeting, which was so nice. The place was an independent house near theirs but it has everything in it. We even cooked our own breakfast everyday. It was 15mins drive to the downtown, not that far. But you do have to have a car.

We lost our bath towel at the Hilton Hawaiian Village in Oahu and we were worried about that. But the surprising thing was that Sharon and Mark prepared two sets of towels for us and folded them nicely on the bed. Sweet. 

Highly recommend to stay here.
The space was lovely and just as described, Sharon and Mark were so friendly and offered us some yummy treats along with fabulous local tips! They made our stay so fun and memorable! Thank you!
Sharon and Mark were gracious hosts and the place was located in a very scenic location. The drive was a bit rough but we did it in a Chevy sonic just fine. Would definitely recommend this location.

I booked this place at last minute but I definitely consider myself very lucky to meet such warm-hearted and sweet host and hostesses. 

The location is great. You can see sunrise from the ocean. The backyard is nice and huge. Amy is the person who helped me check in. Sharon then gave me very good advice for local sceneries and places for food. She also kindly showed me and my parents around the neighborhood. 

Again I would strongly recommend her place. It will definitely be a plus on your trip.
We had a great stay and would recommend it. They were great, very friendly and available.

Sharon and Mark were excellent hosts! They greeted us right when we arrived and offered us delicious foods. The studio was amazing and beautiful—you really get a great deal for what you pay for! Although there wasn’t a kitchen, Sharon and Mark were kind enough to provide a microwave, toaster oven, and a hot plate, in addition to pots/plates/silverware. I would suggest this place for those with rental cars, however, as it is a little bit of a drive from downtown Hilo. We were so sad to leave at the end of the stay, because everything was perfect! Thank you again Sharon and Mark!

Mark and Sharon were great host. From quick responses, giving us suggestions on where to go and constantly making sure everything was okay or if we needed anything. Place was clean. Close to downtown Hilo. Would defiantly go there again.
Lovely place! Spacious, breezy, beautiful, with welcoming hosts and caretaker. I may be a sucker for the horses on the property as well.
You will love it !

Sharon & Mark are wonderfully friendly hosts. We whipped up some awesome meals, enjoyed playing with our toddler on their huge lawn and were treated to a beautiful view of the sunrise each morning. Feels secluded and quiet, but still plenty close to groceries, restaurants and other attractions. Recommended!

Sharon and Mark made us feel welcome from the moment we drove up their scenic driveway to the guesthouse. The views of the ocean and surrounding area are breathtaking. The guesthouse was clean, roomy and filled with everything we would need to make ourselves at home. The location is the perfect secluded place surrounded by fruit trees and flowers but also within a few minutes drive to all the amenities of Hilo and nearby attractions. I can’t recommend this place enough. Thank you Sharon and Mark for making our time here so memorable.
La maison offre une jolie vue et se trouve à environ 10-15 minutes en voiture d'Hilo.

Really enjoyed staying at the Sunrise Studio! Great location, views, scenery around, and really cozy, comfortable and welcoming house. Well decorated,  beautiful - would love to come again! Amy was great, hospitable and friendly!

Nice place on the 'wet' side of the Big Island near Hilo in an agricultural area.  Not to far off the highway.  Great views and own patio.  Has everything you need to cook on a Grill, hot plate or microwave.  Coffee maker and small refrigerator.  Only draw backs were having only a bathroom sink and no AC (Not really needed).  Current volcanic activity only rarely affected this area due to prevailing winds.  Reasonable distance to many Eastside Big Island attractions.

This was a great property away from the hustle and bustle of the city, tucked away in its own little sanctuary.  The property manager, Amy, was so friendly and hospitable. I highly recommend. It is about a 20 minute drive to Hilo, but coming from San Diego, I'm used to needing to drive everywhere. Although, the TV was small, the ability to watch Netflix was a nice perk for the day we spent in relaxing. The only complaint I would have is that the humidity was tough to get used to without an A/C unit. The description clearly says that it is not included, so this the apartment matched my expectation; it was just the weather that was worse than I was anticipating.  There was 2 fans that were extremely helpful and allowed us to fall asleep at night with them pointed at us.

The location is good if you have a car. The scenery is wonderful, there were few dishes to eat fruits and simple snacks. The hose replied quickly, easy to communicate! Willing to stay again if I visit Hilo.
Easy check in and check out! Great hosts. Do recommend 4wheel drive to get to the parking spot but nicely located!
quiet,  private and green.

The studio is very small and it does not have a functional kitchen. I stayed with my 18 year old daughter> Even though there is a bed and a sofa bed, once you open the sofa bed there is no room to walk around the beds. We opted for sleeping together. We did not cook. I found it uncomfortable to wash my cooking utinsils and food in the tiny bathroom sink. Amy Pennington is the caretaker and she is a licensed massage therapist. She was very helpful and the day I flew back I had a full massage on site "al fresco" with the view of the Hilo Bay. Good stay for 3 nights for 2 people. You do need a car to get around. Downtown Hilo is approvimately 7 miles from the place. Thank You Amy for your hospitality and availability.
.

The studio lays on a hill overlooking the ocean and is surrounded by idyllic nature. It is perfect to relax and calm down. To Hilo it is a 20 minute drive and we were happy that we rented a small SUV as the last part to the studio is a unpaved „offroad“ street. 
The dishes need to get washed in the small bathroom sink which is a bit unhandy and we did not find towels to dry them. 
The host was always quick in responding when there was a question and the check in and out was easy and uncomplicated.
beautiful & peaceful
bien placé, au calme, nous avons eu beaucoup de pluie donc nous n'avons pas profité de l'extérieur. Le chemin d'accès est bien pour un 4X4 , pour une voiture normale il faut faire vraiment attention.
The stand-alone studio is in a quiet setting and a great view from the patio.  The caretaker, Amy, was fantastic.

Perfect little retreat tucked away within a cottage style multi-family home on landscaped country acreage, truly within line-of-sight to sunrise with clear or misty mornings. For a comfortable getaway on the sleepier, rainy side of the island, be sure to spend a few nights taking advantage of the simplicity and privacy of the studio unit. The space includes amenities one would expect to have in certain hotel rooms including wardrobe/mirror, mini fridge, plus a table in one corner. Bonus options included onsite massage therapist, and a loaner vehicle. Definitely need a car to reach this location, with Hilo Town about a 10-minute drive away, but any car is a must have if adventuring throughout Big Island, anyway. Don’t overlook this overall excellent value which is definitely the type of place one could return to again and again.
Great spot just up the coast from Hilo, clean, convenient, perfect for 2.  Highly recommended!
What a great place. Everything you need for 1-2 ppl. Nice comfy linens and bed. Great to have a fridge and hot plate. Beautiful spot. I’m actually booked again. ❤️
Thank you for providing a nice, quiet and wonderful place to stay for us. The place is a cute place with an amazing with of the sunrise

Living here made it feel like we we're living the true Hawaiian experience of being very close to nature as the studio was surrounded by trees and animals. The hosts were very hospitable and provided great tips about where to check out during our time in Hilo.

I came to Hilo with my daughter to visit the University. I was delighted to find this adorable place, at an incredible rate, just a short drive from town. The listing is very accurate. What you see is what you get. The eastern view of the ocean is spectacular. We sat on the little patio with coffee and pineapple, and watched the sunrise. The WiFi worked well. And everything was comfortable and well maintained. You won't be disappointed. A few tips though. It is off road a bit, so be prepared to drive down a long, rocky, bumpy country road to get there. It has a few kitchen essentials, but I'd say it's not a place where you're going to do a lot of cooking. There is nothing at all in walking distance, so anything you might need (food, sundries, drinks, whatever), bring it in from town.

Sharon and Mark’s place was awesome. We stayed there for two nights on our tour on Big Island. The Studio is very cozy and the view is incredible! We enjoyed the sunrise so much! 
We will come back definitely!
Thanks for the time and all the tips!

This little guest house is so nice. Clean comfy and gorgeous ocean view. Quiet and secluded but very close to town. About a 10-15 min drive. And while here you can book a wonderful massage with a therapist.

We had a perfectly lovely visit at the Sunrise Studio. 

*Location*
It was very easy to find. We used (Hidden by Airbnb) maps and it took us right to the place. As stated in other reviews, the road to the house can be a little bumpy, but a slow speed will get you there, no problem. And OMG the sunrises. We got up each morning and drank coffee on the private patio overlooking the ocean. It was the best way to start each day. It’s only a few minutes from Hilo and has the benefit of feeling off the main drag and away from any tourist mayhem. 

*The studio* 
It has everything that we needed: bathroom (no tub), queen bed, coffeemaker, microwave, mini fridge, and a table to eat at. It even had a TV that we didn’t use because we were in Hawaii. The host provided some nice extras that we didn’t expect: coffee & filters, silverware, plateware & glassware. There was also a hotplate available. But again, the best part of the studio is the patio that has a table and 2 chairs. 

*The host*
Sharon was very welcoming, meeting us in the driveway upon arrival, and leaving us to get situated as soon as she’d given us the rundown. She offered advice on where to go and what to do based on our preferences. The nicest part was that even though she and Mark live in the house next to the studio, you wouldn’t necessarily know it. Everything was very quiet and peaceful and we never felt like we were under foot or too close.

We would highly recommend the sunrise studio. I think it’s ideal for a couple, but could easily sleep a couple more on the sofa bed (for a family). Sharon and Mark were great, and if we ever come back to the big island, we’d love to stay here again.
Great spot and very welcoming hosts. The morning sunrise is sure to impress, as are the nice little attention from Sharon and Mark!

Sharing and Mark were fantastic hosts and the studio was perfect.   The view of Hilo Bay was awesome and the sunrise was a special treat.  It's also a great place for stargazing!    It's clean, comfortable, spacious and fit our needs perfectly.
great couple hosting us! super nice and brought baked goods. the place was clean and had everything in the listing

Sharon and Mark were wonderful hosts. The studio was more than comfortable for my fiance and I during our 2 day stay. We loved being surrounded by the sounds of wildlife and being able to look out over the ocean from the yard. We hope to return some day.

A really lovely clean contemporary cabin space. Up on the hill where a cooling breeze blows and hosted by two of the loveliest people you could care to meet.
All that and cake.

Sharon & Mark are lovely hosts. They greeted us with a tray full of goodies and gave us a tour of their beautiful home, adjacent to the studio. The studio is bright, fresh, spacious and filled with Sharon's unique collection of furniture and art. It feels like she has put her heart into this place and made it very special. The big windows offered a great view, lovely breezes and the sound of rain. The cute little Coqui frogs sang us to sleep at night.

name: FEB/MAR SPECIAL! Kailua cottage perfect location!!
summary: Convenient cottage just 3 blocks to the least crowded beach in Kailua, the gorgeous Kalama beach! 5-10 minute walk to Kailua town with great eateries, farmer's markets, boutique shopping & healthy options. Newly renovated! The convenience of our cottage makes your vacation plans easy and stress-free. We have beach chairs, beach towels, boogie boards, and much much more! Welcome to your perfect vacation home, Hale Kailua!
space: There are 2 bedrooms with a queen bed in each, and a sofa bed in the living room.  We can accommodate up to 6 guests, with a $20 per night, per guest fee above 4 guests. There is 1 full bathroom, a fully equipped kitchen with a full-sized refrigerator, dish washer, stove and oven. There is a covered 1 car carport and plenty of street parking.
description: Convenient cottage just 3 blocks to the least crowded beach in Kailua, the gorgeous Kalama beach! 5-10 minute walk to Kailua town with great eateries, farmer's markets, boutique shopping & healthy options. Newly renovated! The convenience of our cottage makes your vacation plans easy and stress-free. We have beach chairs, beach towels, boogie boards, and much much more! Welcome to your perfect vacation home, Hale Kailua! There are 2 bedrooms with a queen bed in each, and a sofa bed in the living room.  We can accommodate up to 6 guests, with a $20 per night, per guest fee above 4 guests. There is 1 full bathroom, a fully equipped kitchen with a full-sized refrigerator, dish washer, stove and oven. There is a covered 1 car carport and plenty of street parking. There is a backyard that is shared with another family and a small table/chair set on the side of the house with a bbq grill for outdoor eating. This house is completely separate and does not share anything beside the backyard. Th
neighborhood_overview: There is an extensive list of places around the area in the welcome packet. If you like to plan ahead though, feel free to email me. Kailua is a great community that has world famous beaches, a healthy lifestyle, and great restaurants. The beach and Kailua town, where there is everything you'll need, is a 5-10 minute walk away.
notes: One of the nicest beaches on Oahu is a 5-10 minute walk away, as well as the whole town of Kailua; with Whole Foods, farmerʻs markets, multiple restaurants, grocery stores, retail boutiques, and local surf shops. Please let me know if thereʻs anything we can do to make your stay memorable!
transit: Hawaii has one of the best bus systems, but we recommend renting a car for the most convenience. Kailua is a biking community and you can bike almost anywhere in Kailua in 10 minutes.  This is a great option if you want to "get away from it all" and check out the local scene. If you'd like to explore the island and see different attractions though, we highly recommend a car. The airport and world famous shopping at Ala Moana shopping center is 30 minutes away. Honolulu is 20 minutes away, and the North Shore is 45 minutes away.
access: There is a backyard that is shared with another family and a small table/chair set on the side of the house with a bbq grill for outdoor eating. This house is completely separate and does not share anything beside the backyard. There is a private washer/dryer at the back of the house, and a dishwasher as well. There is cable tv and secure wifi internet available to all guests. We have beach mats, cooler bags, snorkel sets, and boogie boards for our guests to enjoy as well!
interaction: I am a local girl, born and raised on the Windward side of Oahu, so know my way through every nook and cranny here. My goal is for you to enjoy your vacation experience in Hawaii to it's fullest. I have included a welcome packet in the house that has an extensive information list of the surrounding area and places on Oahu in general. I respect your privacy and will only greet you unless you have any other questions.  I am only a phone call or email away and would love to give suggestions or options to help you with your stay!
house_rules: We want everyone's stay to be as enjoyable as possible. Please respect these rules. 1. We respect our neighbors so keep quiet hours between 10 pm- 8 am. 2. There is no smoking on premise. 3. There is a no pet policy. 4. There is a no party policy. 5. It is customary in Hawaii to walk bare foot indoors, so please take off your shoes/slippers (flip flops), and leave it on the bottom two shelves to the left of the door. If your feet are sandy/dirty, please use the hose outside to wash off. 6. We live in the tropics and have bugs. Please help us by throwing away your trash in the grey bin (regular trash), and if you are staying at the cottage on a Friday night, take the grey trash bin out to the curb for trash pick up on Saturday morning. There are trash bags for your convenience.  7. Please do not use our towels for cleaning. If you need to clean something, there are rags on the bottom shelf of the kitchen pantry. 8. There is cable TV and wifi internet access for your convenience. 9. Ther

host.host_about: Aloha mai kakou! My name is Tiffany and I am born and raised on the Windward side of Oahu. I live in Honolulu now, and would love to make your vacation memorable by giving you information about where to go on Oahu. I am fortunate enough to own my own real estate business here in Hawaii and am blessed with three beautiful daughters. I speak English and Hawaiian :) Some of my favorite things to do is go to the beach, hike our beautiful trails and mountains, and eat! We have some of the best, most diverse foods in the world! So come and explore!!

reviews.comments:
We stayed here for 5 nights in October. The house is very newly renovated. We had plenty of space for 2 couples and 2 kids (6). The couch is a pull out and there are 2 queen beds.
Tiffany was very quick in responding to our needs and questions. Everything was new and clean. We were provided with everything we needed.
The house is not air conditioned, which is fine most of the year but it happened to be very hot the week we stayed due to a tropical storm. We were unable to use the oven as it would heat up the whole house very quickly.
The neighbors that share the backyard were very nice. So were all the other neighbors we encountered on our walks to the beach and town.
We loved Kailua and recommend this town to everyone.
She was right there cleaning when we arrived so we knew we were dealing with a true OWNER.  The apartment is cozy and feels big because all the furniture fits perfectly.

Tiffany did a fabulous job with Hale Kailua. We are 2 kitesurfing ladies, who had a full day on the water before arriving at Hale Kailua. So, it was really appreciated to find the pre-packed insulated lunch bag, cold water and treats. It was just great to be able to pull into the car-port for easy unloading. Tiffany, made it easy for us to use the hose to wash our gear too.
The location is on a quiet street and we were just minutes from the kiting area.
The neighbors were very friendly. Clean area and very close to beach. Had everything we needed except bottle opener so purchased one to leave at house also didn't have a can opener but we improvised.

Pro's: Very clean and beach cozy! Everything you might need is all available in the house. (Washer & Dryer outside) The shower is amazing! Absolutely loved it! Loved that there is tons of towels!  Its walking distance to the beach. Tiffany was fast in answering any of our questions. I would really recommend this house, specially if your trying to stay away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. Kailua has amazing beaches!

Cons:  I understand its a cultural and respectful thing to remove your shoes before entering the house, but our only hiking shoes got stolen. I would suggest to remove them outside and place them inside next to the door. There is a broom available in the house to sweep when needed. 
The only mirror in the house is a small one in the one bathroom in the house. I traveled with my two sisters. One mirror with 3 girls was a little difficult. Other than that, its a great place to stay!! Thank you Tiffany! We loved our stay!

The unit was pretty much as advertised. It was well equipped, and had lots of towels. The washer/dryer worked well and were easy to access.  The beds were quite comfortable While it is a two block walk to the beach road, it is 4-5 blocks to actual beach access. The beach itself is lovely.  It is an easy 15 minute walk to town.  The unit got fairly warm, especially late in the afternoon.  One of the two bedrooms was often quite warm.  
The yard space would be nicer if there were a picnic table or chairs to sit on, or if there were some landscaping.

Tiffany's place was nice, new and clean.  We enjoyed our stay.  She was very responsive to all inquiries.  There is a (new?) shelf for shoes next to the door.  The car port was convenient and the photo of it helpful, as that's the view of the apartment from the street.  The bathroom was small but nice.  The vessel sink allows the counter space around it to be used.  It's glass and you can see items behind the sink so that nothing gets left behind.  Apartment feels private despite having neighbors close by.

Excellent communication with Tiffany throughout. The place was exactly as described.   The location was perfect; two blocks to the beach and approximately 5 short blocks to town.  The apartment was very clean and it had everything you might need.  Towels were plentiful and the washer/dryer came in handy.  I would highly recommend this property and Tiffany's oversight!

Quartier simple mais proche de la plage et du centre. Maison très propre, tout le confort à disposition, excellente literie. 
Les hôtes ont été très agréables et ont laissé de petites attentions. Nous recommandons cette petite maison où l'on peut garer la voiture juste devant.

This is a great vacation home rental. It was simple and efficient, having everything we needed in an open, bright, comfortable layout with great proximity to Kalama Beach and all the shops and restaurants. Very walkable if you don't mind walking a couple blocks to a mile on residential streets. The beds were surprisingly comfortable and the location couldn't be beat.

The apartment is very well located. For us, two adults with two small children staying there 10 days, it was rather simply equipped. However, commuication with Tiffany was always good. In the first days, we did not have a dishwasher but Tiffany got one after we had asked for it. Moreover, everything is very new and it was very clean.
The host canceled this reservation 31 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

This place was super great.  We loved the location in Kailua, it was close to all the other places on the island that we wanted to explore and was outside Honolulu.  It was in a quiet residential area.  Tiffany had a welcome packet, some chocolates and a reusable bag waiting for us at the place.  The home was clean and had all the things that were claimed on the website.  It was within walking distance of some shops, restaurants, and the beach.

The location was fantastic. It was a perfect cottage for two people. The neighborhood was quiet and friendly. I had never been to Kailua before and this spot is a great place to enjoy the town and only a short walk from the beach. I can't wait to come back!

The first time I stayed in Hawaii I stayed in Waikiki but this time Tiffany's place in Kailua gave me a totally different experience. I enjoyed the vibe of Kailua and the convenient location. It was perfect for someone who is looking to explore and experience something a little different than what the average tourist will experience. Tiffany communicated well with my group to make our stay issue-free!
Great place and right near the ocean. Never met Tiffany but she was very attentive and was always quick to communicate. Laundry is out back for those that need it.
Great place. Loved it.

Tiffany 's place is really convenient , close to the beach and close to the town centre . We were with small kids and still needed our car because of all the things we like to take with small children but if not walking to the beach is feasible . The neighbourhood is calm and didn't have any issue . Washing mashing and dryer really convenient . There is a really good barbecue too which is really convenient to cook

This is great cozy place in walking distance to the gorgeous beach at Kailua. Tiffany is an exemplary host. She keeps the place spotless and is proactive and friendly in her communication. She also took over organizing the delivery of extra baby equipment we needed, so that everything was already in place once we got there. The place even has extra goodies, like snorkeling gear, beach toys, and sun umbrellas. The kitchen is well equipped (it even has a countertop dishwasher). We enjoyed our stay!
Tiffany's place was a great spot to call home with 3 kids during our vacation. Safe clean home. ;-)

Tiffany is a great host. We were there for approximately two weeks. She answered all our questions completely and in a timely fashion. We would highly recommend her cottage, cozy and clean. We really enjoyed our vacation.

Tiffany was a great host and was very responsive. The property itself was a little smaller than I expected, but regardless, it was wonderful to stay at. We thoroughly enjoyed the property and the yard! Love the yard! It's centrally located and kailua beach, an AMAZING Beach, just blocks away. We loved the location and the property itself and would definitely recommend it to anyone looking to travel to Oahu. Thanks so much, Tiffany!
Great Location and Great Host.

It was very clean, nicely decorated,affordable, and private. For the most part, host leaved their guest alone. I would stay here again and recommend this place to others.
We enjoyed our stay here so much.

Great location only blocks from a beautiful beach. While the space is not large it is setup nicely and was a great home base for our group of 4 adults and 2 kids to explore the entire island. Kailua is a fun little town with 3 perfect beaches within 10 minutes. Look forward to another visit soon!

Tiffany's AirBnB was accurately described. We spent 5 nights at her place and we loved the accommodation. 
It was a short walk to the beach (approx 5-10mins). We had a car, although it would be 10-15min walk to local supermarket & restaurants. 
Tiffany's place is well equipped with beach gear, towels and a full kitchen. 
Her communication and check in was efficient and she was there to answer any questions throughout our stay. 
We would stay again - Thanks Tiffany!

Kailua is one of those places that we've watched grow into a very popular destination by many and all. It's still fun and lovely and Tiffanys place was perfect for us. Being close to everything like beach and food is why we keep coming back and we would definitely return to tiffanys spot as it was quiet, had everything we needed (including a/c, washer/dryer, full stove, etc.). We met her for a brief moment and she is the sweetest person with great advice;) Look forward to staying again!
It is a OK place in a nice area 10 min walk from a beautiful beach!

This was the perfect place for myself and the two other people staying with me. Wonderful location a few blocks from the beach and close to Kailua town. Very clean with ammenities to making cooking, laundry, etc very easy. 

Tiffany was so accommodating when we wanted to check in a bit early and she provided clear instructions and recommendations in a handy booklet (and a welcome gift!) 

I would highly recommend this spot for anyone looking for a good value and a comfortable, clean house in Kailua.

Fantastic rental! It is exactly as described, and even a little nicer in person! It is a very quick walk to the BEST swimming/relaxing beach in Oahu. The bedrooms are both comfortable. The living area is larger than the pictures make it out to be! The house is fully stocked with everything you need for a great vacation - towels, boogie boards, a blender, etc. A great value for friends or a family.

I would like to write a good review of this place but I have to be honest about what the experience was like. This was a very important trip for my family - my father was meeting his 1 year old granddaughter for the first time as I live overseas . The listing says it sleeps 6 people . We were 3 adults and one baby and could not comfortably fit in the dwelling . The listing says it’s a cottage when in fact it’s a converted garage and is extremely small. When the sofa bed was out it left only a couple of feet to manoeuvre between the bed and kitchen and was very unsafe for the crawling baby . It was uncomfortable for 3 adults in the tiny bathroom as well, no room for toiletries by the sink. The bedrooms were extremely small and the foam mattresses very uncomfortable to sleep on .  We had to leave early because the accomodation was not suitable for 3 adults and a baby which led to a very stressful experience using this Airbnb accomodation

This home provided us with a wonderful base in Lanikai. We were within walking distance from restaurants and shops and a short drive from many more things. There was a fully stocked kitchen, so we were able to make blended baby food for our little one without any trouble at all. Finally, the common area was a perfect place for the baby to play. We loved it here and are so grateful for a lovely stay.
We liked the location.

Cleanliness wasnt good at all so had to do a deep clean as soon as we got there (moldy curtains, dust everywhere, ant problem, expired stuff in fridge) feel played for paying $165 for "cleaning fee".
Its close to town but other than that it was really overpriced for what you get. 
Left it cleaner than we recieved it.
Great place!  So close to the beach!

Tiffany’s place was close to the beach and situated close enough to town to be able to walk there. Tiffany also had snorkeling gear which my teenagers made wonderful use of. It was so nice to not have to worry with locating and renting any equipment!

This place is wonderful. Plenty of space  for 4 of us, a short walk to the beach, and nearby plenty of restaurants. Approximately 30 minutes from most anything you could want to do(Honolulu, Waikiki area) and about an hour from the North Shore. All around awesome experience.

The best thing about this house was the location. 8-10 minute walk to Kalama Beach and 10-15 minute walk into town where there’s a Whole Foods and many restaurants. The host Tiffany was great and very communicative. The house itself is very simple so don’t expect anything fancy. The neighborhood is quiet and safe feeling. The rooms were a bit dusty and the beds are not very comfortable but those would be my main complaints. Other than that, it’s a simple little house in a good location.
Very clean, with ample supply of beach gear round back making this a great home away from home for our time in Kailua! Tiffany was very helpful and accommodating.

We enjoyed this beach shack as we came to call it for three weeks. It’s a bit run down but the location is great. The host was quick to respond with a request to replace the bbq gas. Great for small family but size is tight for more than two adults. Kalama beach rules.

Huset har ett bra läge i Kailua med gångavstånd till stranden och till restauranger/affärer.
Tiffany har bra tips på bra restauranger, utflykter osv i en pärm i lägenheten, den använde vi mycket.

Great location, 10 min walk to a beautiful beach that was never busy. All amenities within walking distance (coffee shops, restaurants, grocery store). We've stayed in Waikiki before and wanted something quieter but still drivable to all the tourist spots. This was the perfect combination! The home isn't huge but comfortably fit us (4 adults and a toddler). And the air conditioning was a life saver! Saw concerns that it wasn't in each bedroom, but leave the bedroom doors open and it's fine. Only issue was sugar ants, so couldn't leave any food out, but we saw another home with them so seems to be a local problem. If it doesn't bother you too much, this place is great! Also great to have snorkel and beach gear provided.
Clean, good location. Important items like comfortable beds, good plumbing and good coffee pot were there. Smaller than anticipated, check square footage if you have a family.

Great little cottage just a few blocks from the beach and easy stroll to restaurants and bars, with Uber there as well when you want a lift.  Good conveniences of the kitchen area and the cable TV, but the AC was a real winner, especially when hearing friends in houses nearby talk about trouble sleeping as their places didnt have the AC.  Tiffany was prompt to respond to my questions before the trip as well, but I didn't need any assistance once there.
We had a great time at Tiffany's Kailua cottage. She had a wide assortment of beach gear that we enjoyed using every day. The town is close to fun beaches!

Tiffany is a real pro, communication with her was perfection.
The house is small for 5 (wife myself and 3 kids)  but we managed fine.
2 couples would find this ideal. It is maybe a 10 minute walk to the beautiful beach OR into town. You could stay without a car if you wanted.. the beds were very comfortable. Plenty of kitchen accessories to make meals. Internet and TV were great but we did not really need it much. For the value this would be hard to beat. We really enjoyed Tiffany’s home.

The inside is nice, if not a little small. The outside area is not very nice though. The entrance is a carport and very uninviting. The whole outside area needs some renewal and cleaning.
If you don't mind a very cheap looking outside area, the location is pretty good and inside is in good shape.

My group and I stayed at Tiffany's cottage over New Years this year and had a wonderful time. Tiffany was a great host - quick with responses, let us drop out bags off prior to the check in time, and even helped us find where we could watch fireworks on NYE! The cottage itself is a short walk to the beach and a short walk to cafe's and restaurants. We will definitely stay again if we find ourselves back in Oahu.

A bit small, but cozy :) The enclosed yard & carport is really nice to have with kids. The kitchen isn’t super well-equipped for kids (bar-height chairs, no small / unbreakable dishes) but had the basics. There’s beach equipment for use & washer/dryer in the backyard, which were useful.

Tiffany’s place was our home base for 8 nights, our first time to Hawaii with our baby. We were not looking for anything fancy, just a clean, convenient,  more affordable option than a resort. This fit the bill!

The kitchen and main room are clean, with updated appliances. Great shower! The second bedroom had plenty of room for a travel crib, and we loved having laundry on site, as well as grass in the backyard. 

Tiffany was an incredibly responsive host leading up to and during our stay.

We enjoyed sunrises at Kalama Beach a couple blocks away, and each evening we’d walk/stroll to dinner in Kailua. As she recommended, Kailua Beach Park and Lanakai beaches were great for beach days with a toddler. Whole Foods, core power yoga studio, and target within walking distance were also a plus!

Cute cottage and great location.  Best beach right down the street.   Great that towels were provided, sufficient kitchen items and parking etc.  It is very close to the other properties on site as mentioned ( especially the shared yard). There were some bugs, but could be time of year/outlier.  Didn’t use AC because of some mold but didn’t need it for time of year with windows. Overall, we were there for the beautiful beach and place to sleep so served its purpose for us!  Tiffany was great at responding leading up to check in etc.
Good hostess. Great location.
I really enjoyed my stay at Tiffany’s place. The location was great close to restaurants and beach.

name: Room for Woman Solo Traveller
summary: Hello, I am a travel addict, travel mostly alone and since I know how is travelling alone, offer a cosy room to feel in safe.
space: I travel oft solo and sometimes find a safe place hard. That is why I accept only women, because Istanbul has not good options for female travellers. Two of my family members live in house, that is why I rent out the room for short accommodations. You can feel at home, we are family here!
description: Hello, I am a travel addict, travel mostly alone and since I know how is travelling alone, offer a cosy room to feel in safe. I travel oft solo and sometimes find a safe place hard. That is why I accept only women, because Istanbul has not good options for female travellers. Two of my family members live in house, that is why I rent out the room for short accommodations. You can feel at home, we are family here! Living room, Kitchen, Bathroom, Balcony My little brother can speak English. You can chat with him if help needed or you can help him to improve his english skills. Central, easy to reach subway.  (7 MİN by walking) Just behind one of the popular shopping mall (Cevahir AVM) Additionally, there is a bus leaving near home. You can take it until Eminönü to see the Golden Horn and Historical sides of city.
neighborhood_overview: Central, easy to reach subway.  (7 MİN by walking) Just behind one of the popular shopping mall (Cevahir AVM)
transit: Additionally, there is a bus leaving near home. You can take it until Eminönü to see the Golden Horn and Historical sides of city.
access: Living room, Kitchen, Bathroom, Balcony
interaction: My little brother can speak English. You can chat with him if help needed or you can help him to improve his english skills.
house_rules: We would like to see your kindness, neatness. No smoking at home but in balcony.

name: Sweeping Ocean and Resort Views - 306

description: Unit IOB 306 is on the Third Floor, Located in the Lobby Building with Ocean ViewsKing Size Bed with Queen Sofa SleeperMiniKitchenette with Microwave (no cook top)Counter Height RefrigeratorPrivate Lanai with Table and 2 ChairsFree High Speed WiFi,TVPaper Air ConditioningCounter HeightRefrigeratorMicrowave, Toaster, Coffee MakerCooking Utensils, Flatware, CookwareIron, Ironing BoardIn-room safeCable TVFree in-room WiFiLinens, Kitchen Towels and Beach TowelsBuilding Ice MakerLanaiShared BBQ at PoolBeachside Pool with SPAFree ParkingNo additional fees when you stay with us You have access to all amenities at the resort with the exception of the laundry room which belongs to a different program.  You have several laundry facilities to choose from close by. Our on island contact is there if you should need anything and will address any housekeeping or maintenance requests during your stay. Escape to paradise with a beautiful beachfront tropical resort set on 6 acres with lush landscaped ga
neighborhood_overview: Escape to paradise with a beautiful beachfront tropical resort set on 6 acres with lush landscaped gardens, swaying palm trees, all sitting on the beachfront. Enjoy the three-story plantation style resort to soak up the sunshine on the beach or the beach side outdoor pool and hot tub while you sip on your favorite tropical drink from the poolside bar, or take advantage of the ocean side grills for an evening barbecue. Located on a sandy beach with breathtaking views of the blue Pacific Ocean and year-round cool trade winds. Accommodations is a studio hotel room that is spacious air conditioned rooms with a private lanai with ocean or exotic tropical garden views. Walk to the popular Coconut Marketplace with dozens of boutique shops and restaurants. Located on the East-side just 7 miles north of the airport that is convenient for trips north, south, and west on the island.
