Recently ranked 37th best restaurant in the world, Momofuku Ssam Bar, is a 3 minute walk. I'm more than happy to make many bar and restaurant recommendations or suggest sightseeing activities. Apartment is up five flights of stairs, so unfortunately it's not han
transit: The apartment is a 2 minute walk from the L train and less than a 10 minute walk from Union Square (a major subway intersection). Most major tourism destinations are under $20 by taxi. But really, when it comes to food, drink and culture, there isn't much that you can't walk to easily.
house_rules: No smoking. Clean linens and towels provided. My food and beverages are off-limits to guests. Wi-fi, cable TV and Apple TV included. Feel free to ask for any restaurant, bar, or other recommendations.

host.host_location: New York, New York, United States
host.host_about: I'm a young professional originally from San Diego California and have lived in New York for a over a year now. My main hobby in the City is trying out all the incredible places to eat and drink, particularly during the winter when I can't be in Central or Prospect Park.

reviews.comments:
Lovely clean apartment in a really great location.
It is quite compact but perfectly comfortable, the roof garden was a very nice addition. 
The host was quick to respond and very accommodating.
I recommended highly.

This place is a real gem!! My friend and I stayed for a week and enjoyed true East Village life in this wonderful apartment/neighborhood. First of all the pics don't do the place justice - it's very bright, a true 2 bedroom with full kitchen, washer/dryer and even a bath tub! Windows in each room and as you can see a killer roof deck. Very close to the L line but we ended up walking everywhere most of the time.  Andrew was an amazing host - he was super responsive, provided a clean place with everything we needed for our stay  and even offered suggestions on where to go for the best happy hour drinks :) key exchange was very easy and Andrew was extremely accommodating regarding our arrival and departure times. Bottom line:  This is a great  place to enjoy the vibe of the East Village and Andrew is an excellent host!
Had a great stay at Andrew's place in the East Village.  Excellent location, clean apartment, cool rooftop.  It was quiet and comfortable.  As advertised.

Andrew's East Village apartment is nice, clean, and modern. The photos don't do it justice! All of the furniture, fixtures, appliances, flooring, and walls are modern and new. The bathroom especially was very clean and new looking.

It's in a great part of East Village. It's very convenient to the subway, bars, restaurants, groceries, and stores. Drew and his roommate provided excellent advice for local food and drink.

It's an ideal size for 2 or 3 people. We were a group of 4 adults, and although it felt slightly cozy at times, we definitely felt comfortable!

The rooftop deck is amazing, especially during sunset! It's very large with lovely views of the city. The trade off for such a useful and beautiful deck is that the apartment is on the sixth floor of the building. Be prepared to climb them every day!

The apartment was well stocked with linens, towels, toilet paper, dishes, cups, utensils, and more. Andrew let us use his new and nice appliances: dishwasher, fridge, freezer, microwave, oven, stove top, and clothing washer/dryer combo. It was so convenient to have access to all of these! For technology, the apartment has wifi, a nice flatscreen tv, and an Apple tv. 

We slept peacefully each night. The building is not noisy at all and we cannot hear the neighbors. We also slept comfortably; the double air conditioning is strong and refreshing!

Check in and check out were a breeze.

Andrew and his roommate are informative, communicative, and generous hosts. Please don't hesitate to inquire about the apartment! You'll be glad you did!
Great place to stay - rooftop is absolutely amazing, rooms clean and decent size. Perfect stay.

We had a perfect stay in Drews appartment. The location couldn't be better. Lively East Village setting with plenty of places with good to excellent food. Nice bars and coffee places and friendly young folks in the streets.
Drew is a great host and checking in and out was a breeze.
I definitely recommend Drew's appartment and will stay there again.

This was the most fabulous place to stay, right in the heart of the East Village with wonderful shops, bars and restaurants right on the doorstep.  The apartment itself it just lovely, exposed brickwork and wooden floors, and the roof terrace is a wonderful place to watch the sun go down.

We didn't actually get to meet Andrew, he was out of town for most of the time we were there, but he made it incredibly easy to pick up the keys and then emailed us with top tips of where to go to eat and drink.

I would highly recommend this apartment, and Andrew, in my opinion you really couldn't do better for a place or location to stay in.

Great place to stay in the heart of the East Village with great shops, bars and restaurants right on the doorstep. It's very convenient to the subway.
The rooftop is amazing. Rooms clean, just a little noisy in the large room. 
It's easy to keep the keys. Andrew is very accommodating.
Perfect East Village Location! Had a great stay and Drew was a very easy host to deal with. Would have no hesitation in recommending the apartment and I will definitely stay there again.

When my friend and I were planning to go to New York we were agreed that we wanted the following: our own rooms, a clean place, good assess to Public Transport and for the flat to be situated in a fabulous neighbourhood.

We got all this and more.  

Drew's flat is comfortable; the sofa was a haven after all the hours of walking and shopping.  It's an attractive place; to me the internal brickwork is so redolent of New York.  And really, having access to a roof deck is something quite special.

I am so glad that we stayed in the East Village.  It has all the qualities of the kind of area I like: relaxed and exciting, well connected, eclectic but not overly 'hip'  and most importantly - plentiful with a variety of great places to eat.

Drew was a wonderful host, he was quick to respond to the booking and was always on hand to provide information.

This is a great place, in a great neighbourhood in a great city.  I'm looking forward to going back some day.

My friend and I had a great time in New York and staying in this apartment really made a positive difference to the trip when compared to previous times I have stayed in a hotel. It's true, it is like being a native New Yorker!

Drew is a fantastic host with just the right amount of input as required and always responded very quickly to emails and queries. He was flexible and great to work with.

The apartment is in the East Village in a great location with lots of restaurants and amenities within a 5 minute walk. The area is safe, even at night, and always buzzing. The apartment has a living room, 2 bedrooms (1 double bed, 1 single) with a small kitchen and bathroom. It was clean and bright and of course the roof deck (up a flight of stairs) was wonderful- particularly sitting up there on Drew's furniture watching the sun go down on the NY skyline!

The only downside is that it is up 5 flights of stairs and I certainly had to take a breather near the top. Also, there is Apple TV and Netflix/ HuluPlus but no 'basic' tv channels- I quite like to watch ESPN Sportscenter in the background, but then again you are in NY and won't be sitting around watching much tv anyway.

I would recommend Drew and his apartment highly.

The apt is very nice and located in a perfect area! Lots of bars and great nightlife. It is one block away from de subway so you can get anywhere you want really easy. The rooftop is very nice and i thinks it is what makes you want to stay there despite the 5 floors by stairs. Andrew was a great host. He was out of town but still managed to help us with some things that weren't at the apt at first and we needed.  My only criticism would be that the apt wasn't very clean. It was super tidy! But some things haven't been cleand for a long time. Other than that it was the perfect experience, we really enjoyed our stay there! Thanks a lot drew!
Perfect flat in New York. The neighborhood is nice and it is perfect area to stay when you visit New York. Andrew is very nice and replied very quickly. Recommended.
Great location!! Tons of bars and restaurants around. Walking distance to anywhere we wanted to go. Apartment was clean and the rooftop view was great.

Andrew's apartment was perfect for our stay in NYC. It's in a nice but definitely less touristy area in NYC so you get to experience the city in a more authentic way. The apartment itself was clean and provided everything which was necessary. It was perfect that we had separated rooms so you have more privacy after a long day in the city which is also very nice. We also loved the rooftop as you can experience the skyline in a unique way with a perfect sight at the empire state building and the freedom tower. Andrew himself was also very acommodating and helpful. He provided us with tips and restaurants and responded quickly. Overall, the experience was perfect. The apartment was clean and in a very nice and safe area, Andrew was nice and very responsive. Both things contributed to a very nice first trip to the city. Especially the surrounding was outstanding. You have to travel around five minutes to be in Brookylin and maybe 10-15 minutes to be in Downtown. This was also a great aspect about the place.

The apartment is situated on the last story and there is no elevator: if you have any reason to have trouble with this (young children, health problems...), it's probably best to look elsewhere. 

The apartment is small but nice and absolutely clean and well tidied. 

Andrew left some coffee for us upon my demand: I suggest him to always make breakfast basics available to guests (coffee, tee, sugar), as well as cooking basics (salt, oil, vinegar). 

Finally, Andrew was very reactive when communicating with him, and helpful.

Leaving a 4 star rating for a 3 star experience because Andrew did his best to remedy an uncomfortable situation and re-credited some money back to my account for the inconvenience.

THE GOOD - Andrews place is perfect for a quick getaway to NYC. The downtown neighborhood is a great place for people who are looking to experience the city away from the tourist traps in midtown. Check in was a breeze. His place was extremely tidy with comfortable beds and was plenty enough room for the 3 of us that stayed for the weekend. He was extremely thoughtful to leave a list of food/drink recommendations out for us as well.

THE NOT SO GOOD - Upon our arrival, after walking up five flights of stairs with all of our luggage, we entered an uncomfortably hot apartment. It was almost 90 degrees in NYC that day, and had been in the 80's for the past several days. After looking around, (and also referring back to the airbnb listing to verify that we did indeed book a place with air conditioning) we found two window A/C units stored on a shelf in the second bedroom. They were too high and too heavy for us to reach on our own.

After calling Andrew, his initial response was that it was unseasonably warm for early May, and that me being from Baltimore meant that I was accustomed to hotter temperatures than New York. Baltimore isn't south of the equator. It has comparable temperatures to New York, maybe +/- 5 degrees. I knew to pack for hot weather, my friends knew to pack for hot weather, and as a host he should have been better prepared for the hot weather. It was extremely uncomfortable getting ready for dinner that evening, as Andrew was not able to come install the units until 9:30/10:00 that night. I feel like I also need to add that Andrew did not have a spare key to his own apartment. This would have required us to either cancel our plans and wait for him to arrive, or to leave all of our belongings unlocked inside the apartment. 

As I stated before, this was very much a 3 star experience. I personally would not book this listing again. But Andrew did attempt to make the situation right by reimbursing me for the inconvenience.

A great stay in East Village New York. 
Andrews apartment was in a great location near all the bars and within walking distance to most NYC attractions and subways 
Andrew was a friendly host who welcomed us to the apartment and provided us with his tips on where to eat and drink. 
The beds were comfortable and rooms air conditioned.
loved this 13th st apartment. the location was great and the apartment itself was perfect for myself and my two daughters. we felt very comfortable and at home there. wonderful stay!

Great stay! Clean apartment, working air conditioning units! The view from the shared deck is great - remember there are 5 flights of stairs, but the view is worth it! Great spot for some time in the city.

Drew’s place is in a great location and is in a relatively quiet area. The place was very clean and well-kept and comfortably housed three of us (and one extra for a night) while we attended a conference in NYC. Communication was prompt and easy. No complaints whatsoever. Drew was clear that the apartment is a walk-up on the sixth floor, and this was no problem: the stairs justified an extra slice of pizza.
great location, great apartment, would definitely stay again

Andrew was an exceptional host. Check-in was very easy and Andrew would respond to all questions I had within the hour. Andrew prepared a list of recommendations in the neighborhood and provided a very clean household. There were plenty of linens and towels available. The location is in a great neighborhood and the rooftop has great views of the city.

Thanks Andrew!

The location of this apartment is ideal for those looking to enjoy the restaurant and cocktail scene in the East Village. The apartment was well equipped with AC, bed linens, towels, and a bluetooth speaker. The rooftop deck is a great space that's rare to find in NYC. The neighborhood is quite and very accessible via the "L" transit line. Andrew was a wonderful host.
Great location and nice place. Andrew was a great host and very attentive.
Great value for money, beautiful apartment, comfortable location, loved it.

Appartement tres sympa dans un quartier avec tout ce qu’il faut autour et le metro a 3 min a pied.
Andrew est un hote attentionne et tres reactif pendant la duree du sejour.
Great true NY space..... perfect location... !

name: Beautiful Room - 10 to Manhattan
summary: Furnished bedroom in a large 3Br 2 Ba apartment. Kitchen, living room and bathroom shared between roommates. 2.5 blocks to Broadway/ Myrtle JMZ subway - Express stop about 12 mins to Manhattan. Close to shopping, clean, quiet, Wifi access.

Close to all major shopping and nightlife. Easily accessible to JFK airport via J or Z trains to airtrain at Jamaica Center.

neighborhood_overview: This is a working class neighborhood with a lot of families and young professionals. There are many new buildings within a two block radius being built. Many artists musicians and students collecting in nearby cafes inspiring new ideas and creative lifestyles. Lots of young entrepreneurs also starting business in the nearby area(s). Since this is a very easily accessible part of the neighborhood with the train 2.5 blocks away there are newer cafes and businesses are forming as well.
notes: This is a no smoking apartment. No pets allowed. I do make very rare exceptions to the rule of no pets pending on service animals. No drama. No drugs. No parties.
transit: 2.5 blocks from J, M, Z trains. J and Z trains run express during rush hours so it's about 8 to 10 minutes to Essex street in Manhattan Lower East Side. Also the J and Z train go strait to Broad st Financial district and tourist areas like Brooklyn Bridge and other are very easily accessible. You can also transfer to all other transit lines easily from J M or Z trains. M goes straight through to Herald Square, Empire State Building and Bryant Park, Times Square. All about 20 - 30 minute subway rides.
access: Master bedroom with private bathroom, kitchen, Dining, Living.

host.host_location: New York, New York, United States
host.host_about: Artist, creative producer, filmmaker, writer, director, editor living in NYC for 13 years. Clean quiet respectful friendly kind considerate professional. I love animals. I have a meditation daily meditation practice. I speak English, French, Danish, Hebrew, and trying to remember Italian. I enjoy connecting with others when I'm not busy running from one to the next thing.

address.street: 沙田, 新界, Hong Kong

reviews.comments:
It is very kind to let us to check out in the evening. The overall performer is acceptable but it still to be improved in some ways.

First, the smell of wood is not comfortable. Second the room a little bit wet as it is on the ground floor. Third, I have no idea why to  charge the cleanness fee (¥127/day) if the hosts never clean the room during the journey.

Bides that, I have reported there are two bulbs are broken and one of the remote is out of batteries, but the host never fix these problems.

As a traveller, I recommend that other traveller should consider this room if you will spend daytime outside and just consider a place to have a rest.
房子位于大围地铁站5分钟步行路程内,交通便利,周围商铺､饭馆､小吃非常多｡房间是田园乡村主题的,非常美,跟房东po的图片一模一样~房间的细节装饰做得非常非常好,打算以后去香港都在房东家的主题房住了~
裝修風格很喜歡,屋主很熱心幫忙解決了一些問題,非常感謝!
我们比预计时间晚到了6个小时 房东一直很耐心在等我们 还在地铁口开车接我们 房子的位置很好 离地铁步行5分钟 房间内很漂亮和图片上一样 房间在一楼 周围安静 搬运行李也方便 房子旁边紧挨着711便利店 和吃饭的地方 非常方便 推荐给大家 ✨
很棒的住宿体验,房屋干净,设计很好,房主人也特别好｡

owner gave me very warm welcome, suggested sightseeing places, restaurants, transportation andso on..
Can contact owner easilt and quickly via Line
房东来地铁站接了 很热心 环境OK 干净整洁 唯一的不足是屋内没有Wi-Fi
法国小镇风装修,和照片一样,在大围火车站出口步行5分钟内能到,便利｡房子应该是新装修,有阵浓浓的木头味道,整体都很不错合适3-4人居住｡如果能装固定的wifi设备就更好,没有找到wifi蛋,所有有小小不方便希望可以继续改进哦
房子挺漂亮的,房东人也很好,还亲自开车接我们去房子那里,房子离地铁很近出门购物吃饭都很方便｡

A tidy and charming place with white wood house style as described. Not very big bedrooms but with very cozy beds. Quiet location but easy to reach, as it takes only a few minutes walk to the Tai Wai station. Would be much better if the host make the whole house smell more fresh! PS: the bathroom looks much greater than the pics, so plz update some new ones! :P

好靚的屋
位置方便
下次會再住:)
房屋很干净,带着老人孩子还是很方便的,出门就有巴士站,离大围地铁站也不远,就是离市区有段距离,不过坐地铁还是很方便的!
房间干净实用,房东服务不错｡

宅主很友善,和我本来跟WI. LU.(法律不允许姓名超过2个字母)订好在旺角油麻地通菜街(女人街)的同一时间的六人住处的坏经验相比,是天地之别｡因为那里有太多负面客评和对我的恐吓无礼等行为,AIRBNB官方查实后取消了｡这是客观事实｡我很感谢｡

The host is very friendly. They are very good if I compare with the bad experiance with the other host Wi. Lu. (because of the law I can not tell the whole name) in Tongchoi St. (lady st.) in Mongkok, who got many negative commentaries and showed bad words to me. Finally canceled airbnb my reservation for 6 Persons there for the same time. This is fact! I am thankful ｡

The communication was good, except they rely on (Hidden by Airbnb) and I don't always have internet access when out, for example, on check in, we had to wait around for an hour when we missed their What's App call because we don't have internet access, even tho we had a local mobile number and had asked them to ring that number when they were ready.
The house is quite compact, probably around (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) sq ft. As a stop over or if you plan to eat out all the time it would be adequate, the kitchen is ok to cook a couple bowls of noodles but I definitely wouldn't recommend cooking a 3 course meal or frying an English breakfast. For the purpose of my trip this time, it's more than enough.
It's close to Tai Wai MTR station, about 7-10 mins walk, from there it's pretty much anywhere is reachable quickly and effortlessly. Again for the purpose of this trip which we had to travel to Tai Po daily, it both convenient and value for money.

The house "C'EST LA VIE" is not the accommodation what I was looking forward.I would say that It is a bit lighter and wider in the pictures,so I was really disappointed while I entered in the house...

The smell was not right like musty and humid smell in the house,no hot water after five minutes shower and a bit dust on the floor looked like the cleaner did not work harder in their job.That's why I gently complained to them by phone straight way while I got chance to phone them.

Anyway,to see the good point of "C'EST LA VIE",I have to say that it is extremely beautiful to take pictures around,and you would be amazed by the little details of the house.We really appreciate the decorated of the (Website hidden by Airbnb) just felt like in a part of the fairy tale scene.If you do not care so much of the smell,you would love this house and have great fun in it I am pretty sure.

For us,it just couldn't make up for that smell sorry about that.The smell made us awake and sleep uncomfortably. :(

At the beginning,I wasn't expect that much generous of them while I told them how terribly I felt about the house.They were really good listeners and tried to reorganize us to a better accommodation the next day since there were no any house available for the first night.

That house is closed by Mongkok which is "Garden by the bay"(you could easily search it on their page)That one is spotless incredible with everything you needed and kitchen is seperated from the house beside the balcony which makes the air so much fresh while cooking.The house is well decorated and clean perfectly.That's just my dream house with very good sense.Nothing and no one can complain about it I believe!

They are also super accommodating and patient to us.They gave us many restaurants options and did not mind we put our luggage a bit longer after check-out which really help us go some shopping place more convenience during our last day.They moved our luggage to the new accommodation since I planed to spend whole day long in Macau until very late.They waited for us in Mongkok and made sure we have key to check-in.They did a lot of effort to make our trip way much easier.Thank you everyone sincerely! 

Overall,it was really good deal and great communication with the hosts.They would never throw their responsibilities to anyone else but themselves. They are always reliable,quick respond,and easy to negotiate if needed.

If you are looking for someone better than them to be your host in HK, please save your energy. They are just the best of the bests. :) I would stay again and introduce my friends whoever wants to have fun in HK. :D
房东很热情
very nice and comfortable

挺好的,在HK念书一年,对房价与房间大小都有很好的心理准备了｡恋恋法舍是一个大房一个小房｡大房是1M5的床,有床头柜｡小房则是完整的一张1米2的榻榻米,开门就是没有空隙,一开始以为榻榻米也有1M5的,这个是我自己没有看清楚｡房间整体很干净,厕所和浴室很大,比榻榻米房还大,热水充足,非常舒适｡唯一不尽人意的是榻榻米房间的霉味有点重,香港天气潮湿有霉味是正常的,不过也还是希望房东能处理一下｡另外,宅一起的服务团队都非常nice,问题回复也很及时,非常感谢!
A stylish apartment. There is room for improvement in the odor of the room.
我们住进去最大的感受就是,和照片差太远了吧!照片里拍的明亮干净宽敞,实际进去很小有点暗,小房子里有那种异味,但呆久了就没感觉了｡位置倒是可以,出门就有公交车站,反正也就住两天考试用的,这个价格就这样咯｡
It's in a quiet neighborhood with easy access to the MTR station nearby. The apartment is comfortable and the host was friendly.  We had a good time here :}
房子好小 好暗 小房间味道好大 早上7点就吵得不得了 隔音差
了解卫生干净程度｡
房东团队很热情,态度也不错,只是房间跟照片还差得蛮多的
The host canceled this reservation 4 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

name: Spacious appartment in HOMA
summary: Situé à 2 minutes à pieds d'un métro et à 10 minutes en transport en commun du centre-ville. Le quartier comporte plusieurs bars, restos, épiceries, SAQ, café. À quelques minutes du stade olympique et du vieux-port. Quartier accueillant.
description: Situé à 2 minutes à pieds d'un métro et à 10 minutes en transport en commun du centre-ville. Le quartier comporte plusieurs bars, restos, épiceries, SAQ, café. À quelques minutes du stade olympique et du vieux-port. Quartier accueillant.

name: Bunk bed for Four (A)
summary: A simple room for backpacker who may like to stay short term in an economic way. You may need to share with 3 roommates in a dorm-typed room.
description: A simple room for backpacker who may like to stay short term in an economic way. You may need to share with 3 roommates in a dorm-typed room.
house_rules: If you have child or infant coming along, please make sure child is not running around, screaming or crying to disturb neighbour Anything that you need, please ask to provide. Don't get by yourselves and/or keep in room Anything that borrowed or used must return to original place

host.host_location: 3/F A6 Pak On Building 105 Austin Road Jordan Kowloon Hong Kong
host.host_about:
We have 3 rooms equipped with 3 bunk beds for single back packer. They are clean and secure. 
We are located in Jordan - the Heart of Hong Kong. Our place is absolutely easy and convenient.
You can take airport bus A21 directly to the back of our building or take railway and transfer by free shuttle bus K1 that stops exactly in front of our main door. We are 100% accessible to all tourist spots in HK as well. Very convenient!
Of course, you may do some research how to enjoy being in Hong Kong. I may suggest few really amazing place that you should not miss! For sure, you must like it! I love to talk and share whatever I know. So long as you have time and really to sit down with me, we may exchange our cultures and experiences. Why? It is simply because I love travelling as well.
Come and feel what s home and friendly place we are!

reviews.comments:
Ken is the best host I've come across on airbnb. He bent over backwards to help us out and make sure we was settled in, even helped carrying out heavy bags. He couldn't of done more in my opinion. 

Highly recommend kens place for a basic place to rest. It's right in the centre of Kowloon and in a great location to walk most places

Mr.Ken is nice host, the location is also good. You can walk to almost mall, shopping center at tsim sha sui, mongkok from Ken's House.
Recommended for backpacker, tourist that need some place that clean, cozy to rest.
自由行非常棒的選擇!
很适合短途旅行者暂住

name: Haleiwa Town: Hale Muliwai
summary: We extend the hospitality of our guest cottage situated on the Anahulu Stream, a mere 200 yards to where the river meets the sea. In walking distance to historic Haleiwa Town.  A tranquil 2 bd/1ba retreat. Immaculate new construction built with TLC.
space: Our cottage is situated 8' off the ground due to building codes. There is one uncovered parking space adjacent to the stairs and outdoor shower. This height sets the house well into the Monkey Pod tree canopy. There is a rumor that the trees might have been planted by hawaiian royalty and may well be over 100 years old. The master bedroom has one CalKing bed, a large closet and two custom built dressers. The second bedroom has two twin beds.  An open, covered lanai allows for curling up with a book on the punee (Hawaiian daybed).
description: We extend the hospitality of our guest cottage situated on the Anahulu Stream, a mere 200 yards to where the river meets the sea. In walking distance to historic Haleiwa Town.  A tranquil 2 bd/1ba retreat. Immaculate new construction built with TLC. Our cottage is situated 8' off the ground due to building codes. There is one uncovered parking space adjacent to the stairs and outdoor shower. This height sets the house well into the Monkey Pod tree canopy. There is a rumor that the trees might have been planted by hawaiian royalty and may well be over 100 years old. The master bedroom has one CalKing bed, a large closet and two custom built dressers. The second bedroom has two twin beds.  An open, covered lanai allows for curling up with a book on the punee (Hawaiian daybed). Entire cottage, access to lower lawn, dock for river access if appropriate. We are builders/developers and built the cottage from scratch with tender loving care, using recycled building materials and expert attent
neighborhood_overview: The cottage is situated in a quiet neighborhood where we all look out for one another. Just across the street, is the Loko'ea Fish pond dating from the 17th century, now being restored by Kamehameha Trust. The Anahulu stream is one of O'ahu's longest, flowing 20 miles from the Ko'olau Mountains to the sea. "Anahulu" means 10 days, possibly the time it took ancient Hawaiians to travel it's length. This is a rural area within one of the most popular tourist destinations on Oahu.
notes: Early morning and afternoon commuter traffic can be heard. The house is heavily insulated, therfore it's quiet inside the dwelling.  Trash pick-up occurs Tuesday and Friday around 5:00 am. The 14.41% Transient and GE taxes are not included in the room rate. Owner will invoice guest via Airbnb/Special Request the amount before check-in.
transit: At the junction of Loko'ea (our street) and Kamehmeha Hwy. is a bus stop. Visitors can ride around the island for $2.50 from this location. Renting a car at the airport allows an easy 40 minute access (depending on traffic) to the property. Once here, you can abandon the car and walk thru the boat harbor to Ali'i Beach Park, great restaurants and retail shops in historic Haleiwa town. Just across the street at Surf and Sea you can rent kayaks, stand up paddle boards and bicycles.
access: Entire cottage, access to lower lawn, dock for river access if appropriate.
interaction: We are builders/developers and built the cottage from scratch with tender loving care, using recycled building materials and expert attention to interior finishes. We live on the property and are often in Honolulu several nights a week. We are available by phone or text should our guests have any questions or concerns.
house_rules: The rate does not include the 14.41% tourist tax. I will send notice of that amount prior to arrival thru Airbnb.  We would greatly appreciate the following:  PLEASE utilize the outdoor shower at the bottom of the stairs to wash off ALL sand and dirt before entering the cottage. If there is an excess of sand in the unit at the time of cleaning, there will be an additional $50.00 fee charged thru Airbnb. There is a portable drying rack in the cottage.  Please leave shoes at the door which is an old Hawaiian tradition. Indoor slippers/shoes are acceptable. We restored an old kitchen farm sink thus gave up the convenience of a dishwasher. Please use the cutting boards provided for chopping or try out the many great restaurants and food trucks and liberate yourselves from cooking!  Please wash all dishes and cookware before departure. We have excellent tap water. Also, there is a filter water pitcher in the refrigerator. We ask that guests attempt to minimize the use of plastic bottles whi

host.host_about: I was born and raised here in Hawaii, on the islands of Oahu and Kaua'i. My family has been in the islands since 1870's when my great grandfather emigrated from Norway to Kaua'i. My husband and I are involved in real estate development in Honolulu. When here in Haleiwa, we love to walk, swim long distance and practice Iyengar yoga.

reviews.comments: My wife and I had a wonderful stay at Morgan's newly renovated loft in Halewia. There was plenty of room, cozy and comfortable lounging living room, and a full sized kitchen with an open concept. We woke up to the birds announcing morning was here, and very minimal traffic sounds. The beach is just down the road. This was the perfect little town in Oahu. Tons of good eats! We had a marvelous stay, and Morgan and George were so accommodating, so kind. I highly recommend her place to stay for your visit. It's helpful to have a car if you plan on adventuring outside of the area. The Parking spot was a little tight, but not an issue.

Picture perfect family stay: Beautiful, stylish and peaceful accommodation on private street with peacocks wandering in the garden, and just 2 minutes walk to the bustling, surfing village Haleiwa with great places to eat (Japanese, Mexican, Italian, local), shop, peruse local artwork or buy/hire surf gear. The property is directly on a river popular for stand-up paddling, and a short walk to numerous beautiful beaches, where you can swim, surf or snorkel. In the evenings you can sit on the dock out the back and watch the turtles swim up the river. The property itself is clean, spacious, exactly as described on the site and beautifully decorated with local artwork, and would suit either a couple or family. For nature lovers there is wildlife a plenty in the vicinity. The owners Morgan & George who live next door are very sweet and welcoming, with helpful ideas for things to do on our stay. We had a wonderful time at Hale Muliwai and would certainly return.  

Places to visit nearby: Banzai Pipeline, 15 mn drive to see surfers take on the big waves or go snorkelling in the nearby rock pool at Shark Cove. Kaena Point, 20 mn drive plus 1 hr flat walk each way (or you can drive with an off-roader) to western-most point of Oahu with Albatross colony, monk seals and whale-watching. Polynesian Cultural Centre, 30 mn drive, expensive day-out but it is a great place to visit if you have children and worth the cost if you go to the dinner and show.

Our host's made us feel very much at home. They where nice to talk to and were helpful with any questions we had about Oahu. The home was beautiful, very clean and well taken care of. The view out of the back lanai was amazing. Very peaceful with a lovely yard and river view. 
Our family really liked the neighborhood. It is on a nice quite street where you can live like the local's, away from the tourist's. Walking distance (one block) to the town, restaurants and beach.

Hale Muliwai is a gem!  It is ideally located- a short walk into Haleiwa (never worry about traffic or parking!), and a short drive to everything fabulous on the North Shore. The best part- the home is tucked away on a quiet stream, so you truly get a sense of being away.

The home itself is more like a high-end hotel- beautiful furniture, linens, finishes, and a fully-stocked kitchen.  It was a treat to return to after long days out and about, immaculate but still comfortable.

Morgan and George are terrific hosts.  A basket with fresh fruit, coffee, and nuts awaited on our arrival and they were available by phone and in person for questions.  It is clear they put a lot of time and thought into making a great property and providing a memorable experience for their guests. They are long-time locals, so they had great recommendations for things to do (and things to avoid!).  

I truly hope to stay at Hale Muliwai again.

Morgan and George are lovely. The location is absolutely perfect for exploring Haleiwa and the North Shore. You can walk almost anywhere in Haleiwa. Tons of restaurants, shopping, food trucks, shave ice, surf shops. 
Hale Muliwai is adorable. Morgan has decorated it beautifully and it is very comfortable. It's also the most well-stocked airbnb I've ever stayed at. Plenty of dishes, pots, pans, linens, cutlery, implements, reading material, games, beach chairs, towels, and more!
There were two of us and we had plenty of space. It was the perfect size for us!
It is a second floor unit so if you have little children or people with mobility issues, take that into account.

Truly a piece of paradise! This vacation rental exceeded my expectations. The yard is beautifully landscaped providing a peaceful oasis to relax in.  There is access to a gentle flowing river that leads to the ocean and there are a couple of paddle boards for your use. The rental itself was tastefully decorated and as mentioned in other reviews, the kitchen was supplied with so many extra things that just add to your visit. Morgan was a perfect host, always available to contact but still felt like we were left alone. 
I don't think there is a better location in all of Haleiwa! We could walk everywhere, the beach, shopping and to so many restaurants. This was great when traveling with a multi age family, everyone felt like they had some freedom to go where they wanted on their own. 
When we return to Haleiwa, we would love to stay here again.

When we arrived at Hale Muliwai, we were greeted by the host (George).  Upon arrival, there were goodies and snacks to make us feel welcome in the home (very appreciated after our day of travel!).  The home itself couldn't have been more beautiful and well-designed for a family of 4.  Truly, the house itself was like a high-end boutique rental (but better!) and it was even more gorgeous than the photos suggest!  We loved the lanai, with dining space, grill, lounge seating (I napped there often!), and amazing view of a well-maintained and landscaped yard and lazy river.  Our kids enjoyed access to the yard and docks on the river.  We cooked most of our dinners at home, and the kitchen was perfectly stocked with all the cookware and basics (oil, spices, etc.) we could need.  The home even had beach towels, beach chairs, boogie boards, and sand toys for our use! The location in Haleiwa was ideal--close to beaches, eating and shopping, yet tucked away on a small residential street.

The hosts, Morgan and George, were phenomenal.  They were welcoming and accommodating, even checking in during our stay to see if there was anything we needed.  George took us on a tour of the river in the boat and offered their kayak, paddleboards, and fishing gear.  While it was clear they were there to help or chat if we ran into each other on the property, we had full privacy and autonomy in the cottage.  Even aside from our "professional interactions", Morgan and George were just great people and a lot of fun to talk to!  

For us, Haleiwa is the best place to vacation on Oahu and Hale Muliwai is hands-down the best place to stay while there.  We will be back!

We stayed at Morgan's place for 7 days and overall it was a fantastic experience. Morgan was a great host providing great advice and also the use of her kayak and stand up paddle board for use on the river, which was bliss. The house was beautifully furnished, with very comfortable beds, fully equipped kitchen, and a relaxing atmosphere. It was lovely. The only downside was the traffic noise, if you are sensitive to that. The house was located within a short walk to town and to beaches as well. And it was great for kids as our toddler had a fantastic time looking out at the garden and spotting the wildlife! Overall, we had a wonderful experience.

The 2nd stop on our 3 week tour of Hawaii and again another great spot!

The location is perfect for exploring the North Shore and those lovely beaches! A particular favourite was Shark Coves where we got to snorkel with 1000's of beautiful coloured fishes and turtles! Haleiwa has a great choice of restaurants too, I think every possible cuisine is counted for! And not to forget all the delicious shrimp trucks we found along the coast!

The unit was a haven of relaxation set in amongst the tree canopies. It was peaceful, clean, tidy and had everything we needed for our stay whether we wanted to eat in, BBQ on the veranda, paddle board on the river at the end of the garden, toiletry supplies, guidebooks, Netflix's and more!

So if you are looking to get away from the tourist trap of the south Haleiwa is a great spot!

Thanks Morgan and George for a great stay!

I had such an amazing time, the space was more than I expected, i previously lived in Hawaii so staying at Morgan's felt like coming back home, watching the sea turtles swim up the river every night was beautiful, and the neighbors were so kind. Highly recommend this place !

Morgan was wonderful. We travelled from Australia, arriving early in the morning, and Morgan emailed to provide us early access to the property. She was also incredibly responsive to emails leading up to the trip. 
The property itself is fantastic and in a great location. It was truly a little slice of paradise and serenity but within walking distance to the beach, restaurants and shops. We made use of the kayak and paddle board Morgan kindly provided and spent most evenings on the lanai overlooking the river. Wonderful property and host!
We had a great stay. Morgan and George were fabulous, and their place was very peaceful. Our kids loved using their kayak and SUP on the river.

My three friends and I had a wonderful stay, and everything was perfect! 

The home and Haleiwa in general was exactly what we were after - away from the hustle and bustle of the city, but right near local shops and beaches. The backyard fronting on to the creek was serene, and we enjoyed the view (at one point in the company of the neighbour's dog)

Morgan and George were great hosts, and had prepared for everything we needed. We unfortunately experienced a medical emergency during our trip, and Morgan went out of her way to check in multiple times offering help and to make sure we were OK. Our appreciation for Morgan and George's support is deeply felt.

Whilst we weren't able to take up on their offer to be shown how to use the kayak and SUP this time, it gives us more reason to come back and stay there again!

We cannot recommend this place enough, and only fear that it won't be available when we return!

Thank you again Morgan and George!

Morgan was prompt in answering all my queries before arrival. We arrived late at night, but had been provided excellent directions, and cell phone numbers in case we needed them. The cottage lights were on, and Morgan had graciously provided a beautiful fruit plate, banana bread, tea, coffee and milk, so we would have something for breakfast. There was so much about the cottage that we loved: the walkable proximity to town and beach; the very private and beautiful jungle-like setting; the situation on the river and the easy access to the paddle board and kayak; the birdlife and bird sound including the flock of peacocks; the cottage size and décor and the wonderfully comfortable veranda. Morgan and George were perfect hosts. We felt completely on our own, but they were there when needed, and we very much enjoyed our passing interactions.

We had an amazing stay here! We loved the house and amenities that came with it, looked just like the pictures. We got to try stand up paddling for the first time and loved it! Loved the location, walking distance to town. We'll definitely be back!
The host canceled this reservation 10 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Fabulous location, neat and tidy apartment/maisonette. Wonderful, helpful hosts who went above and beyond during our stay. Excellent communication and friendly advice about the local area and things to do. Highly recommended.

This place is amazing. Location is perfect -- home is on private road but walking distance to everything you'll want to do in Haleiwa. Construction is new, furnishings are high end and kitchen is fully equipped. Property backs up to lovely stream that offers peaceful views from private lanai. On top of all that, the hosts were amazing to us and went way above and beyond with special hospitality. Highly recommend!

This place is amazing! We had a wonderful week here, the cottage is fully equipped and well beyond our expectations. Furthermore, Morgan and George made everything to make our stay even better. Can't wait to get back there again. Highly recommend.

Morgan and George made us feel incredibly welcome upon arrival on Christmas Day and Morgan added nice touches to our units such as holiday decorations and a welcome postcard with treats basket. The location is PERFECT, walking distance to town, beaches, food trucks and is overall an incredible "country" getaway for North Shore Ohau. Our son loved access to the house yard and deck in addition to chasing peacocks while strolling to town. The house is fully stocked with everything you'd need for a perfect beach day --chairs, towels, bags, toys, boogie boards. Thanks Morgan and George for making our Christmas stay so easy and fun! Best, Johnson Family SF CA

We stayed at "Hale Muliwai" (House at the River's Mouth) for an entire month, and couldn't have found a better spot to stay! Before our arrival, Morgan checked with us to make sure we would have everything we needed for a month long stay. To say that the home and grounds are beautiful is an understatement. Interior finishes and furnishings are high quality and beautifully designed, with an eclectic mix of new and refurbished finishes. We loved the large old farmhouse sink and didn't care that there was no dishwasher, as it was so pleasant to work at the sink. The custom reclaimed redwood cabinetry in the bath and master is stunning, as are the kitchen cabinets. Appliances were all in excellent condition and the BBQ on the lanai was used nearly every day. Everything we needed was at hand, including beach chairs, shopping bags, towels, books, TV, washer/drier etc. In short, we felt like we were home while staying here. The view of the river from the deck was exquisite and the daily visits from the peacocks were a wonderful sight. Highlights for us were the ability to walk to several beaches and into town (we didn't even take our car out for the first 2 weeks), paddling with the turtles on the river and bay, napping in the afternoon sun on the lanai daybed and exploring some of the off the beaten path places that Morgan and George told us about. We couldn't imagine better hosts or nicer people to stay with than Morgan and George, and can't wait to see them again!

We had a perfect stay. Everything was as described or even better. The house comes equipped with all you need and then some. The location is ideal. You can walk to everything! We enjoyed standup-paddling so much! And the river is right there and you get to the ocean in no time, paddling downstream! Morgan always made extra sure we are well taken care of and we totally were. We highly recommend this place! The resident pheasants sometimes made their typical noises, but we love this.
Perfect spot. Zero complaints. 100% A+

The place is gorgeous and very peaceful. We stayed in Waikiki for the first 2 nights and then moved to the North Shore for the rest of our trip. I am so glad we did because it was a completely different experience than the downtown area. It felt very authentic. Morgan was extremely helpful and accommodating. She walked us through the house and the amenities upon our arrival. The place has pretty much everything you would need, she even had a pack n play and a highchair which was a life saver for us since we were traveling with our 1 year old baby. The place is like in the pictures, super nice, but what you don't get to see in the pictures is the relaxing vibe and how serene it is. The view is incredible and the area is very nice and walkable. It offers a bbq, a beautiful kitchen, towels and beach supplies, 3 comfortable beds, kitchen utensils and condiments, cooking tools, coffee maker, parking, wifi, basic cable and a smart tv, which allows you to login into your netflix account. I am sure I am missing some but I wanted to list the things I could remember for those who may be wondering. Overall our stay was as great as it could be and we will definitely stay at Morgan's place when we come back to Hawaii.
The host canceled this reservation 80 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

My wife and I stayed at Morgan and George's house for our first wedding anniversary and our experience couldn't have been better.  As stated in the description, the house is immaculately kept.  We were in town for only 6 short days and dined out for dinner every night, so I was disappointed we weren't able to take advantage of the wonderful amenities of the kitchen and grill on the lanai.  Morgan and George's house is extremely well stocked from the utensils and tools in the kitchen, to the huge supply of towels and toiletries in the beautiful bathroom, to linens, dresser and closet space in the bedrooms.  The house is immaculately designed with numerous screened windows and ceiling fans to keep the house airy and cool.  The cal king bed in the master bedroom gave me the best sleep I've had in weeks.  The living room couches are super comfy and the TV has basic cable in addition to Netflix and Amazon for streaming.  We had breakfast every morning on the lanai over looking an incredible backyard leading to the river, it was paradise for a pair of city slickers.  Since we spent most of our time on the beach, we took advantage of using the beach towels, bags, folding chairs and umbrellas, and boogie boards downstairs.  The location is within walking distance to the food trucks, two grocery stores, and just a short drive to numerous beaches.  Morgan was in constant contact with me throughout our stay checking in to see if there was anything I needed.  Morgan and George were ideal hosts and I knew I could get a hold of them right away if I needed anything.  My wife and I can't imagine staying anywhere else other than Morgan's when we return.  Thanks again for the wonderful trip.
Nice place

Morgan was a fabulous host. Her and her husband made sure we had everything we needed and more. I can't tell you enough about how far and away they went to provide for our team while we stayed with them. They made sure to be responsive, when we arrived late in the evening and were ready to great us early in the morning before we went out. The listing looks even better than the photos, and I would recommend everyone who stays here to paddle up the river even if i wasn't brave enough to do so myself. Great Stay!!!!

The home was perfect. My family wouldn't have wanted to stay anywhere else. Morgan and George were so welcoming and provided us with everything we needed. The home made our stay so much more enjoyable to know after a long day we could come home to our temp home and just relax and enjoy.

Hale Muliwai was a wonderful place to finish up our holiday. Although Morgan was away, she ensured that we were looked after and the house was left ready for us. It is clean and comfortable and I loved sitting on the wharf counting the turtles each morning. We enjoyed having a full kitchen, comfortable bedding and space. The house is decorated with care and is clean and tidy. Our days on the Nth Shore were spent at the beach, snorkelling at Sharks Cove, walking to the shops in Hale'iwa and kayaking up river. 
Thank you Morgan for allowing us to stay in your lovely home.
Hopefully next time we will get to meet you.

For anybody looking for one of the most beautiful Airbnb locations in the world, look no further! This is true paradise, with some of the most spectacular views of nature surrounding you! Situated on a calm tropical river perfect for paddle boarders and viewing giant sea turtles. Great hospitality and very affordable! I will definitely be going back very soon!
Great place right on the Haleiwa river.  We had lived there before and enjoyed being so close to our favorite places.  Close walk to beaches and downtown.  We truly enjoyed ourselves!

Morgan's place on the North shore was more than we expected.
It was near to the shops and transport and the beaches you hear about.
The unit was clean and tidy and we had everything we could need.
Morgan's hospitality was outstanding and we could not have asked for a better host.
Thank you for everything Morgan and George

Morgan's place is a hidden oasis in the North Shore. The location is perfect... far enough from the busy streets of Haleiwa if you want some peace and quiet and close enough if you want easy access to restaurants, market, stores, beach, etc. 

The place itself is beautiful. Very clean and amazing decor. Combination of modern and Hawaiian country feel. The backyard is very peaceful and has access to the river which connects with the ocean. 

Great place for a small group as there is plenty of space. 

Mahalo Morgan!!!!!
This is a lovely spacious place, on a quiet street an easy walk to Haleiwa town. Generally very quiet, with occasional wildlife sounds. Morgan and her family were gracious and helpful.
I usually rent places through Airbnb for my trips, and I can say that was the best experience I had. Morgan and George are extremely nice and their guest house is great! I highly recommend them!!!
Magnifique site enchanteur près de tout. Le logement est moderne et très propre. Les hôtes sont accueillants, disponible mais aussi respectueux de notre intimité.

It was a beautiful, clean place. The yard was so nice had peacocks very morning to wait up to and watch while having out coffee on the patio.
It was in a great location you could walk to restaurants and shopping.

Morgan's place perfect, the beds are comfortable, all the windows and the lanai door are screened and the appliances work perfectly (it was the first time we loved an electric stove-turbo heat!). Morgan is very open to your suggestion of what you need. There's a DVD player and Netflix and other streaming on a big TV with a comfortable viewing area. The Barbeque was  a dream come true. It worked with no trouble and didn't burn anything unless we left it on too long. The most amazing thing to the 4 of us was the amenities: Plenty of soap, shampoo, tissues and good books too. You could move in here for a month or more and feel right at home. The washer is under the house, but the dryer is in the closet in the house and there is a useful drying rack on the lanai with a table, chairs a love seat and a day bed and still lots of space! Very relaxing. The Original Art was beautiful, the "coffee table books" gave us the impression that these people know art and then the paintings proved it. The decor was nicely blended and the materials used: floor to ceiling made us feel like the people who made this place, were really special too. Be sure to ask about the Turtles!
Also, the location was very central, with no problem parking.
over incredible. highly recommended

Perfect home base for the whole island. We went all over the place from this location utilizing our car. The town within walking distance is perfect. So many spots to go for eating and activities.the neighborhood and Morgan are perfect in every way. Do yourself a favor and plan your trip with this spot as the anchor.

Thank you Morgan and George, Your place along the river is perfect. Loved going to sleep with warm breezes and the sound of birds.  Everything in the place is so well stocked (lots of towels, zip locks, paper towels, cooking supplies, etc.) And the location walking distance to Haleiwa and close to all North Shore activities can't be beat. Your knowledge of the area and responsiveness when I asked a question was amazing! Thank you. We will be back!
Great location. Walking distance to everywhere. Very good place to relax and unwind. We really enjoyed our stay.

Morgan’s place was spacious, clean, and provided everything we needed to make it feel like a home away from home! 

It was quiet and felt secluded even though it was within a quick walking distance of everything you could need in Haleiwa town. 

The backyard was beautiful and overlooked the river, and my kids especially loved seeing the wild peacocks roaming around and waking up to the sounds of the birds chirping in the morning. 

We couldn’t have asked for anything more!

Very nice! Morgan was a great host - let us know that she was available if we had any questions and very prompt and helpful responses. The living space was nicely laid out, comfortable and clean. Great location too - walk to surf shops and dining, but hidden away on quiet little slice of paradise.

Morgan’s home was magical and I can’t recommend it highly enough. It was located close to town but we felt miles away looking out at the lush gardens and river backing onto the property. 
There were thoughtful touches throughout with beautiful paintings and books available to read - it is clear that this is a much loved property. 
Thanks again Morgan and George. We’ll be back!

Great place and location for the three of us (husband and teenager).  Excellent base for exploring North Shore beaches and other parts of island.  Quick walk into town for dinner/shopping.  Beautiful view of the lush yard and river from the Lanaie.  More than enough supplies (toiletries,towels,etc) and books/info on area and Oahu.  Great kitchen for cooking!
Loved waking to birds and roosters.  If you are sensitive to noise there is some light traffic during commuting hours - we brought earplugs and it did not bother us. Mahalo!
War einfach ein guter Ausgangspunkt.

Morgan’s house couldn’t have been more perfect. She truly provides a home away from home and has thought of every touch you could possibly need down to nail clippers in an easy to find location! The location is beautiful and tucked away from the hustle and bustle of the city but close to local shopping and a quaint downtown area. There’s a beach, restaurants, and multiple coffee houses within walking distance. Eating dinner on the back porch, overlooking the river, really gives you a perspective on what is important.

We stayed here with our 3 year old and while I’m in my second trimester of pregnancy and it was comfortable and cozy for all involved. The only thing that could make it any better is one window ac unit, but I suspect with the breeze that’s not necessary most of the year (we were here in August). I’d highly recommend Morgan’s place, and Morgan as a host. She was also incredibly accommodating of our late flight time and allowed us to stay late so that our toddler could get a nap in before our overnight flight. You really can’t beat that kind of hospitality. Thanks again, Morgan!

We greatly enjoyed our stay at this “tree house” in Haleiwa. The home is stylish and quiet feeling much like a country cottage.  It’s proximity to Haleiwa allowed us to enjoy all the North shore has to offer while providing for a reasonably close drive to the city for shopping, activities and night life. Morgan and her family were very accommodating and communication was great making us feel at home. I highly recommend this property and look forward to returning in future.
Morgan's place is a nice quite oasis along the North Shore and close to many great places!

Our stay at Morgan and George’s was better than expected, both full of adventures and relaxing! This is a private space, with an extremely convenient walk into town and access to the “stream” (actually the longest on the island) out the back door. Our family of 3 especially loved  early mornings and late afternoons on the back deck and the California King in the master! We used the updated/modern kitchen for most of our meals and of course tropical drink preparation. Raised above the street (with a parking spot underneath) there was light traffic but nothing that kept or woke us up during our week-long stay. 

Most days we ventured out to explore the island before or after our son’s nap and spent the rest of the day in Haleiwa town. Great location, fantastic hospitality from the hosts and a better than expected living/play/cooking space! 

We are hoping to return soon to this little slice of paradise.

We have stayed in a lot of Airbnb homes and this is one of our favorites! Morgan has created the ultimate vacation get away.  Everything was so well though out - from the decor, full equipped kitchen, snacks upon arrival, comfortable beds, quality linens, ceiling fans,etc.  You feel like you are in a home not a rental.  The location is perfect.  Walk into town for dinner, stroll to the beach or jump on a paddle board and hit the river right outside your back door.  Morgan and her husband could not have been nicer or more respectful.  We will definitely be back!!

Morgan's place is nicer than it appears in pictures and is perfectly located for all of your North Shore needs. Close to town and the surf. The space is also quite clean and comfortable. Would recommend to anyone looking to stay there.
Beautiful home and great location!!!

Absolutely Perfect! Just finished a wonderful month at Morgan and George's beautiful place. Private yet a short walk to everything. Close to great beaches, shops and restaurants. The house is spacious and very well equipped. Lovely grounds right on the river. We would definitely return.

We highly recommend Morgan’s cottage. It was so beautiful ~ both inside and out!  Morgan was ready and willing to answer questions anytime. The extra touches were most appreciated....rainy day? No worries because we had ponchos and an umbrella right there. Sunny day? We had sunblock to use!  Soap, shampoo.... anything we might need was there for us. We loved the location. A perfect home base for exploring the island; far from the hustle bustle and traffic of Waikiki.  We had an absolutely amazing week.

reviews.comments: It was great to stay in this place. It was easy communicating with Lina and the neighbors are OK.

Place is very neat, clean and tidy, location is handy to nearby shops and also the motorway, Lina was very flexible & understanding with checkout/check in, very welcoming when we arrived as we were shown the granny flat & given the key, would stay again if in Sydney :)
The host canceled this reservation the day before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Easy experience, helped us out whenever we had a question. Great hosts!

Lina is a very warming host. She was there when we arriving and kindly showing to us the entire place. The house itself is very convenient for a family to stay couple of night. Very clean house! It's located in about an hour from CBD which is provide us with quiet environment. Nice place to stay.
Very clean and well arranged.when we arrived lina's husband was there.he was very helpful.good for families.

There is very clean and quiet.

Sydney! It has everything you need from TV, wifi to kitchen and laundry facilities. It's very clean and new and it has got quite enough space to accommodate 2 to 5 people.

Absolutely new apartment. Very clean, has big living room and a parking space. Lina and her husband Tony were very friendly and always willing to help. Before we leave Tony even gave us a bucket of homegrown tomatoes, which were very delicious!

Host Tony  made us very welcome on arrival   Than inside he had left fresh bread, tomatoes,  butter, cool drinks. Awesome place. We book the apartment on a last minute basis and still we get a friendly welcome and help from the the host and her husband!!!
Place look clean and awesome as well. 10/10 will come again if we r visiting sydney!

We were very well received by Lina and her husband. The house is very clean, very well appointed, and the hosts are very nice and accommodating.
We will come again . Thank you for everything.
The house was really new and very nicely decorated. Everything was there, and the location was convenient for shopping and transportation as well. The host was really informative and helpful.

We had a lovely stay, even though only for one night. Very convenient location for everything we had planned for weekend.  House was very clean, spacious, had everything you could possibly need on a trip away and the kitchen was even stocked with extra supplies which was a real bonus!!  Beds were comfortable too.!
Perfect spot for myself and three young children.  Much better value and atmosphere than any hotel. 
We are regular visitors to Sydney and will definitely book this accommodation again. Thank you
Very convenient accommodation for our trip. Very neat and tidy and well equipped.

It was my first ever experience to get a house through airbnb.com. It was awesome, house was very clean and tidy and the LINA herself she's really a nice lady, she helped me and my son to pick up the luggage to the hose. She's always there for your help. 
Whenever I visit NSW I will definitely go for this house.
Spacious, clean and quiet appartment. Lina, her husband and her son have been very friendly and helpful. Highly recommanded!

It was my first Airbnb experience and an absolute pleasure. Lina was flexible with arival and departure times and respected our privacy with minimal contact. Although she was very kind and I'm sure she would have helped with any requirements.

My first time on (Website hidden by Airbnb) was awesome!
The place was exactly as advertised & Lina was a fantastic host. She gave us a warm welcome & a wonderful send-of.
Very clean, cosy and homely place - it had everything we needed & the price was right too. Thanks Lina...

Great little cottage. Perfect for a family. We stayed with our 2 kids,  (3 & 6yrs )  for one night and had everything we could need.  Located in the host's  back yard on a quiet suburban street.  Surrounded by houses yet was very private. The local shopping centre with Coles just a few km's away.  We were very happy with our 1st Airbnb experience and when we next need accommodation in Sydney will try to book again.
This was a great place to stay. We spent a weekend here with two kids (under 12) so we could make an easy day trip to the Blue Mountains. Clean, private and secure.

The place was even better from what we expected. Nice and big and really clean. Everything you need for a short or a little bit longer stay in Sydney. We really recomend the place and for sure we are going to choose it for our next trip in Sydney. Thank you...

Thank you for giving us such a warm house. Although getting along with two days, we feelt your warm and careful. It was my first Airbnb experience and it is above my expectation. Lina was a great host to us and kept offering help to us. Everything was as per published and the property is quite new and the area is safe and quiet.

Starting with a warm welcome from Lina's son, our overnight stay was perfect. A very quiet street and a delightful home with every mod con at a reasonable price.
Thank you Lina,
Tina

Our experience staying at Lina's Kingswood property was very positive. The newly-built house is well-appointed and true to the online listing. Lina and her family are friendly welcoming hosts who were eager to help make our stay as comfortable as possible. I would readily stay here again in future.
Lina's place was immaculately clean & was 5 minute walk to Nepean Hospital, which was perfect for our purposes. Lina was very helpful & obliging.

Lina and her family were incredibly helpful and friendly. The unit was spotless and all the facilities were excellent. I had my 18 month old daughter with me and it was ideal for our week long visit to Sydney. I would definitely stay here again. Thank you Lina for your hospitality.
The host canceled this reservation 17 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

We used Lina's place as a base for visiting family in the Blue Mountains for Christmas. It was really comfortable for 4 adults and one 10 year old. It was super clean and looked the same as in the photos. There were fabulous restaurants and Aldi just a 5 minute drive away. If you need to stay near Penrith Lina's place is value for money.
Very homely convenient and quite location

We stayed one night only - in at 8:00pm and out again early in the morning.  We had 3  adults and it was ideal for us.  It is a new separate unit behind the owner's house, away from the street.  Everything was easy with the owner.  We enjoyed our stay.
Thanks Lina! Great and convenient place for my staff to stay while on work. Lina is a great communicator and helpful.

Very comfortable home. The best mattress we have had through Airbnb! Great a/c, good kitchen and quality appliances. 
Lina and her family was very friendly. The photos don’t give the apartment justice, it’s actually quite large. Can recommend for short or long stays!
Very hospitable host.  Flat was very clean, bed was comfortable, adequate bedding and towels.  Would definitely stay there again

Lina was an amazing host. She provided excellent communication and everything was super smooth from check in to checkout. She even gave us some cherry tomatoes from her garden. She is a very sweet woman and an amazing host. Highly recommend.
Great stay, great house. Thank you Lina

Normally I find something that is wrong with an air b&b, just because I compare it to home.. This one is excellent. Our double room bed was comfy, our friends in the double decker bunk bed however said it was as if they were sleeping on the floor...
Lina's accomodation is clean and comfortable. Much roomier than you would imagine and modern for the area. Lina is happy to help with advice. Really enjoyed our accomodation.

Great little hidden gem.

Property is much larger than we had thought it would be. Pictures don’t do it justice.

Big thanks to Tony as he opened this property up for us in late November, when we couldn’t seem to find anything close by. 

Will stay again if ever in the area.
Great house , tony was very nice and helpful when needed , would definitely stay there again
This is a granny flat not an entire apartment. The spare bed is a very hard mattress

a great spot in a lovely quiet location ... close to transport, a short drive/bus ride to major shopping centres ... and the hospital (if necessary)

If we need to stay in the area again, we will definitely come back

Would definitely stay again if needed.
This was the perfect place for us. It was our first Airbnb experience and we loved it. A couple of the mattresses are a little hard but everything else was exceptional.   Thanks Lina!

Lina was a fantastic host. She was always prompt with her communications, and went out of her way to facilitate our request for an early check in. Anyone looking for a base when visiting the local hospital, or exploring the Penrith area would appreciate this flat.
It was was good, clean, decent bed and great shower. Didn’t realise it was in her back garden from the description - but it was all fine .
We had a great stay! Lovely place - clean, well equipped, comfy. I can recommend staying here.

Beds were hard , pillows were as flat as pancakes , with no spares . Never once saw the host .

The place was perfect for our family, a good place to stay while visiting nearby family. Lina was great to deal with. We'd come back next time.

Such a lovely family would recommend to anyone.
The place is amazing and quite convenient for us. Great hospitality. Quick to respond. Overall, just great.
Lina's house is really wonderful also very clean and tidy.
A little far to Katoomba (blue mountains) and jenolan cave....

Lina’s place is a cozy granny flat in a nice, quiet location. It fit the four of us comfortably. The bottom bunk mattress was a little hard, but that was only negative. Lina was very helpful and even brought us extra blankets to help with the cold. Would stay again!
Great place close to Nepean Hospital.  Worked out really well for a 6 week stay. Host is very friendly and helpful. Has everything you need for short or longer stay.

Lina’s homestay was perfect for us. 
Central to everything we needed/wanted. The home was exactly what the pictures show. Lina was lovely. Came and went as we pleased. Was very comfortable. We will definitely be stayed My here again.

Lina’s place is easy to access and has all the things you need to look after the family while away. The flat is spacious and clean and communication with Lina is excellent. I will definitely use this space again when I’m in Penrith again.

Steps to Beach & Snorkeling, 4 BR The home is located steps away from spectacular Ke Iki Beach.  2 rooms are located on the second story and the master and an adjacent kids room are located on the first floor.
space: The property is one lot back from the ocean with a private side access gate to the beach path. Fully fenced and surrounded by lush tropical plantings with two outdoor patio areas, the property is a secluded oasis. Two rooms are located on the second story and the master and an adjacent kids room are located on the first floor. The lay out offers families traveling together both private areas to unwind and gathering spots to enjoy each other's company. Ample off street parking inside of the gated property is available.
